analyzed: 'khyams par gyur pa'o // gos tshig gam zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: or have gone missing.

original: dge slong gi gos dag mes tshig par gyur pa'o ;🔽/ gos rlung gis khyer ram zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge slong gi gos dag mes tshig par gyur pa'o ; / gos rlung gis khyer ram zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: “Burnt robes” means that the robes of a bhikṣu have been burnt by fire.

original: dge slong gi gos dag rlung gis khyer bar gyur pa'o //🔽gos chus khyer na zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge slong gi gos dag rlung gis khyer bar gyur pa'o // gos chus khyer na zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: “Blown away by the wind” means that the robes of a bhikṣu have been blown away by the wind.

original: dge slong gi gos dag chus khyer bar gyur na'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi gos dag chus khyer bar gyur na'o //
translated: “Washed away by water” means that the robes of a bhikṣu have been washed away by water.

original: khyim bdag gam zhes bya ba ni skyes ba'o //
analyzed: khyim bdag gam zhes bya ba ni skyes ba'o //
translated: “Householder” means a man.

original: khyim bdag gi chung ma zhes bya ba ni bud med do ;
analyzed: khyim bdag gi chung ma zhes bya ba ni bud med do ;
translated: The wife of a householder is a woman.

original: / nye du ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni phyi mo dang / mes po dang / phrugs kyi bdun pa tshun chad ni nye du yin la de phan chad ni nye du ma yin no //
analyzed: / nye du ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni phyi mo dang / mes po dang / phrugs kyi bdun pa tshun chad ni nye du yin la de phan chad ni nye du ma yin no //
translated: A non-relative is one who is not a relative, that is, one who is not a relative up to seven generations of ancestors and descendants.

original: gan du song la zhes bya ba ni drung du song la'o //
analyzed: gan du song la zhes bya ba ni drung du song la'o //
translated: To go to means to go in the presence of.

original: gos zhes bya ba ni bdun po bal gos dang / sha na'i gos dang / zar ma'i gos dang / ras bal gyi gos dang / du gu la'i gos dang / ko tam pa'i gos dang / nyi 'og gi gos las gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: gos zhes bya ba ni bdun po bal gos dang / sha na'i gos dang / zar ma'i gos dang / ras bal gyi gos dang / du gu la'i gos dang / ko tam pa'i gos dang / nyi 'og gi gos las gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: The cloth is one of the seven types of cloth: wool, silk, cotton, linen, jute, hemp, or a cloth from a western country.

original: bslang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni slong mo bya ba'o //
analyzed: bslang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni slong mo bya ba'o //
translated: To beg means to ask.

original: gal te de la bram ze'am khyim bdag dad pa zhig gis dus kyis gos mang po stobs la zhes bya ba ni 'bul ba'o //
analyzed: gal te de la bram ze'am khyim bdag dad pa zhig gis dus kyis gos mang po stobs la zhes bya ba ni 'bul ba'o //
translated: If a faithful Brahmin or householder gives a lot of cloth at the right time, means to offer.

original: 'dod na zhes bya ba ni don du gnyer na'o //
analyzed: 'dod na zhes bya ba ni don du gnyer na'o //
translated: If one wishes, that is, if one desires.

original: dge slong des de las gos stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa'i mthar thug pa blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: dge slong des de las gos stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa'i mthar thug pa blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa ni gnyis te /
translated: The most he can wear as an upper robe and a lower robe is twofold:

original: dge slong gi stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa dang / khyim pa'i stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa'o//
analyzed: dge slong gi stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa dang / khyim pa'i stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa'o//
translated: the most a monk can wear as an upper robe and a lower robe, and the most a layperson can wear as an upper robe and a lower robe.

original: @237b dge slong gi stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa ni sar pa las snam sbyar nyis rim dang / ras yug phran khru lnga pa dang do pa'o //
analyzed: @237b dge slong gi stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa ni sar pa las snam sbyar nyis rim dang / ras yug phran khru lnga pa dang do pa'o //
translated: The most a monk can wear as an upper robe and a lower robe is a double-layered patched robe made from new cloth, a five-fathom cloth, and a cloth for lining.

original: khyim pa'i stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa ni ras yug chen khru bcu gnyis pa dang / ras yug phran khru bdun pa dang do pa'o //
analyzed: khyim pa'i stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa ni ras yug chen khru bcu gnyis pa dang / ras yug phran khru bdun pa dang do pa'o //
translated: The most a layperson can wear as an upper robe and a lower robe is a twelve-fathom cloth, a seven-fathom cloth, and a cloth for lining.

original: de las lhag par len na zhes bya ba ni de las gong ma'o //
analyzed: de las lhag par len na zhes bya ba ni de las gong ma'o //
translated: If he takes more than that,🔽he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni dngos po de spangs nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba bshags par bya ba ste /
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni dngos po de spangs nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba bshags par bya ba ste /
translated: The monk should relinquish that robe and confess the offense entailing relinquishment.

original: des na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is called a downfall that requires rejection.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is a downfall here?🔽Here, the characteristics of the downfalls, the non-downfalls, the trainings, and the restoration should be understood through the root text and commentary.

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: The downfalls are presented here as the root downfall, the secondary downfalls, and the downfalls that are similar to the secondary downfalls.🔽The root downfall is to accept a robe, etc., from a layperson who is not a relative, when one is a fully ordained monk whose robes have been stolen, destroyed, burned, blown away by the wind, or carried away by water, and when the robe is suitable, not too small, and not too large, and when the layperson is not a relative.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gos phrogs pa dang / rlag pa dang / tshig pa dang / rlung gis khyer ba dang / chu sa khyer ba slong bar rigs pas mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur ba srog dang ldan pa nye du ma yin pa las stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa rung ba tshad las mi chung ba phrugs gcig las lhag par len na slong bar rigs
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gos phrogs pa dang / rlag pa dang / tshig pa dang / rlung gis khyer ba dang / chu sa khyer ba slong bar rigs pas mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur ba srog dang ldan pa nye du ma yin pa las stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa rung ba tshad las mi chung ba phrugs gcig las lhag par len na slong bar rigs
translated: The secondary downfalls are to accept a robe, etc., from a layperson who is not a relative, when one is a fully ordained monk whose robes have been stolen, destroyed, burned, blown away by the wind, or carried away by water, and when the robe is suitable, not too small, and not too large, and when the layperson is not a relative.

original: pa'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the actual basis of the downfall.

original: dge slong la slong bar rigs pa'i spang ba'i ltung byed byung na de ma spangs shing bral bar ma byas na ltung ba ma bshags par ram /🔽spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
analyzed: dge slong la slong bar rigs pa'i spang ba'i ltung byed byung na de ma spangs shing bral bar ma byas na ltung ba ma bshags par ram / spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
translated: If a monk has incurred a downfall that is a proscribed misdeed, if he does not relinquish it and does not separate from it, he will have incurred a downfall if he then receives another set of robes.🔽If he has relinquished it but has not separated from it, he will have incurred a downfall if he then receives another set of robes.

original: spangs shing bral bar byas la ltung ba ma bshags par gos stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa'i mthar thug pa de lta bu gzhan zhig rnyed na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: spangs shing bral bar byas la ltung ba ma bshags par gos stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa'i mthar thug pa de lta bu gzhan zhig rnyed na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
translated: If he has relinquished it and has separated from it but has not confessed the downfall, he will have incurred a downfall if he then receives another set of robes.

original: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: However, if he receives another set of robes, he will not have incurred a downfall.

original: dge slong gis slong bar rigs pa'i spang ba'i ltung byed byung la ji srid du spang ba'i dngos po las ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags par lhung bzed dam /
analyzed: dge slong gis slong bar rigs pa'i spang ba'i ltung byed byung la ji srid du spang ba'i dngos po las ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags par lhung bzed dam /
translated: If a monk has incurred a downfall that is a proscribed misdeed, as long as he has not confessed the downfall and has not relinquished the object that caused it, he will have incurred a downfall if he then receives a begging bowl,

original: chos gos sam /🔽dra ba'am / phor bu'am /
analyzed: chos gos sam / dra ba'am / phor bu'am /
translated: a Dharma robe,🔽a water filter,🔽a water bottle,

original: ska rags sam /
analyzed: ska rags sam /
translated: or a belt.

original: dge sbyong gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad gang yang rung ba gzhan nye bar 'jog na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad gang yang rung ba gzhan nye bar 'jog na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
translated: If he stores any other requisite of a monk, that is also abandoned by the power of the former.

original: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //🔽tshe tshad las lhag pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro // tshe tshad las lhag pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: But he does not commit a downfall.🔽There is no fault if he exceeds the life span.

original: phrugs las lhag pa la na smad pa med do //🔽pha @238a * //
analyzed: phrugs las lhag pa la na smad pa med do // pha @238a * //
translated: There is no fault if he exceeds the value.🔽There is no fault if he exceeds the size.

original: las lhag pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: las lhag pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if he exceeds the size.

original: lhag pa sbyin par bya ba mi sbyin pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: lhag pa sbyin par bya ba mi sbyin pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if he does not give what is left over.

original: rung ba nyid dang / tshad dang ldan pa dang / tshad las lhag pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: rung ba nyid dang / tshad dang ldan pa dang / tshad las lhag pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if he gives what is suitable, if it is the right size, or if it exceeds the right size.

original: 'di'i byed pa po yang snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po yang snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The agent of this downfall is as before.

original: mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur pa srog dang ldan pa nye du ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur pa srog dang ldan pa nye du ma yin pa'o //
translated: He is a human being, a layperson, alive, and not a relative.

original: de la dge slong ji lta bu la ltung ba 'di'i byed pa po yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la dge slong ji lta bu la ltung ba 'di'i byed pa po yin zhe na /
translated: What kind of monk commits this downfall?

original: gos phrogs pa dang / rlag pa dang / tshig pa dang / rlung gis khyer ba dang / chus khyer bar gyur pa slong bar rigs pa la'o //
analyzed: gos phrogs pa dang / rlag pa dang / tshig pa dang / rlung gis khyer ba dang / chus khyer bar gyur pa slong bar rigs pa la'o //
translated: It is proper to request a robe for a monk who has had his robe stolen, lost, burned, blown away, or carried away by water.

original: 'di la yan lag ldas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag ldas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the basis of a downfall is completed by ten factors.

original: dge slong gos phrogs pa dang / rlag pa dang tshig pa dang / rlung gis khyer ba dang / chus khyer bar gyur pa slong bar rigs pa dang / sbyin bdag mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur pa srog dang ldan pa nye du ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: dge slong gos phrogs pa dang / rlag pa dang tshig pa dang / rlung gis khyer ba dang / chus khyer bar gyur pa slong bar rigs pa dang / sbyin bdag mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur pa srog dang ldan pa nye du ma yin pa dang /
translated: A monk who has had his robe stolen, lost, burned, blown away, or carried away by water, requests a robe from a layperson who is not a relative, who is human, alive, and not a paṇḍaka.

original: stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa rung ba tshad dang ldan pa las mi chung ba dang / stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa gcig gi mthar thug pa las lhag pa dang len pa'o //
analyzed: stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa rung ba tshad dang ldan pa las mi chung ba dang / stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa gcig gi mthar thug pa las lhag pa dang len pa'o //
translated: The robe is suitable, the right size, and not less than that. The robe is complete, not less than that.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these factors is not complete, the downfall is a serious transgression, as appropriate.

original: de la dge slong gos phrogs pa la sogs par gyur pa zhes smos pa ni de dag slong bar rigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la dge slong gos phrogs pa la sogs par gyur pa zhes smos pa ni de dag slong bar rigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: The term “a monk whose robes are stolen” and so on is mentioned because it is proper to request those.

original: dge slong gang las chos gos gsum la sogs pa yo byad bcu gsum po byin gyis brlab bar bya ba thams cad dam /
analyzed: dge slong gang las chos gos gsum la sogs pa yo byad bcu gsum po byin gyis brlab bar bya ba thams cad dam /
translated: It is proper to request whatever is missing from the thirteen articles such as the three robes that a monk has consecrated.

original: gang dang gang med pa de slong bar rigs pa nyid de slong bar mi rigs pa slong bar byed na ni slong ba'i spang bar gtogs ba'i ltung bar 'gyur la slong bar rigs pa slong bar byed na ni stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa'i mthar thug pa
analyzed: gang dang gang med pa de slong bar rigs pa nyid de slong bar mi rigs pa slong bar byed na ni slong ba'i spang bar gtogs ba'i ltung bar 'gyur la slong bar rigs pa slong bar byed na ni stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa'i mthar thug pa
translated: If it is improper to request something, then it is a downfall of requesting what is improper. If it is proper to request something, then it is a downfall of requesting more than the maximum of an upper and lower robe.

original: las lhag pa len na slong bar rigs pa'i spang bar gtogs pa'i ltung bar 'gyur te bye brag ni de yod do //
analyzed: las lhag pa len na slong bar rigs pa'i spang bar gtogs pa'i ltung bar 'gyur te bye brag ni de yod do //
translated: If one accepts more than that, it is a downfall of requesting what is proper.

original: sbyin bdag mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur pa srog dang ldan pa nye du ma yin pa zhes smos pa ni de las bzlog pa las nyes byas su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: sbyin bdag mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur pa srog dang ldan pa nye du ma yin pa zhes smos pa ni de las bzlog pa las nyes byas su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: The phrase “the donor is a human being, a layperson, alive, and not a relative” is stated because a misdeed is incurred if the opposite is true.

original: / stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa rung ba tshad dang ldan pa las mi chung ba zhes smos pa ni zhu ba las nye du ma yin pa las chos gos mi rung ba dang / mi chog pa nyid slong na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa rung ba tshad dang ldan pa las mi chung ba zhes smos pa ni zhu ba las nye du ma yin pa las chos gos mi rung ba dang / mi chog pa nyid slong na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “a proper upper robe and lower robe, the right size, not small” is stated because it is said that if one asks a non-relative for a Dharma robe that is not proper or not sufficient, one commits a misdeed.

original: stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa phrugs cig gi @238b mthar thug pa las lhag pa len pa zhes smos pa ni phrugs cig gi mthar thug pa len pa la nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa phrugs cig gi @238b mthar thug pa las lhag pa len pa zhes smos pa ni phrugs cig gi mthar thug pa len pa la nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “to receive more than one set of an upper robe and a lower robe” is stated because there is no fault in receiving one set.

original: stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: An upper robe and a lower robe together are of two types:

original: khyim pa dang / dge slong gi'o //
analyzed: khyim pa dang / dge slong gi'o //
translated: those of a layperson and those of a monk.

original: de gnyis smos pa ni dge slong gos 'chang bar 'dod pa rnam pa gnyis kyi dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de gnyis smos pa ni dge slong gos 'chang bar 'dod pa rnam pa gnyis kyi dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir te /
translated: These two are mentioned because there are two types of monks who wish to wear robes.

original: gos ma dras pa 'chang bar 'dod pa dang / dras pa 'chang bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gos ma dras pa 'chang bar 'dod pa dang / dras pa 'chang bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: One wishes to wear uncut robes, the other wishes to wear cut robes.

original: de la gos ma dras pa 'chang bar 'dod pa ni khyim pa'i stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa slong ngo //
analyzed: de la gos ma dras pa 'chang bar 'dod pa ni khyim pa'i stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa slong ngo //
translated: One who wishes to wear uncut robes begs for a householder's upper and lower robes.

original: gos dras pa 'chang bar 'dod pa ni dge slong gi stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa slong ngo //
analyzed: gos dras pa 'chang bar 'dod pa ni dge slong gi stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa slong ngo //
translated: One who wishes to wear cut robes begs for a monk's upper and lower robes.

original: de la khyim pa'i stod g-yogs che tshad ni ras yug chen srid du khru bcu gnyis dang / zheng du khru gsum pa yin la /
analyzed: de la khyim pa'i stod g-yogs che tshad ni ras yug chen srid du khru bcu gnyis dang / zheng du khru gsum pa yin la /
translated: The maximum size of a householder's upper robe is a cloth 12 cubits long and 3 cubits wide.

original: smad g-yogs che tshad ni ras yug phran srid du khru bdun dang zheng du khru do pa'o //
analyzed: smad g-yogs che tshad ni ras yug phran srid du khru bdun dang zheng du khru do pa'o //
translated: The maximum size of a lower robe is a cloth 7 cubits long and 2 cubits wide.

original: dge slong gi stod g-yogs che tshad ni snam sbyar gyi rim pa ji skad bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi stod g-yogs che tshad ni snam sbyar gyi rim pa ji skad bstan pa'o //
translated: The maximum size of a monk's upper robe is the size of the patched robe as explained.

original: smad g-yogs che tshad ni sham thabs kyi rim pa ji skad bstan pa'o //
analyzed: smad g-yogs che tshad ni sham thabs kyi rim pa ji skad bstan pa'o //
translated: The proper size of the lower robe is the same as the proper size of the outer robe.

original: de la dge slong khyim pa'i stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa slong bas de thob na gal te chung na yang bslang bar mi bya la lhag na yang sbyin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la dge slong khyim pa'i stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa slong bas de thob na gal te chung na yang bslang bar mi bya la lhag na yang sbyin par mi bya'o //
translated: If a monk asks for a householder’s outer robe and lower robe, and then receives them, he should not ask for more if they are small, nor should he give any if they are too large.

original: dge slong gis stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa slong bas de dag thob na ni gal te chung na yang bslang bar bya la lhag na yang sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa slong bas de dag thob na ni gal te chung na yang bslang bar bya la lhag na yang sbyin par bya'o //
translated: If a monk asks for a monk’s outer robe and lower robe, and then receives them, he should ask for more if they are small, and he should give some if they are too large.

original: sbyor ba gcig gis stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa gcig gam gnyis sam /🔽mang po zhig thob na yang ltung ba'i dngos gzhi gcig rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: sbyor ba gcig gis stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa gcig gam gnyis sam / mang po zhig thob na yang ltung ba'i dngos gzhi gcig rnam par gzhag go //
translated: If he receives one or two or many outer robes and lower robes in a single transaction,🔽he commits one offense of wrong conduct.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te ;
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te ;
translated: The offense of wrong conduct is a downfall due to training.

original: ji srid du slong bar rigs pa'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du slong bar rigs pa'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as he has not completed the transaction of asking for what is allowable, he commits an offense of wrong conduct for every effort involved, until he makes contact with the main action.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each of the various preparations that are undertaken, there is a single offense of wrong conduct.

original: mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa dang / khyim par gyur pa dang / srog dang ldan pa dang ; nye du ma yin pa las slong ba la nyes byas so //🔽slong ba'i tshe nyid na nyes byas so //
analyzed: mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa dang / khyim par gyur pa dang / srog dang ldan pa dang ; nye du ma yin pa las slong ba la nyes byas so // slong ba'i tshe nyid na nyes byas so //
translated: If the person belongs to the human realm, is a layperson, is alive, and is not a relative, then there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: mi rung ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: mi rung ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If one asks for something that is not suitable, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: chung du la nyes byas so //🔽khyim bdag dang khyim bdag gi chung ma gnyis ka'am /
analyzed: chung du la nyes byas so // khyim bdag dang khyim bdag gi chung ma gnyis ka'am /
translated: If one asks for something of little value, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gcig ma ning dang / mtshan gnyis pa la nyes byas so //🔽phyi rol pa'i rab tu byung ba @239a * //
analyzed: gcig ma ning dang / mtshan gnyis pa la nyes byas so // phyi rol pa'i rab tu byung ba @239a * //
translated: If one asks a householder or a householder’s wife, or both, or one who is neuter or one who is hermaphroditic, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dang ; ma chags pa dang nyams pa dag la nyes byas so //🔽sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: dang ; ma chags pa dang nyams pa dag la nyes byas so // sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: If one asks an outsider who has gone forth, or one who is free from attachment, or one who has died, there is an offense of wrong conduct.🔽The offense of wrong conduct that is a preparation is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: There are as many preparations as there are preparations for the offense of wrong conduct.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The preparation is a minor offense, and the application of the preparation is also a minor offense.

original: de yang dang po yid la sems pa ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: de yang dang po yid la sems pa ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: Moreover, the first mental intention is the minor offense of the preparation of the preparation.

original: de nas lus dang dag gis sbyor ba ni nyes byas dngos so //
analyzed: de nas lus dang dag gis sbyor ba ni nyes byas dngos so //
translated: Then, the application with body and speech is the actual minor offense.

original: de nas mthar thug pa ni spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhi'o zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mthar thug pa ni spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhi'o zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Then, the final step is the actual offense of a downfall that requires relinquishment.

original: ltung ba med pa ni slong bar rigs pas ma lhag pa len pa la ltung pa med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni slong bar rigs pas ma lhag pa len pa la ltung pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one accepts what is appropriate to beg, and does not go beyond that.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang ; sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang ; sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is a beginner, or insane, or deranged, or in pain.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du slong bar rigs pa'i spang bar 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du slong bar rigs pa'i spang bar 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training is that a monk should train in not using in any way what is to be relinquished, which is appropriate to beg, in any country, at any time.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is as before.

original: slong bar rigs pa'i spang ba ste bdun pa bshad zin to /🔽// / so sor thar pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel pa 'dul ba kun las btus pa /
analyzed: slong bar rigs pa'i spang ba ste bdun pa bshad zin to / // / so sor thar pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel pa 'dul ba kun las btus pa /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the seventh downfall.

original: pham po bcu gnyis pa /
analyzed: pham po bcu gnyis pa /
translated: The twelfth downfall is that of soliciting fine foods.

original: spags ba slong ba'i spang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: spags ba slong ba'i spang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, stayed in Śrāvastī, in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: mnyan yod na khyim bdag cig 'dug pa des rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs te /🔽de de dang lhan cig rtse bar byed /🔽dga' bar byed /
analyzed: mnyan yod na khyim bdag cig 'dug pa des rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs te / de de dang lhan cig rtse bar byed / dga' bar byed /
translated: In Śrāvastī there lived a householder. He took a wife of equal caste.

original: dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
analyzed: dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
translated: He played with her, took pleasure with her, and enjoyed himself with her.

original: khyim bdag de gzhan gyi chung ma la chags par gyur nas /
analyzed: khyim bdag de gzhan gyi chung ma la chags par gyur nas /
translated: The householder became attached to another’s wife.

original: de la chung mas rje'i sras de ltar ma mdzad cig ces phyir bzlog na /
analyzed: de la chung mas rje'i sras de ltar ma mdzad cig ces phyir bzlog na /
translated: When his wife tried to stop him, saying, “Master, do not do this,”

original: ji tsam du de phyir bzlog kyang phyir ma log pa de tsam du de'i chud ma de yang skyes pa gzhan dag dang lhan cig 'khrul pa rtsom par byed do //
analyzed: ji tsam du de phyir bzlog kyang phyir ma log pa de tsam du de'i chud ma de yang skyes pa gzhan dag dang lhan cig 'khrul pa rtsom par byed do //
translated: No matter how much he tried to stop her, she would not stop.

original: khyim bdag de yang bud med gzhan dag la sbyin par byed la /
analyzed: khyim bdag de yang bud med gzhan dag la sbyin par byed la /
translated: The householder gave to other women,

original: chung ma de yang skyes pa gzhan dag la sbyin par byed pas /
analyzed: chung ma de yang skyes pa gzhan dag la sbyin par byed pas /
translated: and his wife gave to other men.

original: de ltar khyim de gnyis ka nas rgud par gyur nas /
analyzed: de ltar khyim de gnyis ka nas rgud par gyur nas /
translated: In this way, the household became impoverished on both sides.

original: de gnyis la bu mo mngag gzhug ma zhig yod nas /
analyzed: de gnyis la bu mo mngag gzhug ma zhig yod nas /
translated: They had a servant girl,

original: khyim bdag des bu mo de la 'dis khyim rgud par byas so zhes khu tshur dang thal lcag dag gis rdeg par byed do //
analyzed: khyim bdag des bu mo de la 'dis khyim rgud par byas so zhes khu tshur dang thal lcag dag gis rdeg par byed do //
translated: and the householder said to her, “She has impoverished the household!” and he beat her with his fists and slaps.

original: bu mo des smras pa /
analyzed: bu mo des smras pa /
translated: The girl said,

original: bdag gis khyim rgud par gyur pa @239b 'di ci las gyur ba 'tshal mod kyi 'on kyang bdag gis ji ltar rje dag la bsngags pa ma lags par brjod par bgyir rung /
analyzed: bdag gis khyim rgud par gyur pa @239b 'di ci las gyur ba 'tshal mod kyi 'on kyang bdag gis ji ltar rje dag la bsngags pa ma lags par brjod par bgyir rung /
translated: “I know what has impoverished the household, but how can I say something that is not praise of my lord?”

original: nye dags de tshor nas khyim bdag de dang khyim bdag gi chung ma de'i gan du song ste /🔽ci nas kyang de nyid skyabs su 'gro ba dang bslab pa'i gzhi dag la gnas par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar tshul khrims kyi bsngags ba brjod cing /🔽tshul khrims 'chal ba'i bsngags pa ma yin pa yang brjod nas /
analyzed: nye dags de tshor nas khyim bdag de dang khyim bdag gi chung ma de'i gan du song ste / ci nas kyang de nyid skyabs su 'gro ba dang bslab pa'i gzhi dag la gnas par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar tshul khrims kyi bsngags ba brjod cing / tshul khrims 'chal ba'i bsngags pa ma yin pa yang brjod nas /
translated: Upagupta heard about this and went to the householder and his wife.

original: des de gnyis skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi dag la gnas par byas so //
analyzed: des de gnyis skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi dag la gnas par byas so //
translated: He praised morality and disparaged immorality so that they would take refuge and observe the fundamental precepts.

original: khyim bdag de gtum pa brtun ngas pa drag shul che ba yin pas yang bu mo de dag la rdeg par brtsams pa dang / chung mas de la smras pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag de gtum pa brtun ngas pa drag shul che ba yin pas yang bu mo de dag la rdeg par brtsams pa dang / chung mas de la smras pa /
translated: The householder was violent, impetuous, and rough. He began to beat his daughters, and his wife said to him,

original: rje'i sras gang gi tshe bdag cag las dang las kyi rnam par smin pa mi mkhyen pa de'i tshe go rdeg par mdzad mod /
analyzed: rje'i sras gang gi tshe bdag cag las dang las kyi rnam par smin pa mi mkhyen pa de'i tshe go rdeg par mdzad mod /
translated: “Lord, when we did not know about karma and its ripening, you beat us.

original: da bdag cag dge pa'i bshes gnyen 'phags pa nye dga' la brten nas las dang las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pas /
analyzed: da bdag cag dge pa'i bshes gnyen 'phags pa nye dga' la brten nas las dang las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pas /
translated: Now, relying on the spiritual friend Ārya Udayi, who knows the ripening of karma and its effects,

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten ni rang gi las kyi 'bras bu la spyod pa lags pas su zhig su'i bran lags /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten ni rang gi las kyi 'bras bu la spyod pa lags pas su zhig su'i bran lags /
translated: it is like this: the world experiences the results of its own karma. So who is the servant of whom?🔽“Do not beat this girl.

original: bu mo 'di la rdeg par ma mdzad cig / bzang mo khyod zer ba ma nyes so //
analyzed: bu mo 'di la rdeg par ma mdzad cig / bzang mo khyod zer ba ma nyes so //
translated: Good woman, what you say is not wrong.🔽Come here, girl. Wash yourself and come back.”

original: bu mo tshur shog / khrus gyis la shog shig / bu mo de khrus byas te 'ongs pa dang / des de la gos phrugs cig bskon nas smras pa /
analyzed: bu mo tshur shog / khrus gyis la shog shig / bu mo de khrus byas te 'ongs pa dang / des de la gos phrugs cig bskon nas smras pa /
translated: When the girl had washed herself and returned, he gave her a set of clothes and said,

original: bu mo dga' zhing las byes shig //
analyzed: bu mo dga' zhing las byes shig //
translated: “Girl, be happy and work.”

original: bu mo des bsams pa /
analyzed: bu mo des bsams pa /
translated: The girl thought,

original: khyim bdag khyo shug 'di sngon gtum ba brtun ngas pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag khyo shug 'di sngon gtum ba brtun ngas pa /
translated: “This householder and his wife were previously fierce,

original: drag shul che ba yin te /🔽yang dang yang du bdag la khu tshur dang thal lcag dag gis rdeg par byed cing /
analyzed: drag shul che ba yin te / yang dang yang du bdag la khu tshur dang thal lcag dag gis rdeg par byed cing /
translated: impatient, and violent.🔽Again and again they beat me with their fists and slaps,

original: zas dang gos ngan pa dag sbyin par byed na /
analyzed: zas dang gos ngan pa dag sbyin par byed na /
translated: and they give me bad food and clothes.

original: da 'di bdag gi pha ma dang 'dra bar gyur to snyam nas yang bsams pa /
analyzed: da 'di bdag gi pha ma dang 'dra bar gyur to snyam nas yang bsams pa /
translated: He thought, Now he is like my father and mother.

original: gang tshun chad nas 'phags pa nye dga'i khyim 'dir 'jug par brtsams pa de tshun chad nas khyim bdag 'di pha ma dang 'dra bar gyur pas bdag gis 'phags pa nye dga' la ci zhig gis dga' bar bya snyam nas /
analyzed: gang tshun chad nas 'phags pa nye dga'i khyim 'dir 'jug par brtsams pa de tshun chad nas khyim bdag 'di pha ma dang 'dra bar gyur pas bdag gis 'phags pa nye dga' la ci zhig gis dga' bar bya snyam nas /
translated: He thought again, Since the time the noble Upasena began to enter this householder's home, since then this householder has become like my father and mother. What can I do to please the noble Upasena?

original: des bsams pa /
analyzed: des bsams pa /
translated: He thought,

original: gal te bdag gis 'di las cung zhig brkus te dbul du ni khyim bdag 'dis bdag rdeg 'tshog mang po byas te sngon gyi gnas su gzhag par 'gyur ro snyam nas /
analyzed: gal te bdag gis 'di las cung zhig brkus te dbul du ni khyim bdag 'dis bdag rdeg 'tshog mang po byas te sngon gyi gnas su gzhag par 'gyur ro snyam nas /
translated: If I steal something from him and give it to him, this householder will beat me a lot and put me back in my former place.

original: de sdod cing 'dug go //
analyzed: de sdod cing 'dug go //
translated: So he stayed put.

original: khyim bdag gi chung ma des khyim bdag de la smras pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag gi chung ma des khyim bdag de la smras pa /
translated: The householder's wife said to the householder,

original: rje'i sras mkhyen par mdzod cig /'phags pa nye dga' ni bdag @240a * //
analyzed: rje'i sras mkhyen par mdzod cig /'phags pa nye dga' ni bdag @240a * //
translated: Master, please understand that the noble Upasena

original: cag gi dge ba'i bshes gnyen lags te /
analyzed: cag gi dge ba'i bshes gnyen lags te /
translated: is our spiritual friend.

original: 'phags pa nye dags bdag cag las kyi mtha' dri ma can dang phral nas skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab ba'i gzhi dag la bkod de /
analyzed: 'phags pa nye dags bdag cag las kyi mtha' dri ma can dang phral nas skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab ba'i gzhi dag la bkod de /
translated: The noble Upasena freed us from the stain of bad karma, and established us in the refuges and the bases of the training.

original: yang dang yang du bdag cag la chos kyis sdud par byed pas /
analyzed: yang dang yang du bdag cag la chos kyis sdud par byed pas /
translated: He has gathered us again and again with the Dharma.

original: bdag cag gis kyang de la zang zing cung zad kyis bsdu bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: bdag cag gis kyang de la zang zing cung zad kyis bsdu bar bgyi'o //
translated: We should gather him with a little gift.

original: bzang mo de bzhin bya'o //
analyzed: bzang mo de bzhin bya'o //
translated: Good woman, let's do it.

original: ci zhig bgyi /
analyzed: ci zhig bgyi /
translated: What should we do?

original: de la ras yug chen cig dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la ras yug chen cig dbul bar bya'o //
translated: We should offer him a large piece of cloth.

original: bu mo des de thos nas bsams pa /
analyzed: bu mo des de thos nas bsams pa /
translated: When the girl heard that, she thought,

original: bdag gis 'phags pa nye dga' la dga' ba de sbran par bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag gis 'phags pa nye dga' la dga' ba de sbran par bya'o snyam mo //
translated: I will frighten him with my love for the noble Upasena.

original: nye dga' yang snga dro sham thabs bgos /
analyzed: nye dga' yang snga dro sham thabs bgos /
translated: Upasena put on his lower robe in the morning

original: lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la zhugs nas mthar gyis bsod snyoms la rgyu ba na khyim der zhugs pa dang / bu mo des khyim legs par byugs shing phyag dar bor nas des nye dga' mthong ba dang / rkang pa gnyis la phyag 'tshal te smras pa /
analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la zhugs nas mthar gyis bsod snyoms la rgyu ba na khyim der zhugs pa dang / bu mo des khyim legs par byugs shing phyag dar bor nas des nye dga' mthong ba dang / rkang pa gnyis la phyag 'tshal te smras pa /
translated: When he entered the house, the girl had cleaned and swept the house well. When she saw Upasena, she bowed at his feet and said,

original: bdag gis 'phags pa nye dga' la dgyes pa sbran par bgyi'o //
analyzed: bdag gis 'phags pa nye dga' la dgyes pa sbran par bgyi'o //
translated: “Noble Upasena, I will inform you of something delightful.”

original: khyim bdag 'di khyod la ras yug chen 'bul bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyim bdag 'di khyod la ras yug chen 'bul bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “This householder will give you a large piece of cloth.”

original: nye dags bsams pa /
analyzed: nye dags bsams pa /
translated: Upasena thought,

original: sa'i steng na 'dod pa'i bdag nyid can gang ji snyed pa de dag dang bdag mnyam par deng bu mo 'dis kyang 'phrigs so snyam nas des bshes te smras pa /
analyzed: sa'i steng na 'dod pa'i bdag nyid can gang ji snyed pa de dag dang bdag mnyam par deng bu mo 'dis kyang 'phrigs so snyam nas des bshes te smras pa /
translated: “Even this girl now thinks I am equal to all those who are lustful on the face of the earth.”

original: bu mo gal te bden bar gyur na ni ngas khyod la gshe ba dag la shugs ma bya'o //
analyzed: bu mo gal te bden bar gyur na ni ngas khyod la gshe ba dag la shugs ma bya'o //
translated: He said, “Girl, if it is true, I will not scold you.

original: ci ste brdzun par gyur na ni rdeg 'tshog mang po byed du bcug ste /
analyzed: ci ste brdzun par gyur na ni rdeg 'tshog mang po byed du bcug ste /
translated: But if it is false, I will have you beaten many times.”

original: sngon gyi gnas ji lta bar gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas ji lta bar gzhag par bya'o //
translated: I will arrange it just as you have described.

original: 'phags pa spyo ba mang du mdzad na bzhud cig dang khyod nyid kyis mkhyen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa spyo ba mang du mdzad na bzhud cig dang khyod nyid kyis mkhyen par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you go to the noble one, you will see for yourself.”

original: de zhugs nas stan bshams pa nyid la 'dug pa dang / khyim bdag chung ma dang bcas pas rkang pa la phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: de zhugs nas stan bshams pa nyid la 'dug pa dang / khyim bdag chung ma dang bcas pas rkang pa la phyag 'tshal te /
translated: When he arrived, he sat down on the seat prepared for him, and the householder and his wife bowed down at his feet.

original: stan ches dma' ba blangs nas chos mnyan pa'i phyir mdun du 'dug go / nye dags smras pa /
analyzed: stan ches dma' ba blangs nas chos mnyan pa'i phyir mdun du 'dug go / nye dags smras pa /
translated: They took very low seats and sat before him to listen to the Dharma. Udayin said,

original: khyim bdag kho bo la ras yug chen sbyin par byas pa gang yin pa de blta'o //
analyzed: khyim bdag kho bo la ras yug chen sbyin par byas pa gang yin pa de blta'o //
translated: “Householder, I will see the great cloth that you have given me.”

original: de gnyis kyis phan tshun gdong du blta bar brtsams te /
analyzed: de gnyis kyis phan tshun gdong du blta bar brtsams te /
translated: The two of them looked at each other’s faces

original: 'di skad ces kyang smras so //
analyzed: 'di skad ces kyang smras so //
translated: and said,

original: 'phags pa bdag cag gis gsangs te smras pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa bdag cag gis gsangs te smras pa /
translated: “Noble one, we spoke in secret.

original: 'phags pa la sus bgyis /
analyzed: 'phags pa la sus bgyis /
translated: Noble one, who did this?”

original: ci 'phags pas gzhan gyi sems kyang mkhyen tam /
analyzed: ci 'phags pas gzhan gyi sems kyang mkhyen tam /
translated: “Noble one, do you also know the minds of others?”

original: nye dags smras pa /
analyzed: nye dags smras pa /
translated: Udayin said,🔽“Householder, I know the minds of others.

original: kho bo lhung bzed du zos shing so lhags pa dang / skra dkar @240b por gyur pa yin na kho bo la de tsam yang mi srid dam /🔽khyim bdag des ras yug chen blangs te nye dga' la phul ba dang / nye dags ras yug chen mthong nas lag pa gnyis 'dril bar byed /
analyzed: kho bo lhung bzed du zos shing so lhags pa dang / skra dkar @240b por gyur pa yin na kho bo la de tsam yang mi srid dam / khyim bdag des ras yug chen blangs te nye dga' la phul ba dang / nye dags ras yug chen mthong nas lag pa gnyis 'dril bar byed /
translated: “I’ve eaten from my begging bowl, my teeth have fallen out, and my hair has turned white. Is it impossible for me to have that much?”

original: bzhin sgyur bar byed do //
analyzed: bzhin sgyur bar byed do //
translated: The householder took the bolt of cloth and offered it to Upasena, who, on seeing the bolt of cloth, rubbed his hands together and changed his facial expression.

original: khyim bdag gis smras pa /🔽'phags pa ci'i slad du phyag gnyis 'dril bar mdzad /
analyzed: khyim bdag gis smras pa / 'phags pa ci'i slad du phyag gnyis 'dril bar mdzad /
translated: The householder said,

original: zhal sgyur bar mdzad /
analyzed: zhal sgyur bar mdzad /
translated: “Noble one, why are you rubbing your hands together and changing your facial expression?”

original: nye dags smras pa /
analyzed: nye dags smras pa /
translated: Upasena said,

original: khyim bdag 'di ni khyod la yongs su btang ba las byung ba'i bsod nams ni yod na /
analyzed: khyim bdag 'di ni khyod la yongs su btang ba las byung ba'i bsod nams ni yod na /
translated: “Householder, you have the merit that comes from giving it away,

original: yongs su longs spyad pa las byung ba'i bsod nams ni med de /
analyzed: yongs su longs spyad pa las byung ba'i bsod nams ni med de /
translated: but you do not have the merit that comes from using it.

original: ras yug chen 'di ni mchil lham phyi ba'am skar khung klan par rung ste /
analyzed: ras yug chen 'di ni mchil lham phyi ba'am skar khung klan par rung ste /
translated: This bolt of cloth is suitable for cleaning shoes or patching windows.

translated: Therefore, the actual basis, preparation, and the preparation for the preparation of this downfall of begging for something valuable, the definition of a downfall, the absence of a downfall, the training, and the characteristics of the amendment should be understood just as they were explained in the context of the downfall of begging.

translated: “ Different” means that it is not the same.

original: de ltar na bye brag 'di yod de /
analyzed: de ltar na bye brag 'di yod de /
translated: Thus, this distinction exists.

original: spags pa ma phul bar shes pa ni spags pa slong ba'i spang ba 'di'i yul yin la /
analyzed: spags pa ma phul bar shes pa ni spags pa slong ba'i spang ba 'di'i yul yin la /
translated: The object of this downfall of asking for cloth is the person who does not know that the cloth has been offered.

original: spags kyang rung ma spags kyang rung mi shes pa ni slong ba'i spang ba sngar bstan pa'i yul yin no //
analyzed: spags kyang rung ma spags kyang rung mi shes pa ni slong ba'i spang ba sngar bstan pa'i yul yin no //
translated: The object of the downfall of asking that was taught previously is the person who does not know whether the cloth has been offered or not.

original: de ltar spags pa slong ba'i spang ba dang / slong ba'i spang ba gnyis kyi mtshan nyid spyir 'dra ba dang / khyad par cung zad yod pa go sla bar bya ba'i phyir dang por bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar spags pa slong ba'i spang ba dang / slong ba'i spang ba gnyis kyi mtshan nyid spyir 'dra ba dang / khyad par cung zad yod pa go sla bar bya ba'i phyir dang por bstan nas /
translated: Thus, the characteristics of the two downfalls—asking for cloth and asking—are similar in general, but there is a slight difference. In order to make this easy to understand, he first taught the downfall of asking.

original: da ni spags pa slong ba'i spang ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid rgya cher bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni spags pa slong ba'i spang ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid rgya cher bstan par bya ste /
translated: Now he will teach the characteristics of the downfall of asking for cloth in detail.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag ba ni dge slong gos phrogs pa dang / rlag pa dang / tshig pa dang / rlung gis khyer ba dang / chus khyar bar ma gyur pa slong bar mi rigs pas mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur pa srog dang ldan pa nye du ma yin pa las gos rung @242b ba tshad dang ldan pa las mi chung ba spags pa ma phul bar shes pa rin thang🔽dang kha dog dang khru tshad las rnam pa gang bslangs pa de nyid thob na spags pa slong ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag ba ni dge slong gos phrogs pa dang / rlag pa dang / tshig pa dang / rlung gis khyer ba dang / chus khyar bar ma gyur pa slong bar mi rigs pas mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur pa srog dang ldan pa nye du ma yin pa las gos rung @242b ba tshad dang ldan pa las mi chung ba spags pa ma phul bar shes pa rin thang dang kha dog dang khru tshad las rnam pa gang bslangs pa de nyid thob na spags pa slong ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if a monk asks a layperson who is not a relative, who is not a friend, and who is not a companion, for cloth that is suitable, of the right measure, and not less than the minimum size, and if he knows that the cloth has not been offered, and if he obtains the very cloth that he asked for, then he has committed the actual downfall of asking for cloth.

original: dge slong la spags pa slong ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed byung na de ma spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
analyzed: dge slong la spags pa slong ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed byung na de ma spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
translated: If a monk commits the downfall of asking for cloth, if he does not give up that cloth, if he does not separate from it, if he does not confess the downfall,

original: spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
analyzed: spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
translated: if he gives it up, if he separates from it, if he does not confess the downfall,

original: spangs shing bral bar byas la ltung ba ma bshags par gos spags pa ma phul bar shes pa rin thang dang kha dog dang khru tshad de lta bu gzhan zhig rnyed na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: spangs shing bral bar byas la ltung ba ma bshags par gos spags pa ma phul bar shes pa rin thang dang kha dog dang khru tshad de lta bu gzhan zhig rnyed na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
translated: If one obtains another robe of a similar type—of a similar value, color, or size—that is also abandoned by the force of the previous rule.

original: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But one does not commit an offense by that.

original: dge slong gis spags pa slong ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed byung la /
analyzed: dge slong gis spags pa slong ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed byung la /
translated: If a monk who has committed the downfall of begging for cloth

original: ji srid du spang ba'i dngos po las ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags par lhung bzed dam /
analyzed: ji srid du spang ba'i dngos po las ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags par lhung bzed dam /
translated: does not confess and relinquish the object that is the basis of the downfall,🔽if he then obtains another alms bowl,

original: chos gos sam /🔽dra ba'am / phor bu'am /
analyzed: chos gos sam / dra ba'am / phor bu'am /
translated: another robe,🔽another water strainer,

original: ska rags sam /
analyzed: ska rags sam /
translated: another knife,🔽or any other requisite of a renunciate,

original: dge sbyong gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad gang yang rung ba gzhan nye bar 'jog na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad gang yang rung ba gzhan nye bar 'jog na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
translated: that is also abandoned by the force of the previous rule.

original: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But one does not commit an offense by that.

original: rin thang dang kha dog dang khru tshad las spags pa ma phul bar shes pa rnam pa gang bslangs pa de lta bu nyid thob pa la na smad pa med do ;🔽/ rin thang dang kha dog dang khru tshad kyi dbye ba ma byas par spags pa ma phul bar shes pa spyir bslangs pa na gang yang rung ba zhig thob pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: rin thang dang kha dog dang khru tshad las spags pa ma phul bar shes pa rnam pa gang bslangs pa de lta bu nyid thob pa la na smad pa med do ; / rin thang dang kha dog dang khru tshad kyi dbye ba ma byas par spags pa ma phul bar shes pa spyir bslangs pa na gang yang rung ba zhig thob pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in receiving any of those that were requested, if they were not offered with a price, color, or size specified.🔽There is no fault in receiving any of those that were requested in general, if they were not offered with a price, color, or size specified.

original: rung ba nyid dang tshad dang ldan pa dang / tshad las lhag pa spags pa ma phul bar shes pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: rung ba nyid dang tshad dang ldan pa dang / tshad las lhag pa spags pa ma phul bar shes pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in receiving any of those that were not offered with a price, color, or size specified.

original: 'di'i byed pa po yang snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po yang snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The agent is as before.

original: mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur pa srog dang ldan pa nye du ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur pa srog dang ldan pa nye du ma yin pa'o //

analyzed: de dge slong ji lta bu la ltung ba 'di'i byed pa po yin zhe na /
