translated: The phrase “a monk who has not had his robes stolen and so on” is stated because it is not proper to request robes from those who have not had their robes stolen and so on.

original: sbyin bdag mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur ba srog dang ldan pa nye du ma yin pa zhes smos pa ni de las bzlog pa la nyes byas su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin bdag mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur ba srog dang ldan pa nye du ma yin pa zhes smos pa ni de las bzlog pa la nyes byas su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “a lay person who is a human being, who is alive, and who is not a relative” is stated because it is a minor offense to request robes from those who are the opposite of those.

original: gos rung ba tshad dang ldan pa las mi chung ba spags pa ma phul bar shes pa zhes smos pa ni zhu ba las nye du ma yin pa las chos gos mi rung ba dang / mi chog ba spags pa ma phul bar shes pa nyid slong na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gos rung ba tshad dang ldan pa las mi chung ba spags pa ma phul bar shes pa zhes smos pa ni zhu ba las nye du ma yin pa las chos gos mi rung ba dang / mi chog ba spags pa ma phul bar shes pa nyid slong na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “who knows that the robes are suitable and not less than the proper size” is stated because it is a minor offense to request robes from a non-relative who is not a monk, or who is not a monk but who is a relative, if the robes are unsuitable or less than the proper size.

original: rin thang dang / kha dog dang / khru tshad las spags pa ma phul bar shes pa rnam pa gang bslangs pa dang / de nyid thob pa zhes smos pa ni gzhan thob pa dang / de nyid ma thob pa la ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //🔽sbyor ba gcig gis gos spags pa gcig gam /
analyzed: rin thang dang / kha dog dang / khru tshad las spags pa ma phul bar shes pa rnam pa gang bslangs pa dang / de nyid thob pa zhes smos pa ni gzhan thob pa dang / de nyid ma thob pa la ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro // sbyor ba gcig gis gos spags pa gcig gam /
translated: If one obtains something else, or if one does not obtain that, there is no downfall.

original: gnyis sam / mang po zhig thob na yang ltung ba'i dngos gzhi gcig rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gnyis sam / mang po zhig thob na yang ltung ba'i dngos gzhi gcig rnam par gzhag go //
translated: If one obtains one, two, or many pieces of cloth through a single action, one is still said to have committed a root downfall.

original: spyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: spyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The preparatory stage of this downfall is a minor offense.

original: ji srid du spags pa slong ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi spyor ba brtsams nas /
analyzed: ji srid du spags pa slong ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi spyor ba brtsams nas /
translated: As long as one has begun the preparatory stage of the downfall of asking for cloth,

original: dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: but has not yet reached the actual downfall, one has committed a minor offense.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each of the many different preparatory stages of the actual downfall, one commits a minor offense.

original: mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa dang / khyim par gyur pa dang / srog dang ldan pa dang / nye du ma yin pa las bzlog pa la spags pa ma phul bar shes pa slong ba dang thob pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa dang / khyim par gyur pa dang / srog dang ldan pa dang / nye du ma yin pa las bzlog pa la spags pa ma phul bar shes pa slong ba dang thob pa la nyes byas so //
translated: It is a wrong action to request and obtain, knowing that the donor has not given the gift, from a human being, a layperson, a living person, and one who is not a relative.

original: spags pa ma phul bar shes pa slong ba'i tshe nyid na nyes byas so //🔽spags pa ma phul bar shes pa mi rung ba slong ba dang thob pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: spags pa ma phul bar shes pa slong ba'i tshe nyid na nyes byas so // spags pa ma phul bar shes pa mi rung ba slong ba dang thob pa la nyes byas so //
translated: It is a wrong action to request and obtain, knowing that the donor has not given the gift.🔽It is a wrong action to request and obtain, knowing that the donor has not given the gift, and that it is inappropriate.

original: spags pa ma phul bar shes pa chung du slong ba dang thob pa la nyes byas so //🔽rgyu spun spags pa ma phul bar shes pa slong ba dang thob pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: spags pa ma phul bar shes pa chung du slong ba dang thob pa la nyes byas so // rgyu spun spags pa ma phul bar shes pa slong ba dang thob pa la nyes byas so //
translated: It is a wrong action to request and obtain, knowing that the donor has not given the gift, and that it is small.🔽It is a wrong action to request and obtain, knowing that the donor has not given the gift, and that it is a material for the monastic community.

original: rgyu spun gyi rang bzhin pa la dang / ras bal la sogs pa spags pa ma phul bar shes pa slong ba dang thob pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: rgyu spun gyi rang bzhin pa la dang / ras bal la sogs pa spags pa ma phul bar shes pa slong ba dang thob pa la nyes byas so //
translated: It is a wrong action to request and obtain, knowing that the donor has not given the gift, and that it is a material for the monastic community, and that it is cotton or another material.

original: khyim bdag gam khyim bdag @243b gi chung ma gnyi ga'am gcig ma ning dang mtshan gnyis pa la spags pa ma phul bar shes pa slong ba dang thob pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: khyim bdag gam khyim bdag @243b gi chung ma gnyi ga'am gcig ma ning dang mtshan gnyis pa la spags pa ma phul bar shes pa slong ba dang thob pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If one requests and obtains a gift from a householder or householder’s wife, or from a neuter or hermaphrodite, without having offered it to the Saṅgha, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: phyi rol ba'i rab tu byung ba dang / chos 'di pa'i rab tu byung ba mtshams med pa byas ba la sogs pa gtan gyi bar chad kyis sdom pa dang po nas ma chags pa dang / sdom pa chags pa bslab pa nyams pa dag la spags pa ma phul bar shes pa slong ba dang thob pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: phyi rol ba'i rab tu byung ba dang / chos 'di pa'i rab tu byung ba mtshams med pa byas ba la sogs pa gtan gyi bar chad kyis sdom pa dang po nas ma chags pa dang / sdom pa chags pa bslab pa nyams pa dag la spags pa ma phul bar shes pa slong ba dang thob pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If one requests and obtains a gift from a renunciate of another religion or a renunciate of this religion who has committed an action of immediate retribution, etc., or who is permanently obstructed, or from one who has not taken vows from the beginning, or from one who has violated vows, without having offered it to the Saṅgha, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The offense of a minor infraction of the training is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: As many as there are trainings, there are also that many offenses of a minor infraction of the training.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The offense of a minor infraction of the training of a training is also a minor offense, a minor offense of a minor offense.

original: de yang dang po yid la sems pa ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: de yang dang po yid la sems pa ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: Moreover, first, the mental act of thinking is a minor offense in the preparatory stage.

original: de nas lus dang ngag gis sbyor ba ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas dngos so //
analyzed: de nas lus dang ngag gis sbyor ba ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas dngos so //
translated: Then, the physical and verbal acts are the actual offense in the preparatory stage.

original: de nas mthar thug pa ni spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhi'o zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //🔽ltung ba med pa ni dge slong gos phrogs pa dang / rlag pa dang / tshig pa dang ; rlung gis khyer ba dang / chus khyer ba dag ni slong bar rigs pa yin pas de dag spags pa ma phul bar shes pa slong ba la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: de nas mthar thug pa ni spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhi'o zhes bya bar shes par bya'o // ltung ba med pa ni dge slong gos phrogs pa dang / rlag pa dang / tshig pa dang ; rlung gis khyer ba dang / chus khyer ba dag ni slong bar rigs pa yin pas de dag spags pa ma phul bar shes pa slong ba la ltung ba med do //
translated: Then, the final step is the actual offense of a downfall that requires relinquishment.🔽There is no offense if a monk is worthy of receiving robes because his robes have been stolen, lost, burned, blown away by the wind, or carried away by water, and he requests them, knowing that they have not been offered.

original: rin thang gzhan nam /
analyzed: rin thang gzhan nam /
translated: There is no offense if he requests them, knowing that they are of a different value,

original: kha dog gzhan nam /🔽khru tshad gzhan spags pa ma phul bar shes pa thob pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: kha dog gzhan nam / khru tshad gzhan spags pa ma phul bar shes pa thob pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: a different color,🔽or a different size than the ones that have not been offered.

original: ras ma dang / kha tshar spags pa ma phul bar shes pa slong ba la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ras ma dang / kha tshar spags pa ma phul bar shes pa slong ba la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if he requests them, knowing that they are not offered as cloth or as fringe.

original: kha tshar spags pa ma phul bar shes pa bslangs pa las ras ma thob pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: kha tshar spags pa ma phul bar shes pa bslangs pa las ras ma thob pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one requests cloth from a weaver who has not yet been paid, but who has already woven the cloth.

original: ras ma spags pa ma phul bar shes pa bslangs na ras yug chen dang / ras yug phran dag thob bo snyam nas bslangs shing thob na yang ltung ba med do ;
analyzed: ras ma spags pa ma phul bar shes pa bslangs na ras yug chen dang / ras yug phran dag thob bo snyam nas bslangs shing thob na yang ltung ba med do ;
translated: There is no offense if one requests cloth from a weaver who has not yet been paid, but who has already woven the cloth, thinking that one will obtain a large or small piece of cloth, and then obtains that.

original: / las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: / las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is a beginner, or if one is insane, or if one’s mind is disturbed, or if one is the first offender.

original: bslab bar bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du spags pa slong ba'i spang bar 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab bar bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du spags pa slong ba'i spang bar 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training rule is that a monk should not request cloth from a weaver who has not yet been paid, and should not rely on any of the forms of this.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is as before.

original: spags pa slong ba'i spang ba ste brgyad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: spags pa slong ba'i spang ba ste brgyad pa bshad zin to /
translated: This completes the eighth training rule on requesting cloth.

original: // / so so nas spags pa slong ba'i spang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: // / so so nas spags pa slong ba'i spang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: mnyan yod na khyim @244a * //
analyzed: mnyan yod na khyim @244a * //
translated: In Śrāvastī there lived a certain householder.

original: bdag cig 'dug pa des rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs te /🔽de de dang lhan cig rtse bar byed /🔽dga' bar byed /
analyzed: bdag cig 'dug pa des rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs te / de de dang lhan cig rtse bar byed / dga' bar byed /
translated: He took a wife from a family of equal status.🔽He enjoyed himself with her,🔽took pleasure with her,

original: dga' dgur spyod par byed do //
analyzed: dga' dgur spyod par byed do //
translated: and coupled with her.

original: khyim bdag de gzhan gyi chung ma la chags par gyur nas /
analyzed: khyim bdag de gzhan gyi chung ma la chags par gyur nas /
translated: The householder became attached to another’s wife.🔽When his wife tried to stop him, saying, “Master, don’t do this,” he did not stop.🔽As much as she tried to stop him, he did not stop.

original: de la chung mas rje'i sras de ltar ma mdzad cig ces phyir bzlog na ji tsam du de phyir bzlog kyang phyir ma log pa de tsam du de'i chung ma de yang skyes pa gzhan dag dang lhan cig 'khrul ba rtsom par byed do //
analyzed: de la chung mas rje'i sras de ltar ma mdzad cig ces phyir bzlog na ji tsam du de phyir bzlog kyang phyir ma log pa de tsam du de'i chung ma de yang skyes pa gzhan dag dang lhan cig 'khrul ba rtsom par byed do //
translated: To that extent, she began to have affairs with other men.

original: khyim bdag de yang bud med gzhan dag la sbyin par byed la /
analyzed: khyim bdag de yang bud med gzhan dag la sbyin par byed la /
translated: The householder also gave gifts to other women.

original: chung ma de yang skyes pa gzhan dag la sbyin par byed pas de ltar khyim de gnyis ka nas rgud par gyur nas de gnyis la bu mo mngag gzhug ma zhig yod nas khyim bdag des bu mo de la 'dis khyim rgud par byas so zhes khu tshur🔽dang thal lcag dag gis rdeg par byed do //
analyzed: chung ma de yang skyes pa gzhan dag la sbyin par byed pas de ltar khyim de gnyis ka nas rgud par gyur nas de gnyis la bu mo mngag gzhug ma zhig yod nas khyim bdag des bu mo de la 'dis khyim rgud par byas so zhes khu tshur dang thal lcag dag gis rdeg par byed do //
translated: The householder beat the maid with his fist and slaps, saying, “She has caused the household to decline.”

original: bu mo des smras pa /
analyzed: bu mo des smras pa /
translated: The maid said,

original: bdag gis khyim rgud par gyur pa 'di ji las gyur pa 'tshal mod kyi /
analyzed: bdag gis khyim rgud par gyur pa 'di ji las gyur pa 'tshal mod kyi /
translated: “I know why the household has declined,

original: 'on kyang bdag gis ji ltar rje dag la bsngags pa ma lags pa brjod pa bgyir rung /
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag gis ji ltar rje dag la bsngags pa ma lags pa brjod pa bgyir rung /
translated: but how can I say something that is not praise of my master?”🔽Upatiṣya heard about this and went to the householder and to the householder’s wife.

original: nye dags de tshor nas des khyim bdag de dad khyim bdag gi chung ma de'i gan du song ste ci nas kyang de gnyis skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi dag la gnas par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar tshul khrims kyi bsngags pa brjod cing /
analyzed: nye dags de tshor nas des khyim bdag de dad khyim bdag gi chung ma de'i gan du song ste ci nas kyang de gnyis skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi dag la gnas par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar tshul khrims kyi bsngags pa brjod cing /
translated: He praised moral discipline in such a way that both of them went for refuge and abided in the fundamental precepts.

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa'i bsngags pa ma yin pa yang brjod nas des de gnyis skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi dag la gnas par byas so //
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa'i bsngags pa ma yin pa yang brjod nas des de gnyis skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi dag la gnas par byas so //
translated: He spoke in dispraise of immorality, and they took refuge and observed the bases of training.

original: khyim bdag de gtum pa brtun ngas pa drag shul che ba yin pas yang bu mo de la rdeg par brtsams pa dang / chung mas de la smras pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag de gtum pa brtun ngas pa drag shul che ba yin pas yang bu mo de la rdeg par brtsams pa dang / chung mas de la smras pa /
translated: The householder was violent, impetuous, and rough. He again started to beat his daughter, and his wife said to him,

original: rje'i sras gang gi tshe bdag cag las dang las kyi rnam par smin pa mi mkhyen pa de'i tshe ko rdeg par mdzad mod /
analyzed: rje'i sras gang gi tshe bdag cag las dang las kyi rnam par smin pa mi mkhyen pa de'i tshe ko rdeg par mdzad mod /
translated: “Lord, when we did not know about karma and its ripening, you beat us.

original: da bdag cag dge ba'i bshes gnyen 'phags pa nye dga' la brten nas las dang las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pas /
analyzed: da bdag cag dge ba'i bshes gnyen 'phags pa nye dga' la brten nas las dang las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pas /
translated: Now, having relied on the spiritual friend Ārya Upāli, we know about karma and its ripening.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten ni rang gi las kyi 'bras bu la spyod pa lags pas su zhig su'i bran lags /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten ni rang gi las kyi 'bras bu la spyod pa lags pas su zhig su'i bran lags /
translated: In this world, people experience the results of their own karma. So who is the servant of whom?”🔽“Do not beat this girl.

original: bu mo 'di la rdeg par ma mdzad cig / bzang mo khyod zer ba ma nyes so //
analyzed: bu mo 'di la rdeg par ma mdzad cig / bzang mo khyod zer ba ma nyes so //
translated: Good woman, what you say is not wrong.”

original: bu mo tshur shog khrus gyis la shog shig / bu mo de khrus byas te 'ongs pa dang / des de la gos phrugs cig bskon nas smras pa /
analyzed: bu mo tshur shog khrus gyis la shog shig / bu mo de khrus byas te 'ongs pa dang / des de la gos phrugs cig bskon nas smras pa /
translated: When the girl had washed up and returned, he gave her a set of clothes and said,🔽“Girl, be happy and work.”

original: bu mo dga' @244b zhing las byos shig / bu mo des bsams pa /
analyzed: bu mo dga' @244b zhing las byos shig / bu mo des bsams pa /
translated: The girl thought,

original: khyim bdag khyo shug 'di sngon gtum pa brtun ngas pa drag shul che ba yin te /
analyzed: khyim bdag khyo shug 'di sngon gtum pa brtun ngas pa drag shul che ba yin te /
translated: “This householder and his wife were previously fierce, strict, and violent.

original: yang dang yang du bdag la khu tshur dang thal lcag dag gis rdeg par byed cing zas dang / gos ngan pa dag sbyin par byed na /
analyzed: yang dang yang du bdag la khu tshur dang thal lcag dag gis rdeg par byed cing zas dang / gos ngan pa dag sbyin par byed na /
translated: Again and again they beat me with their fists and slaps, and they gave me bad food and clothes.🔽Now they are like my parents.”

original: da 'di bdag gi pha ma dang 'dra bar gyur to snyam nas yang bsams pa /
analyzed: da 'di bdag gi pha ma dang 'dra bar gyur to snyam nas yang bsams pa /
translated: She thought again,

original: gang tshun chad nas 'phags pa nye dga' khyim 'dir 'jug par brtsams pa de tshun chad nas khyim bdag 'di pha ma dang 'dra bar gyur pas bdag gis 'phags pa nye dga' la ji zhig gis dga' bar bya snyam nas /
analyzed: gang tshun chad nas 'phags pa nye dga' khyim 'dir 'jug par brtsams pa de tshun chad nas khyim bdag 'di pha ma dang 'dra bar gyur pas bdag gis 'phags pa nye dga' la ji zhig gis dga' bar bya snyam nas /
translated: “Since the time the noble Upananda began to enter this house, this householder has become like my parents. What can I do to please the noble Upananda?”🔽She thought,

original: des bsdams pa /
analyzed: des bsdams pa /
translated: This is the restraint.🔽🔽

original: gal te bdag gis 'di las cung zhig brkus te dbul du ni khyim bdag 'dis bdag la rdeg btsog mang po byas te sngon gyi gnas su gzhag par 'gyur ro snyam nas /
analyzed: gal te bdag gis 'di las cung zhig brkus te dbul du ni khyim bdag 'dis bdag la rdeg btsog mang po byas te sngon gyi gnas su gzhag par 'gyur ro snyam nas /
translated: “If I steal a little from this, the householder will beat me and return me to my former state.”

original: de sdod cing 'dug go //
analyzed: de sdod cing 'dug go //
translated: So he stayed there.

original: khyim bdag gi chung ma des khyim bdag de la smras pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag gi chung ma des khyim bdag de la smras pa /
translated: The householder’s wife said to the householder,

original: rje'i sras mkhyen par mdzod cig /'phags pa nye dga' ni bdag cag gi dge ba'i bshes gnyen lags te /
analyzed: rje'i sras mkhyen par mdzod cig /'phags pa nye dga' ni bdag cag gi dge ba'i bshes gnyen lags te /
translated: “Master, please know that the noble Upatiṣya is our spiritual friend.

original: 'phags pa nye dags bdag cag las kyi mtha' dri ma can dang phral nas skyabs su 'gro ba dang bslab pa'i gzhi dag la bkod de /
analyzed: 'phags pa nye dags bdag cag las kyi mtha' dri ma can dang phral nas skyabs su 'gro ba dang bslab pa'i gzhi dag la bkod de /
translated: The noble Upatiṣya has freed us from the stain of work, established us in the refuges and the fundamental precepts,

original: yang dang yang du bdag cag la chos kyis sdud par byed pas bdag cag gis kyang de la zang zing cung zad kyis bsdu bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: yang dang yang du bdag cag la chos kyis sdud par byed pas bdag cag gis kyang de la zang zing cung zad kyis bsdu bar bgyi'o //
translated: and has repeatedly gathered us with the Dharma. We should also gather him with material things.”

original: bzang mo de bzhin bya'o //
analyzed: bzang mo de bzhin bya'o //
translated: “Good woman, let’s do that.”

original: ci zhig bgyi /
analyzed: ci zhig bgyi /
translated: “What should we do?”

original: de la bdag cag so so nas ras yug chen dag dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la bdag cag so so nas ras yug chen dag dbul bar bya'o //
translated: “Each of us should offer a fine cotton cloth.”

original: bu mo des de thos nas bsams pa /
analyzed: bu mo des de thos nas bsams pa /
translated: When the girl heard that, she thought,

original: bdag gis 'phags pa nye dga' la dga' ba de sbran par bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag gis 'phags pa nye dga' la dga' ba de sbran par bya'o snyam mo //
translated: “I will warn the noble Upatiṣya about that.”

original: nye dga' yang snga dro sham thabs bgos lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te /
analyzed: nye dga' yang snga dro sham thabs bgos lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te /
translated: Upatiṣya put on his lower robe and Dharma robes, and carrying his alms bowl,🔽he entered Śrāvastī for alms.

original: mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la zhugs nas mthar gyis bsod snyoms la rgyu ba na khyim der zhugs pa dang / bu mo des khyim legs par phyags shing /
analyzed: mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la zhugs nas mthar gyis bsod snyoms la rgyu ba na khyim der zhugs pa dang / bu mo des khyim legs par phyags shing /
translated: When he entered the house, the girl had swept and cleaned the house well,

original: phyag dar bor nas des nye dga' mthong ba dang / rkang pa gnyis la phyag 'tshal te smras pa /
analyzed: phyag dar bor nas des nye dga' mthong ba dang / rkang pa gnyis la phyag 'tshal te smras pa /
translated: and when she saw Upatiṣya, she bowed down at his feet and said,

original: bdag gis 'phags pa nye dga' la dgyes pa sbran par bgyi'o //
analyzed: bdag gis 'phags pa nye dga' la dgyes pa sbran par bgyi'o //
translated: “I will warn the noble Upatiṣya about that.”

original: khyim bdag dang khyim bdag gi chung ma 'di khyod la so so nas ras yug chen dag 'bul bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyim bdag dang khyim bdag gi chung ma 'di khyod la so so nas ras yug chen dag 'bul bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “The householder and the householder’s wife will each give you a bolt of cloth.”

original: nye dags bsams pa /
analyzed: nye dags bsams pa /
translated: Upatiṣya thought,

original: sa'i stang na 'dod pa'i bdag nyid can gang ji snyed pa de dag dang bdag mnyam par deng bu mo @245a * //
analyzed: sa'i stang na 'dod pa'i bdag nyid can gang ji snyed pa de dag dang bdag mnyam par deng bu mo @245a * //
translated: “All those who are as lustful as I am on the face of the earth, and I myself,

original: 'dis kyang 'phrigs so snyam nas /🔽des bshes te smras pa /
analyzed: 'dis kyang 'phrigs so snyam nas / des bshes te smras pa /
translated: I'm sure he'll be convinced.

original: bu mo gal te bden par gyur na ni ngas khyod la gshe ba dag la shugs ma bya'o //
analyzed: bu mo gal te bden par gyur na ni ngas khyod la gshe ba dag la shugs ma bya'o //
translated: He said to her, Girl, if it's true, I won't punish you for scolding me.

original: ji ste brdzun par gyur na ni rdeg btsog mang po byed du bcug ste sngon gyi gnas ji lta bar gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ste brdzun par gyur na ni rdeg btsog mang po byed du bcug ste sngon gyi gnas ji lta bar gzhag par bya'o //
translated: But if it's false, I'll have you beaten and put back in your former condition.

original: 'phags pa spyong mang du mdzad na bzhud cig dang khyod nyid kyis mkhyen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa spyong mang du mdzad na bzhud cig dang khyod nyid kyis mkhyen par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you're a noble one, you'll go to the Jetavana and find out.

original: de zhugs nas stan bshams pa nyid la 'dug pa dang / khyim bdag de chung ma dang bcas pas rkang pa la phyag 'tshal te stan ches dma' ba blangs nas chos mnyan pa'i phyir mdun du 'dug go //🔽nye dags smras pa /
analyzed: de zhugs nas stan bshams pa nyid la 'dug pa dang / khyim bdag de chung ma dang bcas pas rkang pa la phyag 'tshal te stan ches dma' ba blangs nas chos mnyan pa'i phyir mdun du 'dug go // nye dags smras pa /
translated: When he arrived, he sat down on the seat prepared for him, and the householder and his wife bowed at his feet, took very low seats, and sat before him to listen to the Dharma.

original: khyim bdag kho bo la so so nas ras yug chen sbyin par byas pa gang dag yin pa de dag blta'o //
analyzed: khyim bdag kho bo la so so nas ras yug chen sbyin par byas pa gang dag yin pa de dag blta'o //
translated: Upatiṣya said, Householder, let's see the woolen cloth that was given to me by each of you.🔽 He looked at it and said, Householder, this is not the woolen cloth that was given to me by each of you.

original: de gnyis kyis phan tshun gdong du blta bar brtsams te 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis phan tshun gdong du blta bar brtsams te 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: They looked at each other and said,

original: 'phags pa bdag cag gis gsangs te smras pa de 'phags pa la sus bgyis /
analyzed: 'phags pa bdag cag gis gsangs te smras pa de 'phags pa la sus bgyis /
translated: “Noble one, who told you about our secret conversation?”

original: ci 'phags pas gzhan gyi sems kyang mkhyen tam /
analyzed: ci 'phags pas gzhan gyi sems kyang mkhyen tam /
translated: “Noble one, do you also know the minds of others?”

original: nye dags smras pa /
analyzed: nye dags smras pa /
translated: Udayin said,

original: kho bo cag lhung bzed du zos shing so lhags pa dang / skra dkar por gyur pa yin na kho bo la de tsam yang mi srid dam /
analyzed: kho bo cag lhung bzed du zos shing so lhags pa dang / skra dkar por gyur pa yin na kho bo la de tsam yang mi srid dam /
translated: “I have eaten from a begging bowl, my teeth have fallen out, and my hair has turned white. Could it be that I am not capable of that?”

original: khyim bdag de dang khyim bdag gi chung ma des so so nas ras yug chen blangs te /
analyzed: khyim bdag de dang khyim bdag gi chung ma des so so nas ras yug chen blangs te /
translated: The householder and his wife each took a bolt of cloth

original: nya dga' la phul ba dang / nye dags ras yug chen de dag mthong nas lag pa gnyis 'dril bar byed /
analyzed: nya dga' la phul ba dang / nye dags ras yug chen de dag mthong nas lag pa gnyis 'dril bar byed /
translated: and offered it to Udayin. When Udayin saw the bolts of cloth, he rubbed his hands together

original: bzhin sgyur bar byed do //
analyzed: bzhin sgyur bar byed do //
translated: and contorted his face.

original: khyim bdag gis smras pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag gis smras pa /
translated: The householder said,

original: 'phags pa ci'i slad du phyag gnyis 'dril bar byed /
analyzed: 'phags pa ci'i slad du phyag gnyis 'dril bar byed /
translated: “Noble one, why are you rubbing your hands together

original: zhal sgyur bar byed /
analyzed: zhal sgyur bar byed /
translated: and contorting your face?”

original: nye dags smras pa /
analyzed: nye dags smras pa /
translated: Udayin said,🔽“Householder, I am not capable of accepting these.”

original: khyim bdag 'di dag ni khyed la yongs su btang ba las byung ba'i bsod nams ni yod na /
analyzed: khyim bdag 'di dag ni khyed la yongs su btang ba las byung ba'i bsod nams ni yod na /
translated: “Householders, you have the merit that comes from giving these things to me,

original: yongs su longs spyod pa las byung ba'i bsod nams ni med do /🔽ras yug chen 'di dag ni mchil lham phyi ba'am /
analyzed: yongs su longs spyod pa las byung ba'i bsod nams ni med do / ras yug chen 'di dag ni mchil lham phyi ba'am /
translated: but you do not have the merit that comes from using them.

original: skar khung glan par rung ste /
analyzed: skar khung glan par rung ste /
translated: These fine cloths are suitable for wiping the feet or for covering a window.

original: 'di dag ni chos gos kyi gdang la yongs su zad pa dang mthar thug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dag ni chos gos kyi gdang la yongs su zad pa dang mthar thug par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be used up and exhausted on the Dharma robes.

original: 'o na ji ltar bgyi /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar bgyi /
translated: “What should I do?”🔽“Give me other fine cloths.”

original: ras yug chen bzang po gzhan dag byin cig / ras yug chen gzhan dag ma mchis so //
analyzed: ras yug chen bzang po gzhan dag byin cig / ras yug chen gzhan dag ma mchis so //
translated: “I don’t have any other fine cloths.”

original: tshong dus nas nyos te byin cig / rin dag ma mchis so //
analyzed: tshong dus nas nyos te byin cig / rin dag ma mchis so //
translated: “Buy them in the marketplace and give them to me.”🔽“I don’t have the money.”🔽“Give them to me on credit.”

original: dus thob la byin cig / khyim bdag des chung ma'i gdong du blta bar brtsams pa dang / chung mas smras pa @245b rje'i sras bdag cag la 'phags pa nye dags phan btags kyi /
analyzed: dus thob la byin cig / khyim bdag des chung ma'i gdong du blta bar brtsams pa dang / chung mas smras pa @245b rje'i sras bdag cag la 'phags pa nye dags phan btags kyi /
translated: The householder looked at his wife’s face, and she said, “Lord, the noble Pūrṇa has helped us.

original: ras yug chen dag 'jol la de la phul cig / khyim bdag de nye dga' dang lhan cig srang du dong nas /
analyzed: ras yug chen dag 'jol la de la phul cig / khyim bdag de nye dga' dang lhan cig srang du dong nas /
translated: The householder went with Upasena to the street.

original: tshong khang du phyin pa dang / nye dags bsams pa /
analyzed: tshong khang du phyin pa dang / nye dags bsams pa /
translated: When they reached the shop, Upasena thought,🔽This merchant is proud.

original: chong pa 'di nga rgyal bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: chong pa 'di nga rgyal bskyed par bya ste /
translated: If I make him proud,

original: des na ras yug chen bzang po ster bar 'gyur ro snyam nas nye dags khyim bdag la smras pa /
analyzed: des na ras yug chen bzang po ster bar 'gyur ro snyam nas nye dags khyim bdag la smras pa /
translated: he will give me a good cloth. Upasena said to the householder,

original: khyim bdag tshong pa 'di ni gcam bu zhig yin pas 'di la ras yug chen bzang po med kyi gzhan du 'dong ngo //
analyzed: khyim bdag tshong pa 'di ni gcam bu zhig yin pas 'di la ras yug chen bzang po med kyi gzhan du 'dong ngo //
translated: Householder, this merchant is a braggart. He doesn't have any good cloth. Let's go somewhere else.

original: tshong pa des de thos nas /
analyzed: tshong pa des de thos nas /
translated: When the merchant heard that,

original: des chen po la 'os pa'i ras yug chen dag bstan te smras pa /
analyzed: des chen po la 'os pa'i ras yug chen dag bstan te smras pa /
translated: he showed them some very fine cloth suitable for a king and said,

original: 'phags pa ras yug chen dag la gzigs /
analyzed: 'phags pa ras yug chen dag la gzigs /
translated: Noble one, look at these cloths.

original: ras yug chen 'di dag ni bzang na rin ji tsam 'di dang 'di tsam mo //

translated: The one who desires cloth is the monk who seeks cloth.

original: kun dga' ra ba pa zhes bya ba dang / dge bsnyen zhal ta byed pa zhes bya ba ni gzhi tha dad de gnyis ka yang zhal ta byed pa dang / zhal ta nyams su len pa yin par spyar ro //
analyzed: kun dga' ra ba pa zhes bya ba dang / dge bsnyen zhal ta byed pa zhes bya ba ni gzhi tha dad de gnyis ka yang zhal ta byed pa dang / zhal ta nyams su len pa yin par spyar ro //
translated: The one who performs the duties of the monastery and the one who performs the duties of the lay follower are two different bases. Both are to be connected with the one who performs the duties and the one who practices the duties.

original: de la kun dga' ra ba pa zhes bya ba ni rung ba byed pa ste /
analyzed: de la kun dga' ra ba pa zhes bya ba ni rung ba byed pa ste /
translated: Among them, the one who performs the duties of the monastery is the one who performs the duties.

original: lha 'bangs dang / rtse rgod la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lha 'bangs dang / rtse rgod la sogs pa'o //
translated: He is a servant of the gods, a playful one, and so on.

original: dge bsnyen zhes bya ba ni gsum la skyabs su song ba bslab pa'i gzhi lnga blangs pa ste /
analyzed: dge bsnyen zhes bya ba ni gsum la skyabs su song ba bslab pa'i gzhi lnga blangs pa ste /
translated: The one called a lay follower is one who has gone for refuge to the Three Jewels and taken the five precepts.

original: dge slong gi 'khor du gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi 'khor du gtogs pa'o //
translated: He belongs to the retinue of monks.

original: de nas pho nya des gos kyi rin de dag khyer nas zhal ta byed pa ga la ba der 'gro bar bya zhing phyin nas zhal ta byed pa de la 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa zhal tu byed pa shes par gyis shig / khyod kyis gos
analyzed: de nas pho nya des gos kyi rin de dag khyer nas zhal ta byed pa ga la ba der 'gro bar bya zhing phyin nas zhal ta byed pa de la 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa zhal tu byed pa shes par gyis shig / khyod kyis gos
translated: Then, the messenger should take the price of the cloth and go to the steward. Having arrived, he should say this to the steward:

original: kyi rin 'di dag gis gos 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig nyos la /
analyzed: kyi rin 'di dag gis gos 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig nyos la /
translated: “Venerable steward, please know that you should buy such-and-such cloth with this price of the cloth.🔽When the monk named so-and-so arrives,🔽give him the appropriate cloth at the right time.”

original: dge slong ming 'di zhes bya ba 'ongs pa dang / de la gos rung ba dus su skon cig ces brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni pho nyas gos kyi rin dag zhal ta byed pa la gtad cing /
analyzed: dge slong ming 'di zhes bya ba 'ongs pa dang / de la gos rung ba dus su skon cig ces brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni pho nyas gos kyi rin dag zhal ta byed pa la gtad cing /
translated: This is the statement of instruction and advice by the messenger who has entrusted the price of the cloth to the steward,

original: de dag gos rung bar bsgyur la /
analyzed: de dag gos rung bar bsgyur la /
translated: and who has turned them into appropriate cloth.

original: dge slong de la dus su phul cig ces gdams shing rjes su bstan pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: dge slong de la dus su phul cig ces gdams shing rjes su bstan pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: “Give them to the monk at the right time.”

original: de nas pho nya des zhal ta byed pa de la shin tu legs par yang dag par bsgo zhing /🔽yang dag @256a * //
analyzed: de nas pho nya des zhal ta byed pa de la shin tu legs par yang dag par bsgo zhing / yang dag @256a * //
translated: Then, the messenger should instruct the steward very well,

original: par bstan nas /
analyzed: par bstan nas /
translated: and having instructed him very well,🔽he should go.

original: dge slong de ga la ba der 'gro bar bya zhing phyin nas dge slong de la 'di skrad ces 'phags pas zhal ta bgyid pa bstan pa gang lags bde la /
analyzed: dge slong de ga la ba der 'gro bar bya zhing phyin nas dge slong de la 'di skrad ces 'phags pas zhal ta bgyid pa bstan pa gang lags bde la /
translated: “I will show you the noble one who is the manager.🔽I have shown you the manager. Go to him and he will give you suitable cloth at the right time.”

original: bdag gis yang dag par bstan lags kyi de'i gan du bzhud cig dang / des khyod la gos rung ba dus su bskon par 'gyur ro zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni yid gcugs pa'i tshig gis sngar mngon sum du gtugs pa'i don bsgrub pa phyir rjes su go bar bya ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: bdag gis yang dag par bstan lags kyi de'i gan du bzhud cig dang / des khyod la gos rung ba dus su bskon par 'gyur ro zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni yid gcugs pa'i tshig gis sngar mngon sum du gtugs pa'i don bsgrub pa phyir rjes su go bar bya ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: This is the phrase for understanding after the fact, the phrase for accomplishing the purpose of previously going in person with a phrase of trust.

original: dge slong gos 'dod pas zhal ta byed pa'i gan du song la /🔽tshe dang ldan pa zhal ta byed pa bdag gos 'dod do //
analyzed: dge slong gos 'dod pas zhal ta byed pa'i gan du song la / tshe dang ldan pa zhal ta byed pa bdag gos 'dod do //
translated: “A monk who wants cloth should go to the manager and say,🔽‘Venerable manager, I want cloth.’

original: tshe dang ldan pa zhal ta byed pa bdag gos 'dod do zhes lan gnyis lan gsum du bskul bar bya /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa zhal ta byed pa bdag gos 'dod do zhes lan gnyis lan gsum du bskul bar bya /
translated: He should remind him a second and a third time.

original: dran par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong gis 'jig rten dang mi 'gal ba dang / 'dul ba dang mi 'gal bar bya ba'i tshul bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dran par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong gis 'jig rten dang mi 'gal ba dang / 'dul ba dang mi 'gal bar bya ba'i tshul bstan pa ste /
translated: The phrase you should remember this indicates that a monk should conduct himself in a manner that does not contradict worldly norms and that does not contradict the rules of the monastic code.

original: lan gcig gis grub na gnyis pa bya mi dgos /
analyzed: lan gcig gis grub na gnyis pa bya mi dgos /
translated: If the monk is able to obtain the robe by making the request only once, then he should not make a second request.

original: gnyis pas grub na gsum pa bya mi dgos /
analyzed: gnyis pas grub na gsum pa bya mi dgos /
translated: If he is able to obtain it by making a second request, then he should not make a third request.

original: gnyis pas yang ma grub na gsum pa yang bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis pas yang ma grub na gsum pa yang bya ste /
translated: If he is not able to obtain it by making a second request, then he should make a third request.

original: re zhig de dag ni dus dang por bya ba yin no //
analyzed: re zhig de dag ni dus dang por bya ba yin no //
translated: These are the procedures that should be followed during the first period of time.🔽The phrase if the robe is obtained, that is good means that it would be good if the robe were obtained.

original: lan gnyis lan gsum du bskul zhing dran bar byas nas gal te gos de grub na de lta na legs zhes bya ba ni de lta na bzang ba ste /🔽sbyin bdag dang pho nya dang zhal ta byed pa la yang btang ba las byung ba dang / yongs su longs spyad pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi 'phel bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: lan gnyis lan gsum du bskul zhing dran bar byas nas gal te gos de grub na de lta na legs zhes bya ba ni de lta na bzang ba ste /🔽sbyin bdag dang pho nya dang zhal ta byed pa la yang btang ba las byung ba dang / yongs su longs spyad pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi 'phel bar 'gyur la /
translated: The phrase if the robe is not obtained means that it would not be good if the robe were not obtained.

original: dge slong la yang 'jig rten dang 'gal ba dang / 'dul ba dang 'gal ba'i nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge slong la yang 'jig rten dang 'gal ba dang / 'dul ba dang 'gal ba'i nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, a monk does not have the fault of contradicting the world or contradicting the Vinaya.

original: gal te ma grub na lan bzhi lan lnga lan drug gi bar du phyogs su cang mi smra bar bsdad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong gis 'jig rten dang mi 'gal ba dang / 'dul ba dang mi 'gal bar spyad pa'i cho ga yin no //
analyzed: gal te ma grub na lan bzhi lan lnga lan drug gi bar du phyogs su cang mi smra bar bsdad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong gis 'jig rten dang mi 'gal ba dang / 'dul ba dang mi 'gal bar spyad pa'i cho ga yin no //
translated: If he is not established, he should remain silent in the four directions up to five or six times. This is the rule of conduct for a monk who does not contradict the world or contradict the Vinaya.

original: phyogs su zhes bya ba ni phyogs bzhi po dag tu ste phyogs bzhi po dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: phyogs su zhes bya ba ni phyogs bzhi po dag tu ste phyogs bzhi po dag gang zhe na /
translated: In the four directions means in the four directions. What are the four directions?

original: 'bod gnas dang / khyim gnas dang / las kyi mtha' dang las kyi gnas dag go //
analyzed: 'bod gnas dang / khyim gnas dang / las kyi mtha' dang las kyi gnas dag go //
translated: They are the direction of the potter, the direction of the barber, the direction of the work and the direction of the place of work.

original: de la 'bod gnas ni rdza mkhan gyi gnas dang / 'dreg mkhan gyi gnas so //
analyzed: de la 'bod gnas ni rdza mkhan gyi gnas dang / 'dreg mkhan gyi gnas so //
translated: Among them, the direction of the potter is the place of the potter, the place of the barber.

original: khyim gnas ni khyim gyi gnas sam /
analyzed: khyim gnas ni khyim gyi gnas sam /
translated: The direction of the house is the place of the house,

original: chu'i gnas so //
analyzed: chu'i gnas so //
translated: or the place of water.

original: las kyi mtha' ni bu ram shing gi las kyi mtha' dang / 'bras s'a lu'i las kyi mtha' dang / lan tshva'i las kyi mtha' dag go //
analyzed: las kyi mtha' ni bu ram shing gi las kyi mtha' dang / 'bras s'a lu'i las kyi mtha' dang / lan tshva'i las kyi mtha' dag go //
translated: The end of work is the end of work related to sugarcane, rice, and salt.

original: las kyi @256b gnas ni tshong khang dang tshong rdal lo //
analyzed: las kyi @256b gnas ni tshong khang dang tshong rdal lo //
translated: The place of work is the shop and the market.

original: cad mi smra bar bsdad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bskul ba'i sgo drug po dag gi ste /
analyzed: cad mi smra bar bsdad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bskul ba'i sgo drug po dag gi ste /
translated: One should remain silent when asked about the six doors of exhortation.

original: bskul ba'i sgo drug po dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: bskul ba'i sgo drug po dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six doors of exhortation?

original: khyod 'ongs sam zhes zer ba la de'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / 'ongs pa legs so zhes zer ba la de'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / stan 'di la 'dug shig ces zer ba la de'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / rkang pa khrus shig ces zer ba la de'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: khyod 'ongs sam zhes zer ba la de'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / 'ongs pa legs so zhes zer ba la de'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / stan 'di la 'dug shig ces zer ba la de'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / rkang pa khrus shig ces zer ba la de'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang /
translated: When asked Have you come? one should say For that purpose. When asked Welcome! one should say For that purpose. When asked Sit on this seat, one should say For that purpose. When asked Wash your feet, one should say For that purpose. When asked Eat, one should say For that purpose. When asked Drink, one should say For that purpose.

original: bca' ba dang / bza' ba zo shig ces zer ba la de'i phyir ro zhes zer ba dang / btung ba 'thungs shig ces zer ba la de'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bca' ba dang / bza' ba zo shig ces zer ba la de'i phyir ro zhes zer ba dang / btung ba 'thungs shig ces zer ba la de'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: he is not making a complete statement.

original: bskul ba'i sgo drug po de dag ha cang myur ba dang / thogs pa med par brjod cing /
analyzed: bskul ba'i sgo drug po de dag ha cang myur ba dang / thogs pa med par brjod cing /
translated: If he speaks these six kinds of statements too quickly, or without hesitation,

original: de la gzhan gyi tshig gi skabs med par byed na bskul ba'i sgo drug po dag yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi tshig gi skabs med par byed na bskul ba'i sgo drug po dag yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: and does not allow an opportunity for others to speak, then he should be understood as not making a complete statement.

original: bskul ba'i sgo drug po de dag ha cang mi myur ba dang / thogs pa dang bcas par brjod cing /
analyzed: bskul ba'i sgo drug po de dag ha cang mi myur ba dang / thogs pa dang bcas par brjod cing /
translated: If he speaks these six kinds of statements slowly, or with hesitation,

original: de la gzhan gyi tshig gi skabs yod par byed na bskul ba'i sgo drug po dag yongs su rdzogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi tshig gi skabs yod par byed na bskul ba'i sgo drug po dag yongs su rdzogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: and allows an opportunity for others to speak, then he should be understood as making a complete statement.

original: lan bzhi lan lnga lan drug gi bar du phyogs su cang mi smra bar bsdad pa na /
analyzed: lan bzhi lan lnga lan drug gi bar du phyogs su cang mi smra bar bsdad pa na /
translated: If he remains silent for up to four, five, or six times,

original: gal te gos de grub na de lta na legs zhes bya ba ni dge slong la 'dul ba dang 'gal ba'i kha na ma tho ba'i dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba yang med la /🔽sbyin bdag dang / pho nya dang / zhal ta pa dag la yang btang ba las byung ba dang / yongs su longs spyod pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos gzhi 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te gos de grub na de lta na legs zhes bya ba ni dge slong la 'dul ba dang 'gal ba'i kha na ma tho ba'i dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba yang med la / sbyin bdag dang / pho nya dang / zhal ta pa dag la yang btang ba las byung ba dang / yongs su longs spyod pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos gzhi 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If the robe is completed, it is good.

original: gal te ma grub na de'i 'og tu gos bsgrub pa'i phyir brtsal te /
analyzed: gal te ma grub na de'i 'og tu gos bsgrub pa'i phyir brtsal te /
translated: If it is not completed, then after that he should make an effort to complete the robe.

original: gos grub na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni ltung ba 'di'i byed pa po yin te /
analyzed: gos grub na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni ltung ba 'di'i byed pa po yin te /
translated: If the robe is completed, there is an offense of expiation for the one who is the agent of this downfall.

original: de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba ni de'i 'og rol du'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba ni de'i 'og rol du'o //
translated: After that means after that time.

original: gos bsgrub pa'i phyir brtsal te zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang 'gal ba dang / 'dul ba dang 'gal ba'i 'dzem pa spangs nas so //
analyzed: gos bsgrub pa'i phyir brtsal te zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang 'gal ba dang / 'dul ba dang 'gal ba'i 'dzem pa spangs nas so //
translated: Making an effort to complete the robe means to abandon shame with regard to what is disapproved by worldly people and with regard to what is disapproved by the monastic code.

original: gos grub na zhes bya ba ni thob na'o //🔽spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni dngos po de spangs nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba bshags par bya ba ste /
analyzed: gos grub na zhes bya ba ni thob na'o // spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni dngos po de spangs nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba bshags par bya ba ste /
translated: If he obtains means if he acquires.🔽A downfall is a downfall that is to be confessed after the object has been relinquished.

original: des na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is called a downfall that is to be confessed after the object has been relinquished.

original: da ni dus dang por bya ba dang / ltung ba med par bya ba'i tshig sngar @257a * //
analyzed: da ni dus dang por bya ba dang / ltung ba med par bya ba'i tshig sngar @257a * //
translated: Now, the words that were previously taught about what should be done in the first period and what should not be done in the first period are as follows.

original: bstan pa de dag la tshul bzhin du gnas pa'i dge slong bslab pa'i gzhi 'di'i ltung ba ma byung bas sbyin bdag dang / pho nya dang dge slong rang nyid kyi 'dod pa bzhin ma grub na zhal ta byed pas /
analyzed: bstan pa de dag la tshul bzhin du gnas pa'i dge slong bslab pa'i gzhi 'di'i ltung ba ma byung bas sbyin bdag dang / pho nya dang dge slong rang nyid kyi 'dod pa bzhin ma grub na zhal ta byed pas /
translated: If a fully ordained monk who is properly abiding in those words has not incurred a downfall in this training precept, and if the donor, messenger, and the monk himself do not obtain what they desire, then the manager

original: 'jig rten 'di dang pha rol gyi don la ma gzems par spyi thun gyi rdzas dang bsod nams bar du brnogs pa la dge slong gis chos bzhin du bsgrub pa'i cho ga bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di dang pha rol gyi don la ma gzems par spyi thun gyi rdzas dang bsod nams bar du brnogs pa la dge slong gis chos bzhin du bsgrub pa'i cho ga bstan par bya ste /
translated: should not be discouraged about the aims of this world and the next. He should teach the ritual for the monk to properly accomplish the intermediate storage of the shared goods and merit.

original: gal te ma grub na phyogs gang nas gos kyi rin de dag 'ongs pa der bdag 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong bdag nyid sbyin bdag gi drung du brda sprod du 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te ma grub na phyogs gang nas gos kyi rin de dag 'ongs pa der bdag 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong bdag nyid sbyin bdag gi drung du brda sprod du 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: If it is not established, then I will go to the place from which the price of the cloth came.” This means that the monk himself should go to the donor to communicate.

original: yang na yid brtan pa'i pho nya las tshe dang ldan pa dag gis dge slong che ge mo'i phyir gos kyi rin gang dag bskur ba de dag ni dge slong de'i don cir yang ma grub kyi shes par gyis shig / tshe dang ldan pa dag gi nor🔽chud ma gzan cig ces spring bar bya ste zhes bya ba ni yang na lhan cig gnas pa'am /
analyzed: yang na yid brtan pa'i pho nya las tshe dang ldan pa dag gis dge slong che ge mo'i phyir gos kyi rin gang dag bskur ba de dag ni dge slong de'i don cir yang ma grub kyi shes par gyis shig / tshe dang ldan pa dag gi nor chud ma gzan cig ces spring bar bya ste zhes bya ba ni yang na lhan cig gnas pa'am /
translated: Or, a trustworthy messenger should be sent with the message, “Venerables, know that the price of the cloth that was sent for the monk so-and-so has not been established for any purpose of the monk.

original: nye gnas las de skad ces spring bar bya'o //
analyzed: nye gnas las de skad ces spring bar bya'o //
translated: Venerables, do not lose your wealth.” This means that either a co-resident or a student should send such a message.

original: de la de ni cho ga yin no zhes bya ba ni skabs de la thabs de ltar bya ba de ni 'jig rten dang mi 'gal ba dang / 'dul ba dang mi 'gal ba'i rjes su mthun pa'i chos yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la de ni cho ga yin no zhes bya ba ni skabs de la thabs de ltar bya ba de ni 'jig rten dang mi 'gal ba dang / 'dul ba dang mi 'gal ba'i rjes su mthun pa'i chos yin pa'o //
translated: That is the procedure in that case. This means that the method of acting in that situation is in accordance with the Dharma, not in conflict with the world, and not in conflict with the Vinaya.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one commit a downfall?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here one should understand the characteristics of downfalls through the basic transgression, the preparatory stage, the downfall of the preparatory stage, the absence of downfalls, the training, and the restoration of the vows.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis sbyin bdag mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur pas gos kyi rin gser dngul la sogs pa rung ba ma yin pa pho nya mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur pa las
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis sbyin bdag mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur pas gos kyi rin gser dngul la sogs pa rung ba ma yin pa pho nya mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur pa las
translated: The basic transgression is as follows: A monk receives from a lay person, a human being, not a messenger, not an improper object such as gold and silver, not an improper place such as a charnel ground, not an improper time such as when one is not fasting, not an improper quantity such as more than one needs.

original: skur ba spangs nas pho nyas dge slong gi zhal ta byed pa mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur pa dris shing dge slong gis bstan pa la pho nyas bsgo zhing smras te /
analyzed: skur ba spangs nas pho nyas dge slong gi zhal ta byed pa mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur pa dris shing dge slong gis bstan pa la pho nyas bsgo zhing smras te /
translated: The preparatory stage is as follows: The monk, having rejected the messenger, asks a lay person, a human being, a messenger, to invite a monk who is a steward. The monk indicates the steward to the messenger. The messenger instructs the steward and speaks to him.

original: dge slong la yang brjod pa'i zhal ta byed pa de la bskul ba lan gsum dang bsdad pa lan gsum las lhag gam /
analyzed: dge slong la yang brjod pa'i zhal ta byed pa de la bskul ba lan gsum dang bsdad pa lan gsum las lhag gam /
translated: If a monk has been asked to convey a message to a monk, and he does so three times, and if he stays with him three times, and then does more than that,

original: sbyin bdag gi sems bsdu bar rjes su bsgrub pa khas ma blangs pa las gos blangs na skur ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyin bdag gi sems bsdu bar rjes su bsgrub pa khas ma blangs pa las gos blangs na skur ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: or if he does not accept the request to help the donor gather his thoughts, and then accepts the robe, he commits an actual downfall of the class of downfalls that require confession alone.

original: dge slong la bskur ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed @257b byung na ;🔽de ma spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
analyzed: dge slong la bskur ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed @257b byung na ; de ma spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
translated: If a monk commits a downfall of the class of downfalls that require confession alone,🔽if he does not give it up and does not separate from it, and does not confess the downfall,

original: spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
analyzed: spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
translated: or if he gives it up but does not separate from it, and does not confess the downfall,

original: spangs shing bral bar byas la ltung ba ma bshags par sbyin bdag dang / pho nya dang / zhal ta byed pa'i mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur pa las gos kyi rin gser dngul la sogs pa rung ba ma yin pa dang / gos de lta bu gzhan zhig rnyed na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: spangs shing bral bar byas la ltung ba ma bshags par sbyin bdag dang / pho nya dang / zhal ta byed pa'i mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur pa las gos kyi rin gser dngul la sogs pa rung ba ma yin pa dang / gos de lta bu gzhan zhig rnyed na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
translated: If one has abandoned and separated from the robes, but has not confessed the downfall, then if one accepts gold, silver, or other unsuitable things from householders who are patrons, messengers, or administrators, or if one obtains other robes in the same way, one commits an offense by the force of the previous action.

original: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: However, one does not commit an offense by the present action.

original: dge slong gis skur ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed byung la /
analyzed: dge slong gis skur ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed byung la /
translated: If a monk commits a downfall that requires relinquishment,

original: ji srid du spang ba'i dngos po las ma bshags shing /
analyzed: ji srid du spang ba'i dngos po las ma bshags shing /
translated: as long as he has not confessed the object to be relinquished

original: so sor ma bshags par lhung bzed dam /
analyzed: so sor ma bshags par lhung bzed dam /
translated: and has not been restored,🔽if he keeps a begging bowl,

original: chos gos sam /🔽dra ba'am / por bu'am /
analyzed: chos gos sam / dra ba'am / por bu'am /
translated: a monastic robe,🔽a needle case,

original: ska rags sam /
analyzed: ska rags sam /
translated: a belt,

original: dge sbyong gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad gang yang rung ba gzhan nye bar 'jog na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad gang yang rung ba gzhan nye bar 'jog na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
translated: or any other article necessary for a monk’s livelihood, he commits an offense by the force of the previous action.

original: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: However, he does not commit an offense by the present action.

original: 'di'i rnam par gzhag pa ni sbyin bdag mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur pas gos kyi rin gser dngul la sogs pa rung ba ma yin pa pho nya mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur pa las skur pa pho nyas dge slong la phul ba
analyzed: 'di'i rnam par gzhag pa ni sbyin bdag mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur pas gos kyi rin gser dngul la sogs pa rung ba ma yin pa pho nya mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur pa las skur pa pho nyas dge slong la phul ba
translated: The presentation of this topic is as follows: The donor is a layperson belonging to the human race who sends a messenger belonging to the human race who is also a layperson to offer gold, silver and so on that are not suitable as the price of cloth to a monk.

original: na dge slong gis tshe dang ldan pa pho nya dge slong dag ni gos kyi rin dag len du mi rung ste /
analyzed: na dge slong gis tshe dang ldan pa pho nya dge slong dag ni gos kyi rin dag len du mi rung ste /
translated: If the messenger offers this to the monk, the monk should say, “Venerable messenger, monks are not suitable to receive the price of cloth.

original: bdag cag gos rung ba dus su rnyed na ni len to zhes re zhig spang bar bya'o //🔽pho nyas kyang dge slong de la 'phags pa rnams kyi zhal ta bgyid pa /
analyzed: bdag cag gos rung ba dus su rnyed na ni len to zhes re zhig spang bar bya'o // pho nyas kyang dge slong de la 'phags pa rnams kyi zhal ta bgyid pa /
translated: If we obtain suitable cloth at the appropriate time, we will accept it.”🔽The messenger should ask the monk, “Are there any monks who act as agents for the āryas?

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi zhal ta nyams su len pa gang lags pa 'ga' mchis sam zhes dge slong gi zhal ta byed pa mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur pa ji yod pa dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi zhal ta nyams su len pa gang lags pa 'ga' mchis sam zhes dge slong gi zhal ta byed pa mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur pa ji yod pa dri bar bya'o //
translated: Are there any monks who carry out the instructions of the āryas?”

original: de la dge slong gis kyang pho nya 'di ni dge slong rnams kyi zhal ta byed pa ste /🔽'di ni dge slong rnams kyi zhal ta nyams su len pa'o zhes kun dga' ra ba pa'am /
analyzed: de la dge slong gis kyang pho nya 'di ni dge slong rnams kyi zhal ta byed pa ste / 'di ni dge slong rnams kyi zhal ta nyams su len pa'o zhes kun dga' ra ba pa'am /
translated: The monk should say to the messenger, “This is the monk’s attendant.

original: dge bsten zhal ta byed pa bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: dge bsten zhal ta byed pa bstan par bya'o //
translated: He is the one who carries out the monks’ business.”

original: de nas pho nya des kyang gos kyi rin de dag khyer nas zhal ta byed pa gal ba der 'gro bar bya zhing byin nas zhal ta byed pa de la 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa zhal ta byed pa shes par gyis shig / khyod kyis gos
analyzed: de nas pho nya des kyang gos kyi rin de dag khyer nas zhal ta byed pa gal ba der 'gro bar bya zhing byin nas zhal ta byed pa de la 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa zhal ta byed pa shes par gyis shig / khyod kyis gos
translated: The messenger should then go to the attendant and say, “Venerable attendant, please know that I have brought the price of the robe material.🔽Please buy with this the kind of robe material that is

original: kyi rin 'di dag gis gos 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig nyos la dge slong ming 'di zhes bya ba @258a * //
analyzed: kyi rin 'di dag gis gos 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig nyos la dge slong ming 'di zhes bya ba @258a * //
translated: suitable for the monk so-and-so,

original: 'ongs pa dang / de la gos rung ba dus su skon cig ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'ongs pa dang / de la gos rung ba dus su skon cig ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: and give it to him when he arrives.”

original: de nas pho nya des zhal ta byed pa de la shin tu legs par yang dag par bsgo zhing yang dag par bstan nas /
analyzed: de nas pho nya des zhal ta byed pa de la shin tu legs par yang dag par bsgo zhing yang dag par bstan nas /
translated: The messenger should then instruct the attendant very carefully and thoroughly,

original: dge slong de gal ba der 'gro bar bya zhing phyin nas dag slong de la 'di skad ces 'phags pas zhal ta bgyid pa bstan pa gang lags pa de la bdag gis yang dag par bstan lags kyi de'i gan du bzhud cig dang / des khyod la gos rung ba dus su bskon par 'gyur ro zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong de gal ba der 'gro bar bya zhing phyin nas dag slong de la 'di skad ces 'phags pas zhal ta bgyid pa bstan pa gang lags pa de la bdag gis yang dag par bstan lags kyi de'i gan du bzhud cig dang / des khyod la gos rung ba dus su bskon par 'gyur ro zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The monk should go to the place where the donor lives. Having arrived, he should say this to the donor: “Noble one, I have properly explained to the one who does the work what you have said. Go to him and he will give you suitable cloth in a timely manner.”

original: de nas zhal ta byed pa des kyang gos rung ba dus su bsgrub cing dge slong la dbul bar bya ste ;
analyzed: de nas zhal ta byed pa des kyang gos rung ba dus su bsgrub cing dge slong la dbul bar bya ste ;
translated: Then the one who does the work should obtain suitable cloth in a timely manner and offer it to the monk.

original: re zhig de dag ni sbyin bdag dang / pho nya dang / zhal ta pa la yang sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po rgya chen por 'gyur la dge slong la yang 'jig rten dang 'gal ba dang / 'dul ba dang 'gal ba'i nyes pa med par 'gyur ba'i sbyor ba bzang po yin no //
analyzed: re zhig de dag ni sbyin bdag dang / pho nya dang / zhal ta pa la yang sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po rgya chen por 'gyur la dge slong la yang 'jig rten dang 'gal ba dang / 'dul ba dang 'gal ba'i nyes pa med par 'gyur ba'i sbyor ba bzang po yin no //
translated: This is a good method for the donor, the messenger, and the one who does the work, because it makes the basis of the merit that arises from giving vast. It is also a good method for the monk, because he does not incur the offense of contradicting worldly people and contradicting the Vinaya.

original: gal te zhal ta byed pas de bzhin ma bsgrubs na dge slong gos 'dod pas zhal ta byed pa'i gan du song la tshe dang ldan pa zhal ta byed pa bdag gos 'dod do //
analyzed: gal te zhal ta byed pas de bzhin ma bsgrubs na dge slong gos 'dod pas zhal ta byed pa'i gan du song la tshe dang ldan pa zhal ta byed pa bdag gos 'dod do //
translated: If the attendant does not do as he has been asked, then the monk who wants the robe should go to the attendant and say, ‘Venerable attendant, I want a robe.🔽Venerable attendant, I want a robe.’

original: tshe dang ldan pa zhal ta byed pa bdag gos 'dod do zhes lan gnyis lan gsum du bskul bar bya /🔽dran par bya'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa zhal ta byed pa bdag gos 'dod do zhes lan gnyis lan gsum du bskul bar bya / dran par bya'o //
translated: He should remind him a second and a third time.

original: gal te des kyang ma grub na yang lan gnyis lan gsum gyi bar du phyogs su cang mi smra bar bsdad par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te des kyang ma grub na yang lan gnyis lan gsum gyi bar du phyogs su cang mi smra bar bsdad par bya'o //
translated: If he still does not get it, he should wait for up to two or three days in silence in the vicinity.

original: gal te nges kyang ma grub na phyogs gang nas gos kyi rin de dag 'ongs pa der bdag 'gro bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: gal te nges kyang ma grub na phyogs gang nas gos kyi rin de dag 'ongs pa der bdag 'gro bar byed pa'am /
translated: If he still does not get it, he should go to the place where the robe-cloth money came from,

original: yang na yid brtan pa'i pho nya las tshe dang ldan pa dag gis dge slong che ge mo'i phyir gos kyi rin gang dag bskur ba de dag ni dge slong de'i don cir yang ma grub kyi shes par gyis shig / tshe dang ldan pa dag gis rang
analyzed: yang na yid brtan pa'i pho nya las tshe dang ldan pa dag gis dge slong che ge mo'i phyir gos kyi rin gang dag bskur ba de dag ni dge slong de'i don cir yang ma grub kyi shes par gyis shig / tshe dang ldan pa dag gis rang
translated: or he should send a trustworthy messenger to them, saying, ‘Venerable sirs, the robe-cloth money that you sent for monk-so-and-so has not been used for that purpose. Please know that it is not to be used for that purpose.🔽Venerable sirs, you should send robe-cloth for monk-so-and-so.

original: gi nor chud ma gzan cig ces spring par bya ste /
analyzed: gi nor chud ma gzan cig ces spring par bya ste /
translated: “Do not waste the wealth of the donor.”

original: de la de ni dus dang por bya ba dang cho ga yin no //
analyzed: de la de ni dus dang por bya ba dang cho ga yin no //
translated: This is the first occasion and the rite.

original: de'i 'og tu dge slong gis zhal ta byed pa la gos bsgrub pa'i phyir sngar bskul ba lan gsum byas pa las lhag pa dang / sngar bsdad pa lan gsum byas pa las lhag par 'tshal tam /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dge slong gis zhal ta byed pa la gos bsgrub pa'i phyir sngar bskul ba lan gsum byas pa las lhag pa dang / sngar bsdad pa lan gsum byas pa las lhag par 'tshal tam /
translated: After that, if a monk asks a monk who is acting as an attendant for cloth to make a robe more than three times, or if he stays more than three nights in the same place as the attendant,

original: zhal ta byed pas sbyin bdag gi sems bsdu bar rjes su bsgrub pa khas ma blangs par dus der gos blangs na bskul ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos @258b gzhir rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: zhal ta byed pas sbyin bdag gi sems bsdu bar rjes su bsgrub pa khas ma blangs par dus der gos blangs na bskul ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos @258b gzhir rnam par gzhag go //
translated: and if the attendant does not agree to fulfill the donor’s wish, and if the monk then takes the cloth at that time, then the monk has committed an offense entailing relinquishment and confession, specified as follows.

original: sbyin bdag dang / pho nya dang zhal ta byed pa mi nyid dang / khyim pa nyid lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: sbyin bdag dang / pho nya dang zhal ta byed pa mi nyid dang / khyim pa nyid lan smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the donor, messenger, or attendant is a man, a lay person,

original: de gsum nye du dang nye du ma yin pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: de gsum nye du dang nye du ma yin pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: or if they are a relative or not a relative.

original: de gsum skyes pa dang bud med nyid la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: de gsum skyes pa dang bud med nyid la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if they are a man or a woman.

original: bskul ba dang phyogs na sdod pa go rims bzhin nam /
analyzed: bskul ba dang phyogs na sdod pa go rims bzhin nam /
translated: Is it in the order of the instigator and the one who stays in the vicinity?🔽Or is it in the order of the one who does it first and the one who does it later?

original: snga phyir byas pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: snga phyir byas pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in either order.🔽The agent of this is a human, not a non-human, and a layperson, not a renunciant.🔽The instigator and the one who stays in the vicinity are additional.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni sbyin bdag dang pho nya dang zhal ta byed pa gsum char mi nyid dang khyim pa nyid yin pa dang / bskul ba dang bsdad pa lhag pa dang / sbyin par byed pa'i sems bsdu bar rjes su bsgrub pa khas ma blangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni sbyin bdag dang pho nya dang zhal ta byed pa gsum char mi nyid dang khyim pa nyid yin pa dang / bskul ba dang bsdad pa lhag pa dang / sbyin par byed pa'i sems bsdu bar rjes su bsgrub pa khas ma blangs pa'o //
translated: The one who gives the thought of giving is not followed and accepted.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, there are five branches that make it a downfall of the main part:🔽The agent, the messenger, and the one who serves are all human, not non-human.🔽The price of the cloth is abandoned as unsuitable.🔽The instigator and the one who stays in the vicinity are additional.

original: spyin bdag dang / pho nya dang / zhal ta byed pa gsum char mi nyid yin pa dang / gos kyi rin rung ba ma yin pa spangs pa dang / bskul ba dang bsdad pa lhag pa dang / sbyin par byed pa'i sems bsdu bar rjes su bsgrub par khas ma blangs pa dang gos blangs pa'o //
analyzed: spyin bdag dang / pho nya dang / zhal ta byed pa gsum char mi nyid yin pa dang / gos kyi rin rung ba ma yin pa spangs pa dang / bskul ba dang bsdad pa lhag pa dang / sbyin par byed pa'i sems bsdu bar rjes su bsgrub par khas ma blangs pa dang gos blangs pa'o //
translated: The one who gives the thought of giving is not followed and accepted. The cloth is taken.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of those branches are incomplete, there is a downfall of whatever is appropriate.

original: de la sbyin bdag dang / pho nya dang / zhal ta byed pa gsum char mi nyid dang / khyim pa nyid ces smos pa ni de las bzlog pa dag la nyes byas su gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la sbyin bdag dang / pho nya dang / zhal ta byed pa gsum char mi nyid dang / khyim pa nyid ces smos pa ni de las bzlog pa dag la nyes byas su gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The text states that the patron, messenger, and attendant are human and laypeople, because it is a minor offense if they are the opposite.

original: gos kyi rin rung ba ma yin pa spangs pa zhes smos pa yang de las bzlog pa dag la nyes byas su gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gos kyi rin rung ba ma yin pa spangs pa zhes smos pa yang de las bzlog pa dag la nyes byas su gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The text states that the price of the robe is not suitable, because it is a minor offense if the opposite is true.

original: 'dir kha cig 'di skad ces zer te /
analyzed: 'dir kha cig 'di skad ces zer te /
translated: Here, some say:

original: gos kyi rin gser la sogs pa rung bar ma byas pa dag ni rigs pa 'di nyid kyis nye bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gos kyi rin gser la sogs pa rung bar ma byas pa dag ni rigs pa 'di nyid kyis nye bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The price of the robe, such as gold, that is not suitable is applied by this very reasoning.

original: gos kyi rin gser la sogs pa rung bar byas pa dag ni blangs kyang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gos kyi rin gser la sogs pa rung bar byas pa dag ni blangs kyang nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in accepting the price of the robe, such as gold, that is suitable.

original: de skad du yang bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de skad du yang bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: blang par bya zhing blangs nas kyang sbyin bdag de nyid la yid brtan te bcang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: blang par bya zhing blangs nas kyang sbyin bdag de nyid la yid brtan te bcang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: “Accept it and having accepted it, trust the donor and keep it.”

original: kho bo ni 'di skad ces zer te /
analyzed: kho bo ni 'di skad ces zer te /
translated: We say this:

original: gal te sbyin bdag gis gos kyi rin gyi bsam pas sbyin par byed cing /
analyzed: gal te sbyin bdag gis gos kyi rin gyi bsam pas sbyin par byed cing /
translated: If the donor gives with the intention of giving the price of cloth,

original: dge slong la yang gos kyi dgos pa yod na de'i tshe ni gos kyi rin de dag sngar bstan pa'i rim pa 'di nyid kyis nye bar sbyar bar bya'o //🔽ji ste sbyin pa'i bsam pas sbyin par byed cing dge slong la yang sangs rgyas mchod pa la sogs pa dang / dge 'dun mchod ston @259a * //
analyzed: dge slong la yang gos kyi dgos pa yod na de'i tshe ni gos kyi rin de dag sngar bstan pa'i rim pa 'di nyid kyis nye bar sbyar bar bya'o // ji ste sbyin pa'i bsam pas sbyin par byed cing dge slong la yang sangs rgyas mchod pa la sogs pa dang / dge 'dun mchod ston @259a * //
translated: and if the monk also has a need for cloth, then at that time the price of the cloth should be used in the manner previously explained.

original: gsol ba la sogs pa dag la dgos pa yod na de'i tshe ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i rung ba byas nas bdag gir bya'o //
analyzed: gsol ba la sogs pa dag la dgos pa yod na de'i tshe ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i rung ba byas nas bdag gir bya'o //
translated: But if the donor gives with the intention of giving, and if the monk also has a need for the worship of the Buddha, etc., and for the worship of the Sangha, etc., then at that time, having made it suitable, he should take possession of it, as stated by the Blessed One.

original: bskul ba dang / bsdad pa lhag pa zhes smras pa bskul ba lan gsum las ma lhag pa dang / bsdad pa lan gsum las ma lhag pa la nyes pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bskul ba dang / bsdad pa lhag pa zhes smras pa bskul ba lan gsum las ma lhag pa dang / bsdad pa lan gsum las ma lhag pa la nyes pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: There is no offense if the urging is no more than three times, and the staying is no more than three times, because there is no offense if the urging is no more than three times, and the staying is no more than three times.

original: bskul ba gsum ni tshig gi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: bskul ba gsum ni tshig gi bdag nyid do //
translated: Three urgings are in the form of words.

original: bsdad pa gsum ni phyogs na sdod pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: bsdad pa gsum ni phyogs na sdod pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The three who remain are the one who remains in a place.

original: de dag la go rims nges pa ni med de /
analyzed: de dag la go rims nges pa ni med de /
translated: There is no fixed order among these.

original: gal te sngar phyogs na sdod par byed la phyis skul bar byed na de lta na yang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gal te sngar phyogs na sdod par byed la phyis skul bar byed na de lta na yang nyes pa med do //
translated: If the one who remains in a place first makes an effort, there is no fault.

original: de bzhin du gal te bskul ba gnyis byed cing sdod pa bzhi byed na yang de lta na yang nyes pa med de /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te bskul ba gnyis byed cing sdod pa bzhi byed na yang de lta na yang nyes pa med de /
translated: If the one who makes an effort does so twice and the one who remains in a place does so four times, there is no fault,

original: sdod pa'i gnas skabs dman pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdod pa'i gnas skabs dman pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the state of remaining in a place is inferior.

original: bskul ba dang bsdad pa'i don pha rol pos brda ma phrad na bskul ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: bskul ba dang bsdad pa'i don pha rol pos brda ma phrad na bskul ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: If the meaning of the effort and the remaining in a place are not understood by the other, it is not an effort.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bskul ba'i sgo drug po gang dag gsungs pa de dag ni mngon par smra ba dang legs par sbyor ba dang / zas skom dag gi dbang du byas nas re re la yang gnyis gnyis te drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bskul ba'i sgo drug po gang dag gsungs pa de dag ni mngon par smra ba dang legs par sbyor ba dang / zas skom dag gi dbang du byas nas re re la yang gnyis gnyis te drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The six doors of effort that are mentioned by the Blessed One are two each with regard to speaking, grammar, and food and drink, and thus there are six.

original: de la mngon par smra ba ni khyod 'ongs sam zhes zer ba la de'i phyir ro zhes zer ba dang / legs par 'ongs sam zhes zer ba la de'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'o //
analyzed: de la mngon par smra ba ni khyod 'ongs sam zhes zer ba la de'i phyir ro zhes zer ba dang / legs par 'ongs sam zhes zer ba la de'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'o //
