translated: The expression in the sense of direct statement refers to the statement for the sake of saying 'have you come?' and the statement for the sake of saying 'have you arrived well?'

original: legs par sbyor ba ni stan 'di la 'dug shig ces zer ba la de'i phyir ro zhes zer ba dang / rkang pa khrus shig ces zer ba la de'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'o //
analyzed: legs par sbyor ba ni stan 'di la 'dug shig ces zer ba la de'i phyir ro zhes zer ba dang / rkang pa khrus shig ces zer ba la de'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'o //
translated: The expression in the sense of proper application refers to the statement for the sake of saying 'sit on this seat,' and the statement for the sake of saying 'wash your feet.'

original: zas skom gyi dbang du byas pa ni zan zo shig ces zer ba la de'i phyir ro zhes zer ba dang / skom 'thungs shig ces zer ba la de'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de dag thams cad kyang so sor dbye bar bya ste /
analyzed: zas skom gyi dbang du byas pa ni zan zo shig ces zer ba la de'i phyir ro zhes zer ba dang / skom 'thungs shig ces zer ba la de'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de dag thams cad kyang so sor dbye bar bya ste /
translated: The expression in the sense of food and drink refers to the statement for the sake of saying 'eat,' and the statement for the sake of saying 'drink.' All of these should be distinguished.

original: sbyor ba gcig gis byas na ni drug po thams cad kyang bskul ba'i sgo gcig kho nar 'gyur bas de'i phyir so sor dbye bar bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba gcig gis byas na ni drug po thams cad kyang bskul ba'i sgo gcig kho nar 'gyur bas de'i phyir so sor dbye bar bya'o //
translated: If one were to say that they are all done by a single application, then all six would be only one door of instigation. Therefore, they should be distinguished.

original: sbyin par byed pa'i sems bsdu bar rjes su bsgrub pa khas ma blangs pa zhes smos pa ni zhal ta byed pas sbyin par byed pa'i sems bsdu bar rjes su bsgrub pa khas blangs pa la dge slong gis gos len pa la ltung ba med pa'i phyir te🔽/ sbyin par byed pa'i sems bsdu bar rjes su bsgrub pa khas blangs pa zhes bya ba ni dge slong gis sngar ji skad bstan pa'i rnam pa de dag gis zhal ta byed pa las gos kyi rnyed @259b pa ma grub cing re ba med par gyur nas sbyin
analyzed: sbyin par byed pa'i sems bsdu bar rjes su bsgrub pa khas ma blangs pa zhes smos pa ni zhal ta byed pas sbyin par byed pa'i sems bsdu bar rjes su bsgrub pa khas blangs pa la dge slong gis gos len pa la ltung ba med pa'i phyir te / sbyin par byed pa'i sems bsdu bar rjes su bsgrub pa khas blangs pa zhes bya ba ni dge slong gis sngar ji skad bstan pa'i rnam pa de dag gis zhal ta byed pa las gos kyi rnyed @259b pa ma grub cing re ba med par gyur nas sbyin
translated: The term not accepting a promise to collect the thought of the giver refers to a monk who has no offense for accepting cloth from a monastery attendant who has promised to collect the thought of the giver.

original: par byed pa'i sbyin bdag la zhal ta byed pas bdag la ci yang ma byin gyi khyod nyid shes par gyis shig ces bsgrags shing spangs par gyur zin pa'i 'og tu phyis zhal ta byed pas dge slong la gos 'bul bar byed na de'i tshe dge slong des
analyzed: par byed pa'i sbyin bdag la zhal ta byed pas bdag la ci yang ma byin gyi khyod nyid shes par gyis shig ces bsgrags shing spangs par gyur zin pa'i 'og tu phyis zhal ta byed pas dge slong la gos 'bul bar byed na de'i tshe dge slong des
translated: Accepting a promise to collect the thought of the giver means that if a monk has not obtained cloth from a monastery attendant through the previously explained process and has no hope of receiving it, he should inform the donor of the gift, saying, The monastery attendant has given me nothing at all.🔽You should know this.🔽If the monastery attendant later offers cloth to the monk, the monk should accept it.

original: zhal ta byed pa de la 'di skad ces kho bos sbyin bdag la zhal ta byed pas bdag la ci yang ma byin gyi khyod nyid shes par gyis shig ces gos spangs pa smras zin to zhes rjes su bsgrag par bya zhing de ltar gos spangs pa shes
analyzed: zhal ta byed pa de la 'di skad ces kho bos sbyin bdag la zhal ta byed pas bdag la ci yang ma byin gyi khyod nyid shes par gyis shig ces gos spangs pa smras zin to zhes rjes su bsgrag par bya zhing de ltar gos spangs pa shes
translated: The attendant should be told, I am the attendant of the benefactor, and he has not given me anything at all. You should know that I have already relinquished the robe.

original: par byas kyang gal te zhal ta byed pas de 'di skad ces 'phags pa bdag las gos 'di long shig dang / bdag gis sbyin bdag gi sems bsdu bar bya'o zhes khas len par byed na de'i tshe dge slong des zhal ta byed pa de las gos de glang bar bya'o //
analyzed: par byas kyang gal te zhal ta byed pas de 'di skad ces 'phags pa bdag las gos 'di long shig dang / bdag gis sbyin bdag gi sems bsdu bar bya'o zhes khas len par byed na de'i tshe dge slong des zhal ta byed pa de las gos de glang bar bya'o //
translated: If, despite the fact that the attendant has been informed that the robe has been relinquished, the attendant says, Noble one, take this robe from me, and I will reconcile the benefactor, then at that time the monk should take the robe from the attendant.

original: gos blangs pa'o zhes smos pa ni ma blangs pa la ltung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gos blangs pa'o zhes smos pa ni ma blangs pa la ltung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase having taken the robe is stated because there is no offense if it is not taken.

original: sbyor ba gcig gis gos gcig gam gnyis sam mang po zhig thob na yang ltung ba'i dngos gzhi gcig rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: sbyor ba gcig gis gos gcig gam gnyis sam mang po zhig thob na yang ltung ba'i dngos gzhi gcig rnam par gzhag go //
translated: If one obtains one, two, or many robes through a single action, then a single basis of the downfall is established.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te ji srid du bskur ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te ji srid du bskur ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor infraction. As long as one has begun the preparation for the actual downfall of forsaking the training, but has not reached the actual, one has a minor infraction.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o ;
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o ;
translated: For each of the various preparations for the actual downfall, one has a minor infraction.

original: / sbyin par byed pa dang pho nya dang zhal ta byed pa gsum char mi nyid ma yin pa dang / khyim pa nyid ma yin pa la nyes byas so //🔽mi ma yin pas sbyin par byed cing mi ma yin pa'i pho nya dang / mis rung bar byed na yang nyes byas so //🔽mi ma yin pas sbyin par byed cing mi'i pho nya dang / mi ma yin pas rung bar byed na yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: / sbyin par byed pa dang pho nya dang zhal ta byed pa gsum char mi nyid ma yin pa dang / khyim pa nyid ma yin pa la nyes byas so // mi ma yin pas sbyin par byed cing mi ma yin pa'i pho nya dang / mis rung bar byed na yang nyes byas so // mi ma yin pas sbyin par byed cing mi'i pho nya dang / mi ma yin pas rung bar byed na yang nyes byas so //
translated: If the one who gives, the messenger, and the one who makes the gift acceptable are not human, or are not householders, there is a minor infraction.🔽If a nonhuman gives, and a nonhuman is the messenger, and a human makes the gift acceptable, there is a minor infraction.🔽If a nonhuman gives, and a human is the messenger, and a nonhuman makes the gift acceptable, there is a minor infraction.

original: mis sbyin par byed cing mi ma yin pa'i pho nya dang mi ma yin pas rung bar byed na yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: mis sbyin par byed cing mi ma yin pa'i pho nya dang mi ma yin pas rung bar byed na yang nyes byas so //
translated: If a human gives, and a nonhuman is the messenger, and a nonhuman makes the gift acceptable, there is a minor infraction.

original: mis sbyin par byed cing mi'i pho nya dang / mi ma yin pas rung bar byed na yang nyes byas so //🔽mis sbyin par byed cing mi ma yin pa'i pho nya dang / mis rung bar byed na yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: mis sbyin par byed cing mi'i pho nya dang / mi ma yin pas rung bar byed na yang nyes byas so // mis sbyin par byed cing mi ma yin pa'i pho nya dang / mis rung bar byed na yang nyes byas so //
translated: If a human gives it, and a human messenger, and a non-human makes it suitable, there is an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If a human gives it, and a non-human messenger, and a human makes it suitable, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: mi ma yin pas sbyin par byed cing mi'i pho nya dang mis rung bar byed na yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: mi ma yin pas sbyin par byed cing mi'i pho nya dang mis rung bar byed na yang nyes byas so //
translated: If a non-human gives it, and a human messenger, and a human makes it suitable, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: khyim pa nyid dang khyim pa nyid ma yin pa'i 'gres la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: khyim pa nyid dang khyim pa nyid ma yin pa'i 'gres la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The same applies to a householder and a non-householder.

original: pho nyas byung ba'i mtha' rjes su brjod pa sngar byas pa ma smras par dge slong gis @260a * //
analyzed: pho nyas byung ba'i mtha' rjes su brjod pa sngar byas pa ma smras par dge slong gis @260a * //
translated: If a monk does not say what he has done before, and encourages a go-between,

original: zhal ta byed pa la skul par byed na nyes byas so //
analyzed: zhal ta byed pa la skul par byed na nyes byas so //
translated: there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: rung ba ma yin pa dbyig la sogs pa chos gos kyi rin dge slong nges pho nya la 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa pho nya dge slong dag ni gos kyi rin dag len du mi rung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis ma spangs
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa dbyig la sogs pa chos gos kyi rin dge slong nges pho nya la 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa pho nya dge slong dag ni gos kyi rin dag len du mi rung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis ma spangs
translated: If the monk messenger does not reject the unsuitable things such as jewels, which are the price of the Dharma robe, with the words, “Venerable messenger, it is not suitable for monks to receive the price of Dharma robes,”

original: par len na nyes byas so //
analyzed: par len na nyes byas so //
translated: and accepts them, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: bskul bar byas pa dang / phyogs su bsdad pa byas pas spang ba byas pa na zhal ta byed pas gos sbyin par byed pa'i tshe kho bos 'di yongs su spangs kyi song la sbyin bdag nyad la phyir byin cig ces de skad du yongs su spong bar mi byed par len na yang
analyzed: bskul bar byas pa dang / phyogs su bsdad pa byas pas spang ba byas pa na zhal ta byed pas gos sbyin par byed pa'i tshe kho bos 'di yongs su spangs kyi song la sbyin bdag nyad la phyir byin cig ces de skad du yongs su spong bar mi byed par len na yang
translated: If the messenger does not reject the robe by saying, “I have rejected this. Go and return it to the donor,” when the attendant gives him the robe after he has urged the donor and waited for a suitable time,

original: nyes byas so //🔽pho nyas ma dris par zhal ta byed pa ston na nyes byas so //
analyzed: nyes byas so // pho nyas ma dris par zhal ta byed pa ston na nyes byas so //
translated: he commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If the messenger shows the attendant without asking the donor, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: zhal ta byed pa'i lag na gos 'thob pa'i phyir re ba med pa nyid na sbyin bdag la ma sbran na nyes byas so //
analyzed: zhal ta byed pa'i lag na gos 'thob pa'i phyir re ba med pa nyid na sbyin bdag la ma sbran na nyes byas so //
translated: If the attendant has no hope of receiving the robe, and he does not inform the donor, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: bskul ba dang bsdad pa lhag pa rtsom ba'i tshe nyid na nyes byas so //
analyzed: bskul ba dang bsdad pa lhag pa rtsom ba'i tshe nyid na nyes byas so //
translated: When one is urged to do so and when one is sitting down to do it, then there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gos mi rung ba len pa dang thob pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: gos mi rung ba len pa dang thob pa la nyes byas so //
translated: There is an offense of wrong conduct in accepting or obtaining unsuitable cloth.

original: chung ngu len pa dang thob pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: chung ngu len pa dang thob pa la nyes byas so //
translated: There is an offense of wrong conduct in accepting or obtaining a small amount.

original: rgyu spun len pa dang thob pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: rgyu spun len pa dang thob pa la nyes byas so //
translated: There is an offense of wrong conduct in accepting or obtaining yarn.

original: rgyu spun gyi rang bzhin bal dang ras bal la sogs pa len pa dang thob pa la nyes byas so //🔽sbyin bdag dang pho nya dang zhal ta byed pa gsum char ram gnyis sam gcig ma ning dang mtshan gnyis pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: rgyu spun gyi rang bzhin bal dang ras bal la sogs pa len pa dang thob pa la nyes byas so // sbyin bdag dang pho nya dang zhal ta byed pa gsum char ram gnyis sam gcig ma ning dang mtshan gnyis pa la nyes byas so //
translated: There is an offense of wrong conduct in accepting or obtaining the natural products of yarn, such as wool, cotton, and so on.🔽There is an offense of wrong conduct in the three, the donor, the messenger, and the go-between, or in two or one of them, if they are neuter or have two genders.

original: de gsum char ram gnyis sam gcig gi phyi rol pa'i rab tu byung ba dang chos 'di pa'i rab tu byung ba dang ma chags pa dang nyams pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: de gsum char ram gnyis sam gcig gi phyi rol pa'i rab tu byung ba dang chos 'di pa'i rab tu byung ba dang ma chags pa dang nyams pa la nyes byas so //
translated: There is an offense of wrong conduct in the three, the donor, the messenger, and the go-between, or in two or one of them, if they are non-Buddhist renunciates, Buddhist renunciates, or those without attachment or who have lapsed.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The offense of preparation of a preparation is a minor offense. As many preparations as there are, there are that many preparations of preparations. The preparation of a preparation is also a minor offense, a minor offense.

original: de yang dang po yid la sems pa ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: de yang dang po yid la sems pa ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: Moreover, the first mental intention is the minor offense of the preparation of a preparation.

original: de nas lus dang ngag gi sbyor ba ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas dngos so //
analyzed: de nas lus dang ngag gi sbyor ba ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas dngos so //
translated: Then, the preparation of body and speech is the actual minor offense of preparation.

original: de nas mthar thug pa ni spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhi'o zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mthar thug pa ni spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhi'o zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Then, the final step is the actual offense of a partially concordant act.

original: ltung ba med pa ni bskul ba gsum dang bsdad pa gsum byed pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni bskul ba gsum dang bsdad pa gsum byed pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one makes three requests and stays for three days.

original: sbyin par byed pa'i sems bsdu bar rjes su bsgrub pa khas len pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: sbyin par byed pa'i sems bsdu bar rjes su bsgrub pa khas len pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one accepts the invitation to help collect the alms.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is a beginner, or insane, or deranged, or in pain because of an affliction.

original: @260b bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du bskur ba'i spang bar 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: @260b bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du bskur ba'i spang bar 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training rule is that a monk should train in not using any of the prohibited articles, in any situation, in any country.

original: ma grub na sbyin par byed pa la bsgrag par bya'o //
analyzed: ma grub na sbyin par byed pa la bsgrag par bya'o //
translated: If the article is not available, the monk should announce that fact to the donor.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is the same as before.

original: bskur ba'i spang ba ste bcu pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: bskur ba'i spang ba ste bcu pa bshad zin to /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the tenth downfall.

original: // / so sor thar pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel pa 'dul ba kun las btus pa /
analyzed: // / so sor thar pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel pa 'dul ba kun las btus pa /
translated: The Compendium of Determinations, a commentary on the monastic code

original: bam po bcu bzhi pa /
analyzed: bam po bcu bzhi pa /
translated: Book 14

original: sdom la / srin bal 'ba' zhig cha gnyis dang // drug dang mtho gang lam dang ni //
analyzed: sdom la / srin bal 'ba' zhig cha gnyis dang // drug dang mtho gang lam dang ni //
translated: Summary lines: Silk, two parts, six, and a cubit;

original: 'khru ba dang ni gser dngul dang // mngon mtshan can dang nyo tshong ngo //
analyzed: 'khru ba dang ni gser dngul dang // mngon mtshan can dang nyo tshong ngo //
translated: Washing, gold and silver, ostentatious, and buying and selling.

original: zhes bya ba ni bcu pa gnyis pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bcu pa gnyis pa yin te /
translated: This is the second part of the tenth chapter.

original: sdom la zhes bya ba'i dgos pa dang / tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sdom la zhes bya ba'i dgos pa dang / tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The purpose of the summary is the same as before.

original: bcu pa gnyis pa 'dis kyang spang ba'i ltung byed kyi chos bcu bstan te /🔽srin bal dang / bal na ga po 'ba' zhig dang / cha gnyis bsres pa dang / lo drug tu bcang ba dang / mtho gang dang ; bal thogs pa dang bal rmel du 'jug pa dang gser dngul la reg pa dang / mngon mtshan can gyis spyod pa dang /
analyzed: bcu pa gnyis pa 'dis kyang spang ba'i ltung byed kyi chos bcu bstan te / srin bal dang / bal na ga po 'ba' zhig dang / cha gnyis bsres pa dang / lo drug tu bcang ba dang / mtho gang dang ; bal thogs pa dang bal rmel du 'jug pa dang gser dngul la reg pa dang / mngon mtshan can gyis spyod pa dang /
translated: This second chapter of ten also teaches the ten downfalls that require relinquishment.

original: nyo tshong byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyo tshong byed pa'o //
translated: They are: silk, pure wool, a mixture of one part, keeping for six years, a cubit, carrying wool, having wool spun, handling gold and silver, acting with ostentation, and buying and selling.

original: de la srin bal gyi spang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: de la srin bal gyi spang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The origin story for the downfall of accepting silk is as follows. The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: de'i tshe na dge slong dag srin bal gyi stan sar pa byed pa dang / byed du 'jug ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe na dge slong dag srin bal gyi stan sar pa byed pa dang / byed du 'jug ste /
translated: At that time the monks were making new cushions of silk and having them made.

original: dge slong dag srin bal gyi stan sar pa byed pa dang / byed du 'jug pa na srin bal dkon zhing rin che pas bya ba mang ba dang / byed pa mang bar gyur cing /
analyzed: dge slong dag srin bal gyi stan sar pa byed pa dang / byed du 'jug pa na srin bal dkon zhing rin che pas bya ba mang ba dang / byed pa mang bar gyur cing /
translated: Monks, when they make new cushions stuffed with kapok or have them made, because kapok is rare and valuable, they do many actions and employ many people.

original: lung nod pa dang / klag pa dang / kha don dang / rnal 'byor dang / yid la bya ba dang / nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas kyang gtong bar byed /
analyzed: lung nod pa dang / klag pa dang / kha don dang / rnal 'byor dang / yid la bya ba dang / nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas kyang gtong bar byed /
translated: They give up receiving teachings, reading, reciting, practicing yoga, keeping things in mind, and the inner peace of the mind.

original: srin bal 'dod pa dang srin bal gyi don nyid du 'ongs pa dag bram ze dang / khyim bdag rnams la yang dang yang du rig par byed nas /
analyzed: srin bal 'dod pa dang srin bal gyi don nyid du 'ongs pa dag bram ze dang / khyim bdag rnams la yang dang yang du rig par byed nas /
translated: They repeatedly inform the brahmins and householders who want kapok and have come for the sake of kapok,

original: gzhan mu stegs can dag shes ldan dag sh'akya'i bu'i dge sbyong 'di dag ni srog gcod par byed pa dag ste srog gcod pa las ma log ma spangs so sor ma spangs pas des na srin bal gyi stan sar pa byed pa dang / byed du 'jug ste /
analyzed: gzhan mu stegs can dag shes ldan dag sh'akya'i bu'i dge sbyong 'di dag ni srog gcod par byed pa dag ste srog gcod pa las ma log ma spangs so sor ma spangs pas des na srin bal gyi stan sar pa byed pa dang / byed du 'jug ste /
translated: ‘Sirs, these śramaṇas, the sons of the Śākya, kill living beings. They have not given up killing living beings; they have not abandoned it, have not relinquished it. Therefore, they make new cushions stuffed with kapok and have them made.

original: de dag srin bal gyi stan sar pa byed pa dang byed du 'jug pas srin bal 'byung ba'i @261a * //
analyzed: de dag srin bal gyi stan sar pa byed pa dang byed du 'jug pas srin bal 'byung ba'i @261a * //
translated: They themselves or others spin the cotton, and they themselves or others weave it.

original: srin bu srog chags mang po'i tshogs bsgrubs shing srog gcod par byed de /
analyzed: srin bu srog chags mang po'i tshogs bsgrubs shing srog gcod par byed de /
translated: They kill many living beings, such as the cotton-producing insects.

original: su zhig dge sbyong mgo reg 'di dag la bsod snyoms sbyin pa dang / bya bar sems zhes smod par byed phyar kha gtong par byed /
analyzed: su zhig dge sbyong mgo reg 'di dag la bsod snyoms sbyin pa dang / bya bar sems zhes smod par byed phyar kha gtong par byed /
translated: “Who would give alms to these shaven-headed śramaṇas?”

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported the matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /🔽dge slong rnams la rmas nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de / dge slong rnams la rmas nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One, on this occasion, in this context, assembled the saṅgha of monks🔽and asked them,🔽“Monks, is it true that the monks are doing this?”

original: rnam grangs du mar smad de /
analyzed: rnam grangs du mar smad de /
translated: “Monks, this will give rise to many problems for laypeople.🔽The Blessed One, the Tathāgata, free from attachment, fully awakened, perfect in knowledge and conduct, well-gone, a knower of the world, incomparable leader of persons to be tamed, teacher of gods and humans, a buddha, a blessed lord, having seen the benefit for himself and seen the benefit for others, having seen the benefit for both himself and others, for the benefit and welfare of the world, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods, humans, and the beings of this great trichiliocosm, laid down the first training rule for the monks.

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas pa'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas pa'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: “Monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

original: yang dge slong gang srin pa la gyi stan sar pa byed na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang srin pa la gyi stan sar pa byed na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: Again, the Blessed One made a rule: Monks, if you make a new bed with silk, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place was Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni dge slong rab tu mang po /
analyzed: gang zag ni dge slong rab tu mang po /
translated: The persons were many monks.

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod zhe na /
translated: The affliction was desire.

original: nyes pa ni srin bal gyi stan sar pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni srin bal gyi stan sar pa byed pa'o //
translated: The offense was making a new bed with silk.

original: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //🔽srin bal gyi zhes bya ba ni dar gyi srin bu las byung ba'i srin bal gyi'o //
analyzed: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o // srin bal gyi zhes bya ba ni dar gyi srin bu las byung ba'i srin bal gyi'o //
translated: In this rule, monks means those who belong to this doctrine.🔽Silk means silk from silkworms.🔽A new bed means one of two kinds of beds.

original: stan sar pa zhes bya ba ni stan gnyis te /🔽nang tshangs can dang blings pa'o //
analyzed: stan sar pa zhes bya ba ni stan gnyis te / nang tshangs can dang blings pa'o //
translated: One has a frame and the other is a mat.

original: don 'dir ni gnyis ka yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: don 'dir ni gnyis ka yin par dgongs so //
translated: In this rule, both are intended.

original: sar ba zhes bya ba ni sar pa gnyis te gsar pas sar pa dang rnyed pas sar pa'o //
analyzed: sar ba zhes bya ba ni sar pa gnyis te gsar pas sar pa dang rnyed pas sar pa'o //
translated: New means one of two kinds of new: new by being new and new by being acquired.

original: don 'dir ni gsar pas sar pa yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: don 'dir ni gsar pas sar pa yin par dgongs so //
translated: In this rule, new by being new is intended.

original: byed na zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis byed dam gzhan byed du 'jug na'o //
analyzed: byed na zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis byed dam gzhan byed du 'jug na'o //
translated: If you make it means if you make it yourself or you have someone else make it.

original: spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni dngos po de spangs nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba bshags par bya ba ste /
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni dngos po de spangs nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba bshags par bya ba ste /
translated: A “consequence” is a downfall that must be confessed as a serious transgression after relinquishing the object.

original: des na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is called a “consequence.”

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is a downfall here?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, the characteristics of the downfalls, the non-downfalls, the trainings, and the restoration should be understood through the root text and commentary of the Pratimoksha Sutra.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis srin pa la sar pa'i chun po dang 'da' ba dang / phung po las stan nang tshangs can nam /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis srin pa la sar pa'i chun po dang 'da' ba dang / phung po las stan nang tshangs can nam /
translated: Here, the downfalls of the actual basis are as follows: A monk should not make a mat of black wool, or one that exceeds the right size, or one that is solid black.

original: blings pa rang gis byas sam /
analyzed: blings pa rang gis byas sam /
translated: He should not make a mat of wool that he has requested himself, or one that is mixed with cotton more than one-fourth.

original: gzhan byed du bcug na dang po bkram pa nyid kyi tshe na srin bal gyi spang @261b ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan byed du bcug na dang po bkram pa nyid kyi tshe na srin bal gyi spang @261b ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: If one causes another to do it, then at the very time of spreading it, one comes to have the actual basis of the offense of the kashaya of cotton down.

original: dge slong la srin bal gyi spang ba'i ltung byed byung na de ma spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
analyzed: dge slong la srin bal gyi spang ba'i ltung byed byung na de ma spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
translated: If a fully ordained monk has the offense of the kashaya of cotton down, if he does not abandon it, does not separate from it, and does not confess the offense,

original: spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par srin bal dang srin bal gyi stan de lta bu gzhan zhig rnyed na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'byung te /
analyzed: spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par srin bal dang srin bal gyi stan de lta bu gzhan zhig rnyed na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'byung te /
translated: or if he abandons it, but does not separate from it, and does not confess the offense, and then obtains another such kashaya of cotton down or cushion, that also is to be abandoned by the force of the former.

original: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But he does not come to have an offense.

original: dge slong gis srin bal gyi spang ba'i ltung byed byung la ji srid du spang ba'i dngos po las ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags par lhung bzed dam /🔽chos gos sam /
analyzed: dge slong gis srin bal gyi spang ba'i ltung byed byung la ji srid du spang ba'i dngos po las ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags par lhung bzed dam / chos gos sam /
translated: If a fully ordained monk has the offense of the kashaya of cotton down, for as long as he does not confess the thing to be abandoned, does not confess it individually, and does not confess the offense, he must not use a begging bowl,🔽robes,🔽a water strainer,🔽a water pot,

original: dra ba'am / phor bu'am /🔽ska rags sam /
analyzed: dra ba'am / phor bu'am /🔽ska rags sam /
translated: or a belt.

original: dge sbyong gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad gang yang rung ba gzhan nye bar 'jog na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad gang yang rung ba gzhan nye bar 'jog na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te //
translated: If he stores any other requisite of a monk, that is also abandoned by the power of the former.

original: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But he does not commit a downfall.

original: srin bal sar pa'i stan nang tshangs can dang blings pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: srin bal sar pa'i stan nang tshangs can dang blings pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in using a new woolen cloth that is not thick, has no fringe, and is not fully felted.

original: gsar pas sar pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: gsar pas sar pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in using a new woolen cloth that is not thick.

original: rang gis byas pa dang gzhan byed du bcug pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: rang gis byas pa dang gzhan byed du bcug pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in making it oneself or having someone else make it.

original: stan la ni bkram pa nyid byed pa mthar thug pa'i dang po yin pas der dgos pa'i srin bal 'byed pa dang / 'jig pa dang / rmel ba'i 'og rol du dang por bkram pa nyid la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: stan la ni bkram pa nyid byed pa mthar thug pa'i dang po yin pas der dgos pa'i srin bal 'byed pa dang / 'jig pa dang / rmel ba'i 'og rol du dang por bkram pa nyid la na smad pa med do //
translated: Since the mere spreading of a cloth on a seat is the first step in its use, there is no fault in spreading a new cloth on a seat for the first time, if it is necessary to do so in order to separate the wool, to repair it, or to felt it.

original: srin bal gyi rdzas bzang ngan dang mnyam pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: srin bal gyi rdzas bzang ngan dang mnyam pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in using a cloth that is equal in quality to the original cloth.

original: srin bal ma nyams pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: srin bal ma nyams pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in using a cloth that is not damaged.

original: srin bal dang bal nag po la sogs pa dkon zhing rin che ba cha mnyam pa bsres pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: srin bal dang bal nag po la sogs pa dkon zhing rin che ba cha mnyam pa bsres pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in mixing together cotton, black wool, etc., which are rare and valuable, in equal parts.

original: srin bal rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: srin bal rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in using cotton that is suitable.

original: stan gyi tshad ni gsum ste /
analyzed: stan gyi tshad ni gsum ste /
translated: The size of the mat is threefold:

original: chen po dang / 'bring dang / chung ngu'o //
analyzed: chen po dang / 'bring dang / chung ngu'o //
translated: large, medium, and small.

original: chen po'i srid ni khru phyed dang lnga chung ngu'i srid ni khru phyed dang gsum /🔽'bring gi srid ni de gnyis kyi bar te /
analyzed: chen po'i srid ni khru phyed dang lnga chung ngu'i srid ni khru phyed dang gsum / 'bring gi srid ni de gnyis kyi bar te /
translated: The large one is five cubits long and three cubits wide.

original: khru phyed dang bzhi'o //
analyzed: khru phyed dang bzhi'o //
translated: The medium one is four cubits long and two cubits wide.🔽The small one is three and a half cubits long and two and a half cubits wide.

original: de dag gi zheng tshad ni gding ba'i zheng dang tshad mnyam ste /🔽zhed du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho phyed dang do ste /
analyzed: de dag gi zheng tshad ni gding ba'i zheng dang tshad mnyam ste / zhed du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho phyed dang do ste /
translated: The width of all of them is the same as the width of the mat.🔽The width of the mat is one and a half cubits.

original: tha mal pa'i khru do dang sor drug go //
analyzed: tha mal pa'i khru do dang sor drug go //
translated: The small one is two cubits and six finger-widths.

original: srin bal gyi stan tshad de dag dang / de dag pas ltag pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: srin bal gyi stan tshad de dag dang / de dag pas ltag pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in making a cotton mat larger than these sizes.

original: yul gang na bal dkar po dkon zhing rin che la srin bal mod cing rin chung ba der ni srin bal gyi gnas su bal dkar po rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yul gang na bal dkar po dkon zhing rin che la srin bal mod cing rin chung ba der ni srin bal gyi gnas su bal dkar po rig par bya ste /
translated: In a place where white wool is rare and expensive, and cotton is abundant and cheap, then white wool should be known as the basis for cotton.🔽Thus, there is no offense in making a seat of cotton,

original: de ltar na srin bal gyi stan byed pa la ni ltung ba med la bal dkar po'i stan byed pa @262a * //🔽la ni skabs 'di'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //🔽'di'i byed pa po ni srin bal sar pa'i stan nang tshangs can dang blings pa tshad dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: de ltar na srin bal gyi stan byed pa la ni ltung ba med la bal dkar po'i stan byed pa @262a * // la ni skabs 'di'i ltung bar 'gyur ro // 'di'i byed pa po ni srin bal sar pa'i stan nang tshangs can dang blings pa tshad dang ldan pa'am /
translated: but there is an offense in making a seat of white wool in this context.🔽The agent of this is one who makes a new seat of cotton, with a lining and filling, of the proper measure,

original: de bas lhag par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas lhag par byed pa nyid do //
translated: or more than that.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the actual downfall occurs through five limbs:

original: srin bal dang / sar pa dang / stan dang / byas pa dang / byed pa mthar thug pa'i dang po bkram pa nyid do //
analyzed: srin bal dang / sar pa dang / stan dang / byas pa dang / byed pa mthar thug pa'i dang po bkram pa nyid do //
translated: cotton, new, seat, made, and completion of the action, the first being the spreading out.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If those limbs are incomplete, then there is an offense as appropriate.

original: de la srin bal zhes smos pa ni de las gzhan pa dag la kha cig la nyes pa med la /
analyzed: de la srin bal zhes smos pa ni de las gzhan pa dag la kha cig la nyes pa med la /
translated: In that regard, the mention of cotton is for the purpose of excluding other materials, for some are not faulty.

original: kha cig la nyes byas su gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha cig la nyes byas su gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that it is a minor offense for some.

original: sar pa zhes smos pa ni rnying pa dang nyams pa dag la nyes byas su gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sar pa zhes smos pa ni rnying pa dang nyams pa dag la nyes byas su gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “new” is stated because it is said that it is a minor offense to spread it on old or worn rugs.

original: stan zhes smos pa ni stan las gzhan pa gding ba la sogs pa dag la na smad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: stan zhes smos pa ni stan las gzhan pa gding ba la sogs pa dag la na smad pa'i phyir te /
translated: The term “seat” is stated because it is a minor offense to spread it on other things such as rugs.

original: gding ba dang stan ni tha dad de /
analyzed: gding ba dang stan ni tha dad de /
translated: Rugs and seats are different.

original: 'di ltar gding ba ni gos kyi ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gding ba ni gos kyi ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: Thus, rugs are the nature of cloth,

original: tshig rkyang dang sbyar ma zhes bya ba la sogs par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig rkyang dang sbyar ma zhes bya ba la sogs par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are called “single-layered” and “multi-layered.”

original: stan ni stan gyi ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: stan ni stan gyi ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: Seats are the nature of seats,

original: nang tshangs can dang blings pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang tshangs can dang blings pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the nature of cushions and benches.

original: dgos pa tha dad pa'i yang phyir te /
analyzed: dgos pa tha dad pa'i yang phyir te /
translated: They are different because they have different purposes.

original: stan ni grang ba'i gnyen po yin te /
analyzed: stan ni grang ba'i gnyen po yin te /
translated: Seats are antidotes to cold,

original: 'di ltar 'phrog phyogs dag tu grang bas gnod par gyur pa dag gi dbang du mdzad nas stan rjes su gnang ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'phrog phyogs dag tu grang bas gnod par gyur pa dag gi dbang du mdzad nas stan rjes su gnang ba yin la /
translated: because they were permitted for those who are afflicted by cold in the northern region.

original: gding ba ni mal stan g-yogs pa dang kun du bsrung ba dag gi dbang du mdzad nas rjes su gnang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gding ba ni mal stan g-yogs pa dang kun du bsrung ba dag gi dbang du mdzad nas rjes su gnang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Buddha permitted the use of a mat in consideration of the covering of bedding and the protection of the bedding.

original: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni rnam par 'byed pa las /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni rnam par 'byed pa las /
translated: Thus, the text of the Vinaya states:

original: gding ba ni so sor gding ba dang / kun du gding ba dang / nye bar gding ba zhes rgya cher gsungs la ;
analyzed: gding ba ni so sor gding ba dang / kun du gding ba dang / nye bar gding ba zhes rgya cher gsungs la ;
translated: The mat is a personal mat, a universal mat, and a nearby mat.

original: mdo sde las kyang gding ba phrag pas blangs nas 'gro bar bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: mdo sde las kyang gding ba phrag pas blangs nas 'gro bar bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The sutra also states: “One should carry the mat over the shoulder when traveling.”🔽When traveling on the road, one should carry a mat with a central opening, a cotton mat, and a thick mat over the shoulder.

original: lam du 'gro bas stan nang tshangs can dang / blings pa ras bal can dang / dbyam po dag phrag pas blangs nas khyer ba ni tshul ma yin pas de'i phyir gding ba dang stan ni tha dad do //
analyzed: lam du 'gro bas stan nang tshangs can dang / blings pa ras bal can dang / dbyam po dag phrag pas blangs nas khyer ba ni tshul ma yin pas de'i phyir gding ba dang stan ni tha dad do //
translated: Since this is improper, the mat and the seat are different.

original: byas pa zhes smos pa ni ma byas pa dang byed du ma bcug pa la ltung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byas pa zhes smos pa ni ma byas pa dang byed du ma bcug pa la ltung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “made” is used because there is no offense if one does not make or cause to be made.

original: byed pa mthar thug pa'i dang po bkram pa nyid ces smos pa ni stan byed pa la der gtogs pa'i byed pa ni mthar thug pa'i dang po ni srin bal bkram pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: byed pa mthar thug pa'i dang po bkram pa nyid ces smos pa ni stan byed pa la der gtogs pa'i byed pa ni mthar thug pa'i dang po ni srin bal bkram pa nyid yin te /
translated: The first of the final actions is spreading, because the action that belongs to the basis is the first of the final actions.

original: de tsam byas na dngos gzhir 'gyur zhing de phyin tshad gang @262b byed pa de ni de'i khongs su 'dus pa yin la /
analyzed: de tsam byas na dngos gzhir 'gyur zhing de phyin tshad gang @262b byed pa de ni de'i khongs su 'dus pa yin la /
translated: If one does that much, it becomes the actual basis. Whatever is done after that is included in that.

original: bkram pa nyid kyi sngon rol du 'byed pa dang 'jig pa dang / rmel ba dag ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bkram pa nyid kyi sngon rol du 'byed pa dang 'jig pa dang / rmel ba dag ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because separating, tearing, and sewing before spreading are preparatory offenses.

original: sbyor ba gcig gis srin bal gyi stan gcig gam gnyis sam mang po zhig byed na yang ltung ba'i dngos gzhi gcig rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: sbyor ba gcig gis srin bal gyi stan gcig gam gnyis sam mang po zhig byed na yang ltung ba'i dngos gzhi gcig rnam par gzhag go //
translated: If one makes one or two or many cotton mats with one preparation, then one is established in one actual basis of a downfall.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The downfall of preparation is an offense.

original: ji srid du srin bal gyi spang ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du srin bal gyi spang ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as one begins the preparation for the downfall of discarding cotton but has not reached the actual basis, it is an offense.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //🔽srin bal dang bal dkar po'am /🔽sha na'i ras ngal lam /
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o // srin bal dang bal dkar po'am / sha na'i ras ngal lam /
translated: For each of the various preparations that are undertaken, there is a single offense of wrong conduct.🔽If one makes a mat with a small amount of material mixed in, such as white wool,

original: gso bal la sogs pa'i rdzas nyung du dang bsres te stan byed pa nyid la nyes byas so //
analyzed: gso bal la sogs pa'i rdzas nyung du dang bsres te stan byed pa nyid la nyes byas so //
translated: cotton cloth, or silk, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: srin bal rnying pa dang nyams pa nyid la nyes byas so //
analyzed: srin bal rnying pa dang nyams pa nyid la nyes byas so //
translated: If one makes a mat with old or damaged cotton, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: stan las gzhan pa byed pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: stan las gzhan pa byed pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If one makes a mat from something other than the prescribed materials, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: byed pa mthar thug pa'i dang po 'grems pa'i mdun rol du 'byed pa dang / 'jig pa dang rmel ba dag la nyes byas so //
analyzed: byed pa mthar thug pa'i dang po 'grems pa'i mdun rol du 'byed pa dang / 'jig pa dang rmel ba dag la nyes byas so //
translated: If one spreads out the mat before the first part of the process of making it is completed, or if one cuts it, tears it, or weaves it, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: rgyu rung ba ma yin pa la nyes byas so //🔽tshad pas chung ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: rgyu rung ba ma yin pa la nyes byas so // tshad pas chung ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If one uses inappropriate materials, there is an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If one makes a mat that is smaller than the prescribed size, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The offense for the preparation of a preparation is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: There are as many preparations of a preparation as there are preparations.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The preparation is a preparation that is a minor offense, which is a minor offense.

original: de yang dang po yid la sems pa ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: de yang dang po yid la sems pa ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: Moreover, the first mental intention is a minor offense that is a preparation for a preparation.

original: de nas lus dang ngag gis sbyor ba ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas dngos so //
analyzed: de nas lus dang ngag gis sbyor ba ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas dngos so //
translated: Then, the preparation by means of body and speech is the actual minor offense that is a preparation.

original: de nas mthar thug pa ni spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhi'o zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mthar thug pa ni spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhi'o zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Then, the final step is the actual offense of a downfall that requires relinquishment.

original: ltung ba med pa ni byas zin pa rnyed pa dang / gzhan gyis byas pa la yongs su longs spyod pa dang / rnyed pa'i byi dor mngon par 'du byed pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni byas zin pa rnyed pa dang / gzhan gyis byas pa la yongs su longs spyod pa dang / rnyed pa'i byi dor mngon par 'du byed pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one uses what has already been used by another, if one uses what has been made by another, or if one makes use of what has been made by another.

original: stan gyi phyi shun gyi rdzas gzhan la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: stan gyi phyi shun gyi rdzas gzhan la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one uses the outer bark of a tree.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is a beginner, if one is insane, if one is deranged, or if one is overwhelmed by pain.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du srin bal gyi spang bar 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du srin bal gyi spang bar 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training rule is that a monk should train by not using a bed of cotton wool in any way, in any situation, in any country.

original: stan tha mal pa nang tshangs can dang / blings pa ras bal can dang / dbyam po zhes bya ba dag bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: stan tha mal pa nang tshangs can dang / blings pa ras bal can dang / dbyam po zhes bya ba dag bcang bar bya'o //
translated: He should use a regular seat, a seat with fringes, a seat with cotton wool, or a thick mat.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //🔽srin bal @263a * //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no // srin bal @263a * //
translated: The amendment is as before.

original: gyi spang ba ste bcu gcig pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: gyi spang ba ste bcu gcig pa bshad zin to /
translated: This is the rule on cotton wool, the eleventh.🔽The origin of the rule on black wool

original: // / bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi spang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: // / bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi spang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying at Jetavana, Anāthapiṇḍada’s Park near Śrāvastī,

original: de'i tshe dge slong dag lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi stan sar pa byed pa dang byed du 'jug ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe dge slong dag lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi stan sar pa byed pa dang byed du 'jug ste /
translated: when the monks made new sitting mats and had them made from black wool.

original: dge slong dag lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi stan sar pa byed pa dang / byed du 'jug pa na lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig dkon shing rin che bas bya ba mang ba dang byed pa mang bar gyur cing /
analyzed: dge slong dag lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi stan sar pa byed pa dang / byed du 'jug pa na lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig dkon shing rin che bas bya ba mang ba dang byed pa mang bar gyur cing /
translated: Monks, when you make or have others make new black wool rugs, you will have to go many times to the laypeople, the brahmans and householders, to ask for black wool, and you will have to ask for a lot of wool.

original: lung nod ba dang / klag pa dang / kha ton dang / rnal 'byor dang / yid la bya ba dang / nang gi sems gyi zhi gnas kyang gtong bar byed /
analyzed: lung nod ba dang / klag pa dang / kha ton dang / rnal 'byor dang / yid la bya ba dang / nang gi sems gyi zhi gnas kyang gtong bar byed /
translated: You will have to give up receiving teachings, reading, reciting, practicing, keeping things in mind, and the inner mental practice of shamatha.

original: lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig 'dod pa dang / lug nag po 'ba' zhig gi don nyid du 'ongs pa dag bram ze dang / khyim bdag rnams la yang dang yang du rig par byed nas dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi stan sar pa byed pa dang byed du 'jug ste /
analyzed: lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig 'dod pa dang / lug nag po 'ba' zhig gi don nyid du 'ongs pa dag bram ze dang / khyim bdag rnams la yang dang yang du rig par byed nas dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi stan sar pa byed pa dang byed du 'jug ste /
translated: You will have to go many times to the laypeople, the brahmans and householders, to ask for black wool, and you will have to ask for a lot of wool.

original: dge slong dag lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi stan sar pa byed pa dang / byed du 'jug pa na lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig dkon zhing rin che bas bya ba mang ba dang byed pa mang bar gyur cing /
analyzed: dge slong dag lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi stan sar pa byed pa dang / byed du 'jug pa na lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig dkon zhing rin che bas bya ba mang ba dang byed pa mang bar gyur cing /
translated: Monks, when you make or have others make a new mat of black wool alone, since black wool alone is rare and valuable, you will have many activities and much work.

original: lung nod pa dang klag pa dang / kha ton dang / rnal 'byor dang yid la bya ba dang nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas kyang gtong bar byed /
analyzed: lung nod pa dang klag pa dang / kha ton dang / rnal 'byor dang yid la bya ba dang nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas kyang gtong bar byed /
translated: You will give up recitation, reading, chanting, yoga, mental attention, and inner mental tranquility.

original: lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig 'dod pa dang / lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi don nyid du 'ongs pa dang bram ze dang khyim bdag rnams la yang dang yang du rig par byed ces smod par byed /
analyzed: lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig 'dod pa dang / lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi don nyid du 'ongs pa dang bram ze dang khyim bdag rnams la yang dang yang du rig par byed ces smod par byed /
translated: You will want only black wool alone, and you will come for the sake of only black wool alone. You will repeatedly inform brahmins and householders.

original: phyar kha gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar kha gtong bar byed /
translated: You will criticize,🔽and you will gossip.”

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: Then the Blessed One, with this incident and with this cause and with this occasion, gathered the saṅgha of monks.

original: dge slong rnams la rmas nas rnam grangs du mar smad de /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la rmas nas rnam grangs du mar smad de /
translated: Having questioned the monks, he censured them in many ways.

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas /
translated: He saw ten benefits of establishing training rules for his disciples:

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: “My disciples should recite this training rule like this:

original: yang dge slong gang lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi stan sar pa byed na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi stan sar pa byed na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: ‘If a monk makes a new sitting mat entirely of black wool, it is to be forfeited.’”

original: yul @263b ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul @263b ni mnyan yod /
translated: The location is Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni dge slong rab tu mang po /
analyzed: gang zag ni dge slong rab tu mang po /
translated: The individuals are many monks.

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod zhe na /
translated: The affliction is any of the three.

original: nyes pa ni lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi stan sar pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi stan sar pa byed pa'o //
translated: The offense is making a new sitting mat entirely of black wool.

original: de la yang dge slong gar zhes bya ba ni chos 'di ba'o //
analyzed: de la yang dge slong gar zhes bya ba ni chos 'di ba'o //
translated: Here, “monk” refers to one who has this dharma.

original: lug bal zhes bya ba ni lug gi bal lo //
analyzed: lug bal zhes bya ba ni lug gi bal lo //
translated: “Wool” refers to the wool of sheep.

original: nag po 'ba' zhig gi zhes bya ba ni nag po bzhi ste /
analyzed: nag po 'ba' zhig gi zhes bya ba ni nag po bzhi ste /
translated: “Only black” means the four black ones.

original: rang bzhin gyis gnag pa dang / sngo bas gnag pa dang / 'dam kha dang / kham pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis gnag pa dang / sngo bas gnag pa dang / 'dam kha dang / kham pa'o //
translated: They are naturally black, dyed black, muddy, and dusty.

original: stan zhes bya ba ni stan gnyis te /
analyzed: stan zhes bya ba ni stan gnyis te /
translated: “Seat” means the two seats.

original: nang tshangs can dang / blings pa'o //
analyzed: nang tshangs can dang / blings pa'o //
translated: They are the one with a hole in the middle and the one with a border.

original: don 'dir ni blings pa yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: don 'dir ni blings pa yin par dgongs so //
translated: In this context, the intended meaning is the one with a border.

original: sar pa zhes bya ba ni sar pa gnyis te gsar pas sar pa dang rnyed pas sar pa'o //
analyzed: sar pa zhes bya ba ni sar pa gnyis te gsar pas sar pa dang rnyed pas sar pa'o //
translated: “New” means the two new ones: new because it is new and new because it is obtained.

original: don 'dir ni gsar pas sar pa yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: don 'dir ni gsar pas sar pa yin par dgongs so //
translated: In this context, the intended meaning is new because it is new.

original: byed na zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis byed dam gzhan byed du 'jug na'o //
analyzed: byed na zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis byed dam gzhan byed du 'jug na'o //
translated: “If he makes” means if he makes it himself or has someone else make it.

original: spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni dngos po de spangs nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba bshags par bya ba ste /
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni dngos po de spangs nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba bshags par bya ba ste /
translated: “It becomes a downfall that requires confession and relinquishment” means that after relinquishing that object, he must acknowledge the downfall that is a downfall that requires confession.

original: des na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is called a downfall that requires confession and relinquishment.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is a downfall in this context?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should understand the characteristics of this training rule by means of the main part, the preparatory stage, the preparatory stage of the preparatory stage, downfalls, non-downfalls, what is to be trained in, and restoration.

original: de la bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi spang ba 'di dang ; sngar srin bal gyi spang ba'i rnam pa bstan pa'i gnas skabs thams cad 'dra ste /
analyzed: de la bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi spang ba 'di dang ; sngar srin bal gyi spang ba'i rnam pa bstan pa'i gnas skabs thams cad 'dra ste /
translated: In this training rule on black wool, the preparatory stage and all the situations in which downfalls are and are not incurred are the same as in the training rule on silk.

original: khyad par du na sngar srin bal zhes bya ba de'i gnas su 'dir /
analyzed: khyad par du na sngar srin bal zhes bya ba de'i gnas su 'dir /
translated: The only difference is that in the previous training rule the word “silk” is used,

original: bal nag po 'ba' zhig ces bya ba'i ming gzhan brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: bal nag po 'ba' zhig ces bya ba'i ming gzhan brjod par bya ste /
translated: while in this training rule the word “black wool” is used.

original: de'i phyir lug gi bal nag po 'ba' zhig dag go zhes bya ba smras so ;
analyzed: de'i phyir lug gi bal nag po 'ba' zhig dag go zhes bya ba smras so ;
translated: Therefore, the root text says, “black wool of sheep.”

original: / de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltur ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis lug bal nag po sar pa 'ba' zhig gi chun po dang 'dra ba dang / phung po las stan blings pa rang gis byas sam gzhan byed du bcug na dang po bkram pa nyid kyi tshe na bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltur ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis lug bal nag po sar pa 'ba' zhig gi chun po dang 'dra ba dang / phung po las stan blings pa rang gis byas sam gzhan byed du bcug na dang po bkram pa nyid kyi tshe na bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the actual basis of the offense of the black wool is as follows: If a monk himself or someone else at his bidding weaves a mat from black wool alone, new and sheared, then the actual basis of the offense of discarding the black wool occurs at the very moment when it is first spread out.

original: dge slong la bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi spang ba'i ltung byed byung na /🔽de ma spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /🔽spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
analyzed: dge slong la bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi spang ba'i ltung byed byung na / de ma spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram / spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
translated: If a monk has committed the offense of discarding the black wool,🔽if he has not discarded it and has not separated from it, and has not confessed the offense,

original: spangs shing bral bar byas la ltung ba ma @264a * //
analyzed: spangs shing bral bar byas la ltung ba ma @264a * //
translated: or if he has discarded it but has not separated from it, and has not confessed the offense,

original: bshags par lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig dang / lus bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi stan de lta bu gzhan zhig rnyed na /
analyzed: bshags par lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig dang / lus bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi stan de lta bu gzhan zhig rnyed na /
translated: or if he has discarded it and has separated from it, but has not confessed the offense, and then obtains another mat of black wool alone or of black wool mixed with white wool,

original: de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, that is abandoned by the power of the former.

original: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It does not become a downfall from that.

original: dge slong gis bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi spang ba'i ltung byed byung la /
analyzed: dge slong gis bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi spang ba'i ltung byed byung la /
translated: A fully ordained monk commits a downfall of abandoning black wool.

original: ji srid du spang ba'i dngos po las ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags par lhung bzed dam /
analyzed: ji srid du spang ba'i dngos po las ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags par lhung bzed dam /
translated: As long as he does not confess the thing to be abandoned and does not individually confess it, if he keeps a begging bowl,

original: chos gos sam /🔽dra ba'am / phor bu'am /
analyzed: chos gos sam / dra ba'am / phor bu'am /
translated: a Dharma robe,🔽a water strainer,🔽a water pot,

original: ska rags sam /
analyzed: ska rags sam /
translated: a belt,

original: dge sbyong gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad gang yang rung ba gzhan nye bar 'jog na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad gang yang rung ba gzhan nye bar 'jog na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
translated: or any other requisite of a renunciate, that is also abandoned by the power of the former.

original: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It does not become a downfall from that.

original: lug bal nag po sar pa 'ba' zhig gi stan blings pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: lug bal nag po sar pa 'ba' zhig gi stan blings pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in making a mat from black sheep’s wool alone.

original: ci zhig gis nag por gyur pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig gis nag por gyur pa yin zhe na /
translated: By what does it become black?

original: nag po bzhi ste rang bzhin gyis gnag pa dang / rang bzhin gyis sngo ba dang / rang bzhin gyis 'dam kha dang rang bzhin gyis kham pa ste /
analyzed: nag po bzhi ste rang bzhin gyis gnag pa dang / rang bzhin gyis sngo ba dang / rang bzhin gyis 'dam kha dang rang bzhin gyis kham pa ste /
translated: There are four kinds of black: naturally black, naturally blue, naturally brown, and naturally gray.

original: de dag la na smad ba med do //
analyzed: de dag la na smad ba med do //
translated: There is no blame in those.

original: gsar pas sar pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: gsar pas sar pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no blame in a new one for a new one.

original: rang gis byas pa dang / gzhan byed du bcug pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: rang gis byas pa dang / gzhan byed du bcug pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no blame in making it oneself or having someone else do it.

original: stan la ni bkram pa nyid byed pa mthar thug pa'i dang po yin pas /
analyzed: stan la ni bkram pa nyid byed pa mthar thug pa'i dang po yin pas /
translated: As for the mat, spreading it is the first step in the final stage.

original: der dgos pa'i lug nag po 'ba' zhig 'byed pa dang / 'jig pa dang / rmel ba'i 'og rol du dang po bkram pa nyid la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: der dgos pa'i lug nag po 'ba' zhig 'byed pa dang / 'jig pa dang / rmel ba'i 'og rol du dang po bkram pa nyid la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no blame in separating, destroying, or combing the black wool that is necessary for that, before spreading it for the first time.

original: lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi rdzas bzang ngan dang mnyam pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi rdzas bzang ngan dang mnyam pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no blame in equalizing the good and bad materials of black wool alone.

original: lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig ma nyams pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig ma nyams pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no blame in using undamaged black wool alone.

original: lug bal nag po dang srin bal la sogs pa dkon zhing rin che ba cha mnyam par bsres pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: lug bal nag po dang srin bal la sogs pa dkon zhing rin che ba cha mnyam par bsres pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no blame in mixing equal parts of rare and precious black wool, cotton fluff, and so on.

original: lug bal nag po rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: lug bal nag po rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no blame in using suitable black wool.

original: stan gyi tshad ni gsum ste /
analyzed: stan gyi tshad ni gsum ste /
translated: The size of the mat is three cubits in length and one and a half cubits in width.

original: chen po dang / 'bring dang / chung ngu'o //
analyzed: chen po dang / 'bring dang / chung ngu'o //
translated: The large, medium, and small.

original: chen po'i srid ni khru phyed dang lnga /
analyzed: chen po'i srid ni khru phyed dang lnga /
translated: The large is five cubits and a half.

original: chung ngu'i srid ni khru phyed dang gsum /
analyzed: chung ngu'i srid ni khru phyed dang gsum /
translated: The small is three cubits and a half.

original: 'bring gi srid ni de gnyis kyi bar te khru byed dang bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'bring gi srid ni de gnyis kyi bar te khru byed dang bzhi'o //
translated: The medium is between those two, four cubits and two🔽handspans.

original: de dag gi zheng tshad ni gding ba'i zheng dang mnyam ste /
analyzed: de dag gi zheng tshad ni gding ba'i zheng dang mnyam ste /
translated: The width of these is the same as the width of the mat.

original: zheng du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho phyed dang do ste tha mal pa'i khru do dang sor drug go //
analyzed: zheng du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho phyed dang do ste tha mal pa'i khru do dang sor drug go //
translated: The width is one and a half cubits of the Sugata, two cubits and six finger lengths of an ordinary person.

original: lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi stan tshad de dag dang / de dag las lhag pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi stan tshad de dag dang / de dag las lhag pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in a mat of pure black wool that is of these measurements or larger.

original: @264b yul gang na bal dkar po dkon zhing rin che ba la bal nag po mod cing rin chung ba der ni bal nag po'i gnas su bal dkar por rig par bya ste /
analyzed: @264b yul gang na bal dkar po dkon zhing rin che ba la bal nag po mod cing rin chung ba der ni bal nag po'i gnas su bal dkar por rig par bya ste /
translated: In a place where white wool is rare and expensive, but black wool is common and cheap, white wool should be known as the basis for black wool.

original: de ltar na bal nag po phyed pas lhag pa la ni ltung ba med la /
analyzed: de ltar na bal nag po phyed pas lhag pa la ni ltung ba med la /
translated: Thus, there is no offense in having more than half black wool.

original: bal dkar po phyed pas lhag pa la ni skabs 'di'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bal dkar po phyed pas lhag pa la ni skabs 'di'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is more than half black wool, then there is an offense in this context.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni lug bal nag po sar pa 'ba' zhig gi stan blings pa tshad dang ldan pa dang / de bas lhag par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni lug bal nag po sar pa 'ba' zhig gi stan blings pa tshad dang ldan pa dang / de bas lhag par byed pa nyid do //
translated: The agent of this is one who makes a mat of new black wool alone, of the right size, and more than that.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, there are five limbs for the downfall of the basis:

original: lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig dang / sar pa dang / stan dang byas pa dang / byed pa mthar thug pa'i dang po bkram pa nyid do /
analyzed: lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig dang / sar pa dang / stan dang byas pa dang / byed pa mthar thug pa'i dang po bkram pa nyid do /
translated: new black wool alone, a mat, making it, and the completion of the making, the first is the spreading out.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If those limbs are incomplete, then there is a downfall of a partial defeat, as is appropriate.

original: de la lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig ces smos pa ni de las gzhan pa dag la /🔽kha cig la nyes pa med la /
analyzed: de la lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig ces smos pa ni de las gzhan pa dag la / kha cig la nyes pa med la /
translated: In that regard, the statement “new black wool alone” is because there is no offense in some other cases.

original: kha cig la nyes byas su gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha cig la nyes byas su gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because it is said that there is an offense of wrong conduct in some cases.

original: sar pa zhes smos pa ni rnying pa dang nyams pa dag la nyes byas su gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sar pa zhes smos pa ni rnying pa dang nyams pa dag la nyes byas su gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement “new” is because it is said that there is an offense of wrong conduct in the case of old and worn out wool.

original: stan zhes smos pa ni stan las gzhan pa gding ba la sogs pa dag la na smad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stan zhes smos pa ni stan las gzhan pa gding ba la sogs pa dag la na smad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “seat” is mentioned because it is reprehensible to use a mat or the like other than a seat.

original: byas pas zhes smos pa ni ma byas pa dang byed du ma bcug pa la ltung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byas pas zhes smos pa ni ma byas pa dang byed du ma bcug pa la ltung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “made” is mentioned because there is no offense if one does not make it or does not cause it to be made.

original: byed pa mthar thug pa'i dang po bkram pa nyid ces smos pa ni stan byed pa la der gtogs pa'i byed pa mthar thug pa'i dang po ni lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig bkram pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: byed pa mthar thug pa'i dang po bkram pa nyid ces smos pa ni stan byed pa la der gtogs pa'i byed pa mthar thug pa'i dang po ni lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig bkram pa nyid yin te /
translated: The term “the first stage of completion of the making of the seat is the spreading of the black wool alone” means that in the making of the seat, the first stage of completion of the making that is included in that is the spreading of black wool alone.

original: de tsam byas na dngos gzhir 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de tsam byas na dngos gzhir 'gyur zhing /
translated: If one does just that, it becomes the actual basis of the offense.

original: de phyin chad gang byed pa de ni de'i khongs su 'dus pa yin la /
analyzed: de phyin chad gang byed pa de ni de'i khongs su 'dus pa yin la /
translated: Whatever is done after that is included in that.

original: bkram pa nyid kyi sngon rol du 'byed pa dang ; 'jig pa dang / rmel ba dag ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bkram pa nyid kyi sngon rol du 'byed pa dang ; 'jig pa dang / rmel ba dag ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The splitting, tearing, and patching before the spreading is a preparation that is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba gcig gis bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi stan gcig gam gnyis sam mang po zhig byed na yang ltung ba'i dngos gzhi gcig rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: sbyor ba gcig gis bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi stan gcig gam gnyis sam mang po zhig byed na yang ltung ba'i dngos gzhi gcig rnam par gzhag go //
translated: If one makes a mat of black wool alone, either one or two or many, with one performance, then one is established in the actual basis of a downfall.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor offense.

original: ji srid du bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi spang ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi spang ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as one has begun the preparation for the offense of abandoning black wool alone, but has not reached the actual basis, it is a minor offense.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each performance of the actual basis, there is one minor offense.

original: bal nag po dang bal dkar po'am sha na'i ras bal lam /
analyzed: bal nag po dang bal dkar po'am sha na'i ras bal lam /
translated: If one mixes a small amount of white wool or silk or cotton wool or

original: gso bal la sogs pa'i rdzas @265a * //
analyzed: gso bal la sogs pa'i rdzas @265a * //
translated: wool from goats or sheep, etc.

original: nyung du dang bsres te stan byed pa nyid la nyes sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //🔽de byas so //
analyzed: nyung du dang bsres te stan byed pa nyid la nyes sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o // de byas so //
translated: with black wool and makes a mat, then the performance of the preparation is also a minor offense, a subtle minor offense.

original: stan las gzhan pa dag byed pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: stan las gzhan pa dag byed pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If one makes something other than a mat, it is a minor offense.

original: byed pa mthar thug pa'i dang po 'grems pa'i mdun rol du 'byed pa dang / 'jig pa dang / rmel bdag la nyes byas so //
analyzed: byed pa mthar thug pa'i dang po 'grems pa'i mdun rol du 'byed pa dang / 'jig pa dang / rmel bdag la nyes byas so //
translated: The first of the final acts is the offense of wrong conduct for separating the robes before the distribution at the beginning of the summer retreat.

original: rgyu rung ba ma yin pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: rgyu rung ba ma yin pa la nyes byas so //
translated: There is an offense of wrong conduct for using unsuitable materials.

original: tshad pas chung ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: tshad pas chung ba la nyes byas so //
translated: There is an offense of wrong conduct for making robes that are smaller than the prescribed size.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /🔽sbyor ba ji snyed ba la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste / sbyor ba ji snyed ba la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
