translated: The offense of wrong conduct for preparation is a minor offense.🔽There are as many offenses of wrong conduct for preparation as there are preparations.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The offense of wrong conduct for the preparation for preparation is also a minor offense.

original: de yang dang po yid la sems pa ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: de yang dang po yid la sems pa ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: Moreover, the initial mental act is the minor offense of wrong conduct for preparation.

original: de nas lus dang ngag gis sbyor ba ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas dngos so //
analyzed: de nas lus dang ngag gis sbyor ba ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas dngos so //
translated: Then, the preparation with body and speech is the actual offense of wrong conduct for preparation.

original: de nas mthar thug pa ni spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhi'o zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mthar thug pa ni spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhi'o zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Then, the final act is the actual offense entailing expulsion.

original: ltung ba med pa ni byas zin pa rnyed pa dang / gzhan gyis byas pa la yongs su longs spyad pa dang / rnying pa'i byi dor mngon par 'du byed pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni byas zin pa rnyed pa dang / gzhan gyis byas pa la yongs su longs spyad pa dang / rnying pa'i byi dor mngon par 'du byed pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one uses what has already been made, if one uses what was made by another, or if one makes a new one from an old one.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense for a beginner, for one who is insane, for one who is deranged, or for one who is overwhelmed by pain.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi spang bar 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi spang bar 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training rule is that a monk should train by not using any black wool in any way, not using any wool at all.

original: stan tha mal pa nang tshangs can dang blings pa ras bal can dang / dbyam po zhes bya ba dag bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: stan tha mal pa nang tshangs can dang blings pa ras bal can dang / dbyam po zhes bya ba dag bcang bar bya'o //
translated: He should use a simple seat with a lining, a cotton lining, or a woolen lining.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is the same as before.

original: bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi spang ba ste /
analyzed: bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi spang ba ste /
translated: This is the training rule on using only black wool.

original: bcu gnyis pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: bcu gnyis pa bshad zin to /
translated: The twelfth is finished.

original: // / cha gnyis bsres pa'i spang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: // / cha gnyis bsres pa'i spang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi stan sar pa mi bya'o zhes gsungs pas ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi stan sar pa mi bya'o zhes gsungs pas ;
translated: The Blessed One said, “Monks should not make new sitting mats entirely of black wool.”

original: de dag bal dkar po dang 'khob bal cung zhig bcug nas lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi stan sar pa byed pa dang byed du 'jug ste /
analyzed: de dag bal dkar po dang 'khob bal cung zhig bcug nas lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi stan sar pa byed pa dang byed du 'jug ste /
translated: So they put a little white wool and a little goat hair into black wool and made new sitting mats entirely of black wool, or had them made.

original: des kyang de dag bya ba mang ba dang byed pa mang bar gyur cing /
analyzed: des kyang de dag bya ba mang ba dang byed pa mang bar gyur cing /
translated: Because of that, they had many things to do and many activities.

original: lung nod pa dang / klag pa dang / kha ton dang / rnal 'byor dang yid la bya ba dang / @265b nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas kyang gtong bar byed /
analyzed: lung nod pa dang / klag pa dang / kha ton dang / rnal 'byor dang yid la bya ba dang / @265b nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas kyang gtong bar byed /
translated: They neglected to recite scriptures, to read them, to chant them, to practice yoga, to pay attention to them, and to cultivate inner mental calm.

original: de 'dod pa dang de'i don nyid du 'ongs pa dag bram ze dang khyim bdag rnams la yang dang yang du rig par byed nas /
analyzed: de 'dod pa dang de'i don nyid du 'ongs pa dag bram ze dang khyim bdag rnams la yang dang yang du rig par byed nas /
translated: When the monks who had come for that purpose and for that reason told the brahmins and householders again and again,🔽the monks with few desires complained and criticized them,

original: dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag bal dkar po dang 'khob bal cung zhig bcug nas /
analyzed: dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag bal dkar po dang 'khob bal cung zhig bcug nas /
translated: “Why are the monks adding a little white wool and black wool

original: lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi stan sar pa byed pa dang byed du 'jug ste /
analyzed: lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi stan sar pa byed pa dang byed du 'jug ste /
translated: and then having new woolen garments made that are mostly black?

original: des kyang bya ba mang ba dang / byed pa mang bar gyur cing /
analyzed: des kyang bya ba mang ba dang / byed pa mang bar gyur cing /
translated: Because of that, they have many activities and much work.

original: lung nod pa dang / klag pa dang / kha ton dang / rnal 'byor dang / yid la bya ba dang nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas kyang gtong bar byed /
analyzed: lung nod pa dang / klag pa dang / kha ton dang / rnal 'byor dang / yid la bya ba dang nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas kyang gtong bar byed /
translated: They give up receiving teachings, reading, reciting, yoga, mental attention, and inner mental tranquility.

original: de 'dod pa dang de'i don nyid du 'ongs pa dag bram ze dang khyim bdag rnams la yang dang yang du rig par byed ces smos par byed /🔽phyar kha gtong bar byed /
analyzed: de 'dod pa dang de'i don nyid du 'ongs pa dag bram ze dang khyim bdag rnams la yang dang yang du rig par byed ces smos par byed / phyar kha gtong bar byed /
translated: When the monks who had come for that purpose and for that reason told the brahmins and householders again and again, they said,🔽‘They are boasting.🔽They are talking.🔽’

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de /
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de /
translated: At that time,

original: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang ; gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang ; gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: Then the Blessed One, on this occasion, for this purpose, and with this pretext, assembled the community of monks and asked them,

original: dge slong rnams la rmas nas /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la rmas nas /
translated: “Monks, is it true that the monks are doing this?”

original: rnam grangs du stan gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam grangs du stan gnyis te /
translated: “There are two kinds of mats:

original: nang tshangs can dang blings pa'o //
analyzed: nang tshangs can dang blings pa'o //
translated: the woolen and the cotton.

original: don 'dir ni gzigs pas /
analyzed: don 'dir ni gzigs pas /
translated: In this case, the Blessed One saw the meaning and said,

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: “Monks, my disciples should recite this training rule:

original: dge slong gis stan sar pa byed pa na cha gnyis ni lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig las gzhug par bya /
analyzed: dge slong gis stan sar pa byed pa na cha gnyis ni lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig las gzhug par bya /
translated: ‘When a monk makes a new mat, he should use black sheep’s wool for two-thirds of it,

original: gsum pa ni dkar po las /
analyzed: gsum pa ni dkar po las /
translated: white for one-third,

original: bzhi pa ni 'khob bal las gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni 'khob bal las gzhug par bya'o //
translated: and brown for the border.

original: gal te dge slong gis cha gnyis lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig las ma bcug gam /
analyzed: gal te dge slong gis cha gnyis lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig las ma bcug gam /
translated: If a monk does not use black sheep’s wool for two-thirds of a new mat,

original: gsum pa dkar po las /
analyzed: gsum pa dkar po las /
translated: white for one-third,

original: bzhi pa 'khob bal las ma bcug par stan sar pa byed na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: bzhi pa 'khob bal las ma bcug par stan sar pa byed na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: The fourth is a downfall through accepting black wool and then making a new mat without adding white wool.

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place is Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni dge slong rab tu mang po /
analyzed: gang zag ni dge slong rab tu mang po /
translated: The person is a monk.

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod zhe na /
translated: The affliction is any of the three.

original: nyes pa ni bal dkar po dang 'khob bal chung zhig bcug nas lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi stan sar pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni bal dkar po dang 'khob bal chung zhig bcug nas lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi stan sar pa byed pa'o //
translated: The action is to accept black wool and then make a new mat of only black wool, adding a small amount of white wool or black wool from sheep.

original: de la dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni chos 'di bas so //
analyzed: de la dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni chos 'di bas so //
translated: The monk is one who has taken up this rule.

original: stan zhes bya ba ni stan gnyis te /
analyzed: stan zhes bya ba ni stan gnyis te /
translated: A mat is of two kinds:

original: nang tshangs can dang blings pa'o //
analyzed: nang tshangs can dang blings pa'o //
translated: one with a lining and one without.

original: don 'dir ni blings pa yin par gsungs so //
analyzed: don 'dir ni blings pa yin par gsungs so //
translated: In this context, it is a mat without a lining.

original: sar pa zhes bya ba ni sar pa gnyis te /🔽gsar @266a * //
analyzed: sar pa zhes bya ba ni sar pa gnyis te / gsar @266a * //
translated: New is of two kinds:

original: pas sar pa dang / rnyed pas sar pa'o //
analyzed: pas sar pa dang / rnyed pas sar pa'o //
translated: new in the sense of new and new in the sense of obtained.

original: don 'dir ni gsar pas sar pa yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: don 'dir ni gsar pas sar pa yin par dgongs so //
translated: In this context, it means new in the sense of new.

original: byed na zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis byed dam gzhan byed du 'jug na'o //
analyzed: byed na zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis byed dam gzhan byed du 'jug na'o //
translated: To make is to make it oneself or to have someone else make it.

original: cha gnyis ni lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig las gzhug par bya zhes bya ba la cha gnyis zhes bya ba ni rangs pa gcig la bzhi cha bzhir bsres pa'i bzhi cha gnyis te phyed do //
analyzed: cha gnyis ni lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig las gzhug par bya zhes bya ba la cha gnyis zhes bya ba ni rangs pa gcig la bzhi cha bzhir bsres pa'i bzhi cha gnyis te phyed do //
translated: The second part is two of the four parts of a full (amount of wool), that is, half.

original: lug ba la zhes bya ba ni lug gi bal lo //
analyzed: lug ba la zhes bya ba ni lug gi bal lo //
translated: Black wool means the wool of a sheep.

original: nag po 'ba' zhig las zhes bya ba ni nag po bzhi ste /
analyzed: nag po 'ba' zhig las zhes bya ba ni nag po bzhi ste /
translated: Alone means four blacks:

original: rang bzhin gyis gnag pa dang / sngo bas gnag pa dang / 'dam kha dang / kham pa ste de las so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis gnag pa dang / sngo bas gnag pa dang / 'dam kha dang / kham pa ste de las so //
translated: naturally black, blue-black, muddy, and tawny.

original: gzhug par bya zhes bya ba ni bsre bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhug par bya zhes bya ba ni bsre bar bya'o //
translated: To be made means to be mixed.

original: gsum pa ni dkar po las zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gsum pa ni dkar po las zhes bya ba la /
translated: The third part is to be made of white wool.

original: gsum pa zhes bya ba ni rangs pa gcig la bzhi cha bzhir bsres pa'i bzhi cha gsum pa ste bzhi cha gcig go //
analyzed: gsum pa zhes bya ba ni rangs pa gcig la bzhi cha bzhir bsres pa'i bzhi cha gsum pa ste bzhi cha gcig go //
translated: The third part is one of the four parts of a full (amount of wool).

original: dkar po las zhes bya ba ni glo'i bal dang rgyab kyi bal dang gnya' ba'i bal te de las so//
analyzed: dkar po las zhes bya ba ni glo'i bal dang rgyab kyi bal dang gnya' ba'i bal te de las so//
translated: White wool means the wool of a goat, the wool of a camel, and the wool of a yak.

original: bzhi pa ni 'khob bal las gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni 'khob bal las gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The fourth part is to be made of the wool of a sheep.

original: bzhi pa zhes bya ba ni rangs pa gcig la bzhi cha bzhir bsres pa'i bzhi cha bzhi pa ste bzhi cha gcig go //
analyzed: bzhi pa zhes bya ba ni rangs pa gcig la bzhi cha bzhir bsres pa'i bzhi cha bzhi pa ste bzhi cha gcig go //
translated: The fourth part means the fourth part of the four parts into which one part is divided.

original: 'khob pa las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'khob pa las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: From the wool of the sheep means

original: rkang ba'i bal dang / mgo bo'i bal dang / lto ba'i bal te de las so //
analyzed: rkang ba'i bal dang / mgo bo'i bal dang / lto ba'i bal te de las so //
translated: from the wool of the sheep's legs, head, and belly.

original: gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bsre bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bsre bar bya ba'o //
translated: One should mix means one should combine.

original: de ltar stan rangs pa gcig gi rgyu'i phyed ni lug bal nag po bzhi cha ni dkar po /
analyzed: de ltar stan rangs pa gcig gi rgyu'i phyed ni lug bal nag po bzhi cha ni dkar po /
translated: Thus, the cause for one part of the mat is one part black sheep's wool, one part white,

original: bzhi cha ni 'khob bal las spyir bsres te bling bar bya'i /
analyzed: bzhi cha ni 'khob bal las spyir bsres te bling bar bya'i /
translated: and one part wool from the sheep's legs. In general, one should mix them and make the mat.

original: stan phyed nag po bzhi cha dkar po bzhi cha 'khob pa la gyi kha dog las khra bor bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: stan phyed nag po bzhi cha dkar po bzhi cha 'khob pa la gyi kha dog las khra bor bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But one should not make half the mat one part black, one part white, and one part wool from the sheep's legs, and make the other half variegated.

original: gal te dge slong gis cha gnyis lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig las ma bcug gam /
analyzed: gal te dge slong gis cha gnyis lug bal nag po 'ba' zhig las ma bcug gam /
translated: If a monk does not put in two parts of black sheep's wool,

original: gsum pa dkar po las /
analyzed: gsum pa dkar po las /
translated: three parts of white,

original: bzhi pa 'khob bal las ma bcug par zhes bya ba ni ma bsres par ro //
analyzed: bzhi pa 'khob bal las ma bcug par zhes bya ba ni ma bsres par ro //
translated: and one part of wool from the sheep's legs, means not mixing.

original: stan sar ba byed na zhes bya ba ni stan blings pa gsar pas sar pa bdag nyid kyis byed dam gzhan byed du 'jug na'o //
analyzed: stan sar ba byed na zhes bya ba ni stan blings pa gsar pas sar pa bdag nyid kyis byed dam gzhan byed du 'jug na'o //
translated: If one makes a new one means if one makes a new one oneself or has another make it with a new mat.

original: spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni dngos po de spangs nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba bshags par bya ste /
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni dngos po de spangs nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba bshags par bya ste /
translated: One commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession means that, having relinquished that article, one confesses the offense entailing relinquishment.

original: des na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is called an offense entailing relinquishment.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one commit an offense?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa @266b dang ; bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa @266b dang ; bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should understand the characteristics of this offense through the main part, the preparation, the preparation for the preparation, the presentation of the offense, the absence of an offense, the training, and the amendment.

original: cha gnyis bsre ba'i spang ba 'di yang sngar srin bal gyi spang ba dang bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi spang ba'i rnam pa bstan pa'i gnas skabs dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: cha gnyis bsre ba'i spang ba 'di yang sngar srin bal gyi spang ba dang bal nag po 'ba' zhig gi spang ba'i rnam pa bstan pa'i gnas skabs dang 'dra ste /
translated: This prohibition against mixing wool is similar to the situation in which the prohibition against silk was presented earlier and the prohibition against black wool was presented.

original: khyad par du na sngar srin bal zhes bya ba dang ; bal nag po 'ba' zhig ces bya ba de'i gnas su 'dir cha gnyis bsre ba zhes bya ba'i ming gzhan brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: khyad par du na sngar srin bal zhes bya ba dang ; bal nag po 'ba' zhig ces bya ba de'i gnas su 'dir cha gnyis bsre ba zhes bya ba'i ming gzhan brjod par bya ste /
translated: In particular, the former term “cotton” and the term “pure black wool” are replaced here by the term “two parts mixed.”

original: de'i phyir lug bal nag po de dag phyed pas lhag pa nyid na'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir lug bal nag po de dag phyed pas lhag pa nyid na'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Therefore, the text says, “if the black wool exceeds half.”

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis stan sar pa byed na phyed ni lug bal nag po bzhi cha gcig ni dkar po //
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis stan sar pa byed na phyed ni lug bal nag po bzhi cha gcig ni dkar po //
translated: In this case, the presentation of the actual basis of the downfall is this: If a monk makes a new mat, half of it must be black wool, one quarter must be white,

original: bzhi cha gcig ni 'khob bal las gzhug bar gsungs pa'i srang tshad las lug bal nag po dag phyed pas lhag pa nyid las stan blings pa gsar pas sar pa rang gis byas sam gzhan byed du bcug na dang por bkram pa nyid kyi tshe na cha gnyis
analyzed: bzhi cha gcig ni 'khob bal las gzhug bar gsungs pa'i srang tshad las lug bal nag po dag phyed pas lhag pa nyid las stan blings pa gsar pas sar pa rang gis byas sam gzhan byed du bcug na dang por bkram pa nyid kyi tshe na cha gnyis
translated: and one quarter must be brown. The measure of a srang is stated in the scriptures. If the black wool exceeds half, then if the monk himself weaves the new mat or has another weave it, then when the mat is first spread out, the two parts

original: bsre ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsre ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: are mixed. This is the actual basis of the downfall of discarding the mixed cloth.

original: dge slong la cha gnyis bsre ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed byung na de ma spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
analyzed: dge slong la cha gnyis bsre ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed byung na de ma spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
translated: If a monk has committed the downfall of keeping the two robes for more than one day and has not yet amended it, that is, has neither given up the extra robe nor confessed the downfall,

original: spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
analyzed: spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
translated: or if he has given up the extra robe but has not confessed the downfall,

original: spangs shing bral bar byas la ltung ba ma bshags par cha gnyis bsre ba'i bal dang / cha gnyis pa sres pa'i stan de lta bu gzhan zhig rnyed na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: spangs shing bral bar byas la ltung ba ma bshags par cha gnyis bsre ba'i bal dang / cha gnyis pa sres pa'i stan de lta bu gzhan zhig rnyed na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
translated: or if he has given up the extra robe and confessed the downfall but then acquires another such two-piece garment made of mixed wool, he will have to give it up as well, because the previous downfall has not been amended.

original: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: However, he will not have committed a new downfall.

original: dge slong gis cha gnyis bsre ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed byung la ji srid du spang ba'i dngos po las ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags par lhung bzed dam chos gos sam dra ba'am phor bu'am ska rags sam dge sbyong gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad gang yang
analyzed: dge slong gis cha gnyis bsre ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed byung la ji srid du spang ba'i dngos po las ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags par lhung bzed dam chos gos sam dra ba'am phor bu'am ska rags sam dge sbyong gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad gang yang
translated: If a monk has committed the downfall of keeping the two robes for more than one day and has not yet amended it, that is, has neither given up the extra robe nor confessed the downfall, he will have to give up any of the following articles that he may acquire: a begging bowl, a robe, a needle case, a water bottle, a belt, or any other article necessary for a monk’s livelihood.

original: rung ba gzhan nye bar 'jog na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rung ba gzhan nye bar 'jog na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
translated: If one places another suitable one nearby, that is also abandoned by the power of the former.

original: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One does not commit an infraction through that.

original: lug bal nag po sar pa stan phyed kyi srang tshad las lhag pa las stan blings pa lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: lug bal nag po sar pa stan phyed kyi srang tshad las lhag pa las stan blings pa lan smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense in making a mat from black sheep’s wool that is new and more than half a standard measure, if one does not have the wool washed.

original: ji zhig gis nag por gyur pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji zhig gis nag por gyur pa yin zhe na /
translated: By what does it become black?

original: nag bo bzhi ste /
analyzed: nag bo bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of black:

original: rang bzhin gyis gnag pa dang / rang bzhin gyis sngo ba dang / rang bzhin gyis 'dam kha dang / rang @267a * //🔽bzhin gyis kham pa ste /🔽de dag lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis gnag pa dang / rang bzhin gyis sngo ba dang / rang bzhin gyis 'dam kha dang / rang @267a * // bzhin gyis kham pa ste / de dag lan smad pa med do //
translated: naturally black, naturally blue, naturally red, and naturally variegated.

original: dkar po dang 'khob bal gnyi ga bsdoms pa phyed kyi tshad pas chung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dkar po dang 'khob bal gnyi ga bsdoms pa phyed kyi tshad pas chung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if it is less than half the size of a standard measure of white or brown wool.

original: gsar pas sar pa lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: gsar pas sar pa lan smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if it is new.

original: rang gis byas pa dang / gzhan byed du bcug pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: rang gis byas pa dang / gzhan byed du bcug pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one has it made by oneself or has someone else make it.

original: stan la ni bkram pa nyid byed pa mthar thug pa'i dang po yin pas der dgos pa'i lug bal nag po phyed pas lhag pa dang / dkar po dang 'khob bal gnyi ga bsdoms pa phyed pas chung ba 'byed pa dang / 'jig pa dang rmel ba'i 'og rol du dang po bkram pa nyid la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: stan la ni bkram pa nyid byed pa mthar thug pa'i dang po yin pas der dgos pa'i lug bal nag po phyed pas lhag pa dang / dkar po dang 'khob bal gnyi ga bsdoms pa phyed pas chung ba 'byed pa dang / 'jig pa dang rmel ba'i 'og rol du dang po bkram pa nyid la na smad pa med do //
translated: The first of the final stages is the spreading of the mat. There is no fault in using a mat that is more than half black wool, and less than half white and woolen cloth combined, if it is the first mat one has spread.

original: lug bal gyi rdzas bzang ngan dang mnyam pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: lug bal gyi rdzas bzang ngan dang mnyam pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in using a mat that is equal parts good and bad wool.

original: lug bal ma nyams pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: lug bal ma nyams pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in using a mat of undamaged wool.

original: lug bal dang srin bal la sogs pa dkon zhing rin che ba cha mnyam par bsres pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: lug bal dang srin bal la sogs pa dkon zhing rin che ba cha mnyam par bsres pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in using a mat that is a mixture of equal parts of rare and valuable wool and cotton.

original: yul gang na bal dkar po dkon zhing rin che la nag po dang 'khob bal mod cing rin chung na de ni bal nag po'i gnas su dkar po rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yul gang na bal dkar po dkon zhing rin che la nag po dang 'khob bal mod cing rin chung na de ni bal nag po'i gnas su dkar po rig par bya ste /
translated: In a place where white wool is rare and valuable, and black and woolen cloth are plentiful and cheap, white wool should be considered as valuable as black wool.

original: dkar po phyed pas lhag cing nag po dang 'khob bal bsdoms pa phyed pas chung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dkar po phyed pas lhag cing nag po dang 'khob bal bsdoms pa phyed pas chung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the black is less than half and the white and wool are equal or more.

original: yul gang na 'khob bal rin che zhing dkon pa la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: yul gang na 'khob bal rin che zhing dkon pa la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The same applies if wool is expensive and rare in a certain place.

original: cha gnyis bsre ba'i bal rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: cha gnyis bsre ba'i bal rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the wool is suitable for mixing with two parts of another wool.

original: stan gyi tshad ni gsum ste /
analyzed: stan gyi tshad ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three sizes of mats:

original: chen po dang / 'bring dang / chung du'o //
analyzed: chen po dang / 'bring dang / chung du'o //
translated: large, medium, and small.

original: chen po'i srid ni khru phyed dang lnga /🔽chung du'i srid ni khru phyed dang gsum /
analyzed: chen po'i srid ni khru phyed dang lnga / chung du'i srid ni khru phyed dang gsum /
translated: The large one is five and a half cubits long.🔽The small one is four and a half cubits long.

original: 'bring gi tshad ni de gnyis kyi bar te khru phyed dang bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'bring gi tshad ni de gnyis kyi bar te khru phyed dang bzhi'o //
translated: The medium one is between those two, three cubits long.

original: de dag gi zheng tshad ni gding ba'i zheng dang mnyam ste /
analyzed: de dag gi zheng tshad ni gding ba'i zheng dang mnyam ste /
translated: Their width is the same as the width of the mat.

original: zheng du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho phyed dang do ste /
analyzed: zheng du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho phyed dang do ste /
translated: The width is one and a half cubits of the Sugata.

original: tha mal pa'i khru do dang sor drug go //
analyzed: tha mal pa'i khru do dang sor drug go //
translated: That is two and a half cubits of an ordinary person.

original: lug bal nag po phyed pas lhag pa'i stan chad de dag dang de dag pas lhag pa lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: lug bal nag po phyed pas lhag pa'i stan chad de dag dang de dag pas lhag pa lan smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the mat is less than half black wool, or more than that.

original: lug bal dkar po ni gang yin /
analyzed: lug bal dkar po ni gang yin /
translated: What is white wool?

original: 'khob bal ni gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'khob bal ni gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is black wool?

original: glo dang rgyab dang gnya' ba nas skyes pa ni dkar po'o //
analyzed: glo dang rgyab dang gnya' ba nas skyes pa ni dkar po'o //
translated: White wool is that which grows on the chest, back, and neck.

original: mgo dang rkang pa dang lto ba nas skyes pa ni 'khob bal lo //
analyzed: mgo dang rkang pa dang lto ba nas skyes pa ni 'khob bal lo //
translated: Black wool is that which grows on the head, legs, and belly.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni yul gang na lug bal nag po dkon zhing rin che bar lug bal nag po sar pa phyed pas lhag pa nyid kyi stan tshad dang ldan pa dang / de bas lhag par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni yul gang na lug bal nag po dkon zhing rin che bar lug bal nag po sar pa phyed pas lhag pa nyid kyi stan tshad dang ldan pa dang / de bas lhag par byed pa nyid do //
translated: The agent of this offense is one who makes a mat that is the right size, with more than half black wool, with new black wool, in a place where black wool is rare and expensive.🔽The basis of the offense is a mat that is the right size.

original: 'di @267b la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di @267b la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The actual basis is five factors:

original: lug bal nag po dang phyed pas lhag pa nyid dang / sar pa dang / stan dang / byas pa dang / byed pa mthar thug pa'i dang po bkram ba nyid do //
analyzed: lug bal nag po dang phyed pas lhag pa nyid dang / sar pa dang / stan dang / byas pa dang / byed pa mthar thug pa'i dang po bkram ba nyid do //
translated: black wool, more than half black wool, new, a mat, and the completion of the action of making.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these factors is incomplete, then the offense is a minor one.

original: de la lug bal nag po dag phyed pas lhag pa nyid ces smos pa ni ma lhag pa la ltung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la lug bal nag po dag phyed pas lhag pa nyid ces smos pa ni ma lhag pa la ltung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term more than in more than a black wool part is stated because there is no offense if it is not more.

original: sar pa zhes smos ba ni rnying pa dang nyams pa dag la nyes byas su gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sar pa zhes smos ba ni rnying pa dang nyams pa dag la nyes byas su gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term new is stated because it is said to be a minor offense if it is old or worn out.

original: stan zhes smos pa ni stan las gzhan pa gding ba la sogs pa dag la na smad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stan zhes smos pa ni stan las gzhan pa gding ba la sogs pa dag la na smad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term mat is stated because there is no offense if it is a mat or something other than a mat.

original: byas pa zhes smos pa ni ma byas pa dang byed du ma bcug pa la na ltung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byas pa zhes smos pa ni ma byas pa dang byed du ma bcug pa la na ltung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term made is stated because there is no offense if it is not made or if one does not cause it to be made.

original: byed pa mthar thug pa'i dang po bkram pa nyid ces smos pa ni stan byed pa la der gtogs pa'i byed pa mthar thug pa'i dang po ni lug bal nag po dag phyed pas lhag pa bkram pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: byed pa mthar thug pa'i dang po bkram pa nyid ces smos pa ni stan byed pa la der gtogs pa'i byed pa mthar thug pa'i dang po ni lug bal nag po dag phyed pas lhag pa bkram pa nyid yin te /
translated: The first of the final stages of making is spreading out because the first of the final stages of making a mat is spreading out more than a black wool part.

original: de tsam byas na dngos gzhir 'gyur zhing de phyin chad gang byed pa de ni de'i khongs su 'dus pa yin la bkram pa nyid kyi sngon rol du 'byed pa dang / 'jig pa dang / rmel ba dag ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam byas na dngos gzhir 'gyur zhing de phyin chad gang byed pa de ni de'i khongs su 'dus pa yin la bkram pa nyid kyi sngon rol du 'byed pa dang / 'jig pa dang / rmel ba dag ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The preparatory act of spreading the mat, the actual basis of separating the black and white wool, and the subsequent act of weaving are all included in that.

original: sbyor ba gcig gis bal nag po dag byed pas lhag pa'i stan gcig gam gnyis sam mang po zhig byed na yang ltung ba'i dngos gzhig cig rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: sbyor ba gcig gis bal nag po dag byed pas lhag pa'i stan gcig gam gnyis sam mang po zhig byed na yang ltung ba'i dngos gzhig cig rnam par gzhag go //
translated: If one makes one, two, or many extra mats with one preparatory act of black wool, then one is said to have committed the actual basis of a downfall.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The preparatory act of a downfall is a minor offense.

original: ji srid du cha gnyis bsre ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du cha gnyis bsre ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as one has begun the preparatory act of the downfall of discarding two parts, but has not yet reached the actual basis, it is a minor offense.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o ;
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o ;
translated: For each preparatory act that one begins up to the actual basis, there is one minor offense.

original: /'khob bal bas dkar po lhag par byed na nyes byas so //
analyzed: /'khob bal bas dkar po lhag par byed na nyes byas so //
translated: If one makes the white wool predominate over the black wool, it is a minor offense.

original: lug bal rnying pa dang nyams pa nyid la nyes byas so //
analyzed: lug bal rnying pa dang nyams pa nyid la nyes byas so //
translated: If the wool is old or damaged, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: stan las gzhan pa dag byed na nyes byas so //🔽byed pa mthar thug pa'i dang po 'grems pa'i mdun rol du 'byed pa dang / 'jig pa dang / rmel ba dag la nyes byas so//
analyzed: stan las gzhan pa dag byed na nyes byas so // byed pa mthar thug pa'i dang po 'grems pa'i mdun rol du 'byed pa dang / 'jig pa dang / rmel ba dag la nyes byas so//
translated: If one makes a mat from something other than wool, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: rgyu rung ba ma yin pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: rgyu rung ba ma yin pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If one makes a mat that is not the right size, there is an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If one makes a mat from unsuitable wool, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: tshad pas chung ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: tshad pas chung ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If one makes a mat that is smaller than the right size, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The offense of preparation for preparation is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: As many preparations as there are, there are that many preparations for preparation.

analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The preparation for a minor offense is also a minor offense.

original: de yang dang po yid la sems pa @268a * //
analyzed: de yang dang po yid la sems pa @268a * //

original: ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas phra mo'o //

analyzed: de nas lus dang ngag gis sbyor ba ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas dngos so //

analyzed: de nas mthar thug pa ni spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhi'o zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: The final step is the actual basis of a downfall through transgression.

original: ltung ba med pa ni byas zin pa rnyed pa dang / gzhan gyis byas pa la yongs su longs spyod pa dang / rnying pa'i byi dor mngon par 'du byed pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni byas zin pa rnyed pa dang / gzhan gyis byas pa la yongs su longs spyod pa dang / rnying pa'i byi dor mngon par 'du byed pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the wool has already been acquired, if one uses wool that has been made by another, or if one makes a mat out of old wool.

original: dkar po dang 'khob bal dag ni lhag par gyur pa la bal nag po dag ni nyung ba'am mnyam par gyur pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: dkar po dang 'khob bal dag ni lhag par gyur pa la bal nag po dag ni nyung ba'am mnyam par gyur pa la ltung ba med do //

original: dkar po'am 'khob bal lhag pa la yang ltung ba med do //
analyzed: dkar po'am 'khob bal lhag pa la yang ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the white or brown wool is in excess.

original: las dang po pa dang ; smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang ; smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is a beginner, or if one is insane, deranged, or in pain.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du cha gnyis bsre ba'i spang bar 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //

translated: The training rule is that a monk should train by not using wool that is a mixture of two parts of any region in any situation, and by not using wool in any way that would result in a downfall.

original: stan tha mal pa nang tshangs can dang blings pa ras bal can dang / dbyam po zhes bya ba dag bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: stan tha mal pa nang tshangs can dang blings pa ras bal can dang / dbyam po zhes bya ba dag bcang bar bya'o //

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //

original: cha gnyis bsre ba'i spang ba ste bcu gsum pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: cha gnyis bsre ba'i spang ba ste bcu gsum pa bshad zin to /

original: // / lo drug tu bcang ba'i spang ba'i gleng gzhi ni bcas pa dang gnang ba'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /

original: 'di ni ha cang thung ngo //

translated: Ānanda, any monk who is a caretaker of the monastery and who is unable to find a seat for six years should request the saṅgha for permission to use a seat for up to six years.

original: 'di ltar gsol par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gsol par bya ste /

analyzed: thugs brtse ba can dge 'dun btsun pa rnams kyis thugs brtse ba'i slad du /
translated: Therefore, the saṅgha of noble monks, out of compassion,

analyzed: bdag dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la lo drug tshun chad du stan gnang ba stsal du gsol /
translated: please grant me, the monk named so-and-so, a sitting place for up to six years.

original: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas /
analyzed: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas /

original: gal te ha cang dog pa yin na ba la sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te ha cang dog pa yin na ba la sbyin par bya'o //
translated: If it is too narrow, they should add to it.

original: gal te ral ba dang rdol ba yin na bal sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te ral ba dang rdol ba yin na bal sbyin par bya'o //
translated: If it is torn or worn, they should add to it.

original: gal te thams cad kyi thams cad du bug rdol dang sha zad pa dang / bcos dka' ba nyid yin na de'i tshe dge slong de dag gis rgan pa'i mtha' logs su gus pa dang bcas pas 'dug ste /
analyzed: gal te thams cad kyi thams cad du bug rdol dang sha zad pa dang / bcos dka' ba nyid yin na de'i tshe dge slong de dag gis rgan pa'i mtha' logs su gus pa dang bcas pas 'dug ste /
translated: If it is completely torn, worn, or difficult to repair, then those monks should sit respectfully at the end of the row of the most senior monks

original: 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: and say this:

original: gnas brtan dag dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i stan de dag thams cad kyi thams cad du bug rdol dang sha zad pa dang / bcos dka' ba nyid lags kyi da de'i dus la bab par mkhyen par mdzod cig / de ni dus dang por bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnas brtan dag dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i stan de dag thams cad kyi thams cad du bug rdol dang sha zad pa dang / bcos dka' ba nyid lags kyi da de'i dus la bab par mkhyen par mdzod cig / de ni dus dang por bya ba'o //
translated: This is the first rite.

original: de'i 'og tu dge slong gcig gis gsol ba byas te las bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dge slong gcig gis gsol ba byas te las bya'o //
translated: After that, one monk should make a proposal and perform the rite.

original: 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: It should be done like this.

original: 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: Sitting down, he should say this:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: “Venerable saṅgha, please listen!

original: dge slong lag gi zla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di lo drug tu stan mi bgyid pa las dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge 'dun las lo drug tshun chad du stan gnang ba gsol na /
analyzed: dge slong lag gi zla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di lo drug tu stan mi bgyid pa las dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge 'dun las lo drug tshun chad du stan gnang ba gsol na /
translated: This monk Hastalola, who has not had a seat for six years, is requesting the saṅgha for a seat for up to six years.

original: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyis pa la lo drug tshun chad du stan gnang ba stsol to //
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyis pa la lo drug tshun chad du stan gnang ba stsol to //
translated: If the time is right for the Saṅgha and it is agreeable, the Saṅgha should give permission to the monk named so-and-so to use a mat for six years.

original: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
translated: This is the motion.

original: las ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: las ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: The rite is as follows:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: “Venerable sirs, listen!

original: dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba lo drug tu stan mi bgyid pa las /🔽dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge 'dun las lo drug tshun chad du stan gnang bar gsol te /
analyzed: dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba lo drug tu stan mi bgyid pa las / dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge 'dun las lo drug tshun chad du stan gnang bar gsol te /
translated: The monk named so-and-so has not used a mat for six years.🔽This monk named so-and-so is asking the Saṅgha for permission to use a mat for six years.

original: de'i slad du dge 'dun gyis dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la lo drug tshun chad du stan gnang ba stsol na /
analyzed: de'i slad du dge 'dun gyis dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la lo drug tshun chad du stan gnang ba stsol na /
translated: If the time is right for the Saṅgha and it is agreeable, the Saṅgha should give permission to the monk named so-and-so to use a mat for six years.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang dag dge slong lag @270a * //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang dag dge slong lag @270a * //
translated: Venerable sirs, listen!

original: gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di la lo drug tshun chad du stan gnang ba stsal bar bzod pa de dag ni cang ma gsung shig / gang dag mi bzod pa de dag ni gsungs shig / dge 'dun gyis bzod cing gnang nas dge 'dun gyis dge
analyzed: gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di la lo drug tshun chad du stan gnang ba stsal bar bzod pa de dag ni cang ma gsung shig / gang dag mi bzod pa de dag ni gsungs shig / dge 'dun gyis bzod cing gnang nas dge 'dun gyis dge
translated: If it does not accept, then the saṅgha should speak.

original: slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la lo drug tshun chad du stan gnang ba stsal lags te /
analyzed: slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la lo drug tshun chad du stan gnang ba stsal lags te /
translated: The saṅgha has accepted and granted the seat for six years to the monk named so-and-so.

original: 'di ltar cang mi gsung bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'di ltar cang mi gsung bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to //
translated: Since the saṅgha has remained silent, this is how I understand it.🔽The saṅgha has granted the seat for six years to the monk named so-and-so.

original: dge 'dun gyis dge slong lag gi bla gang la lo drug tshun chad du stan gnang ba byin pa des lo drug tshun chad du stan byed du bzhug ste 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis dge slong lag gi bla gang la lo drug tshun chad du stan gnang ba byin pa des lo drug tshun chad du stan byed du bzhug ste 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o //
translated: He should be allowed to give a seat for six years. He should not regret it.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa dang / bslab pa la gus pa dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags pa brjod de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa dang / bslab pa la gus pa dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags pa brjod de /
translated: Then the Blessed One praised those who desired training, those who had respect for training, and those who were ascetic with regard to requisites.

original: dge slong rnams la yang de dang mthun pa dang / de'i shas che ba dang / de dang 'tsham pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid mdzad nas /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la yang de dang mthun pa dang / de'i shas che ba dang / de dang 'tsham pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid mdzad nas /
translated: He spoke to the monks in a way that was consistent with that, that was more abundant than that, and that was appropriate to that.

original: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then he said to the monks,

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni bcas pa yin la 'di ni gnang ba yin te /
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni bcas pa yin la 'di ni gnang ba yin te /
translated: “Monks, therefore, the previous was a rule, but this is a concession.

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: My disciples should recite this rule for training in the Monastic Law:

original: dge slong gis stan sar pa byed na mi 'dod bzhin du lo drug tu bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis stan sar pa byed na mi 'dod bzhin du lo drug tu bcang bar bya'o //
translated: ‘If a monk makes a new mat, he must use it unwillingly for six years.

original: gal te dge slong gis lo drug tshun chad du stan rnying pa de spangs kyang rung ma spangs kyang rung stan sar pa gzhan byed na dge 'dun gyis gnang ba ma gtogs te spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gnang ba mdzad de /
analyzed: gal te dge slong gis lo drug tshun chad du stan rnying pa de spangs kyang rung ma spangs kyang rung stan sar pa gzhan byed na dge 'dun gyis gnang ba ma gtogs te spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gnang ba mdzad de /
translated: If a monk discards his old mat after six years, or if he makes a new mat even if he hasn’t discarded his old one, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession, except if the Sangha has given permission.’

original: yul ni 'brog gnas /
analyzed: yul ni 'brog gnas /
translated: The place was in the wilderness.

original: gang zag ni dge slong lag gi bla /
analyzed: gang zag ni dge slong lag gi bla /
translated: The person was the monk Hand-Bread.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nyes pa ni med do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nyes pa ni med do //
translated: There is no offense or transgression.

original: de la dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pas so //
analyzed: de la dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pas so //
translated: “Bhikṣus” means those who follow this teaching.

original: stan zhes bya ba ni stan gnyis te /
analyzed: stan zhes bya ba ni stan gnyis te /
translated: “Seat” means two kinds of seats:

original: nang tshangs can dang / blings pa'o //
analyzed: nang tshangs can dang / blings pa'o //
translated: one with a lining and one without a lining.

original: don 'dir ni blings pa yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: don 'dir ni blings pa yin par dgongs so //
translated: In this context, it is intended to mean without a lining.

original: sar pa zhes bya ba ni sar pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sar pa zhes bya ba ni sar pa gnyis te /
translated: “New” means two kinds of new:

original: gsar pas sar pa dang / rnyed pas sar pa'o //
analyzed: gsar pas sar pa dang / rnyed pas sar pa'o //
translated: new in the sense of being fresh and new in the sense of being obtained.

original: don 'dir ni gsar pas sar pa yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: don 'dir ni gsar pas sar pa yin par dgongs so //
translated: In this context, it is intended to mean new in the sense of being fresh.

original: byed na zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis byed dam gzhan byed du 'jug na'o //
analyzed: byed na zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis byed dam gzhan byed du 'jug na'o //
translated: “If he makes” means if he makes it himself or has someone else make it.

original: mi 'dod bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ma dad bzhin du'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ma dad bzhin du'o //
translated: “Without wanting to” means without being willing.

original: lo drug tu bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni lo drug tshun chad du bcang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: lo drug tu bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni lo drug tshun chad du bcang bar bya ba'o //
translated: “He should keep it for six years” means he should keep it for up to six years.

original: gal te dge slong gis lo drug tshun chad du zhes bya ba ni de tshun chad du'o//
analyzed: gal te dge slong gis lo drug tshun chad du zhes bya ba ni de tshun chad du'o//
translated: “If a bhikṣu keeps it for more than six years” means for more than that.

original: @270b stan rnying pa de zhes bya ba ni stan gang yod pa de'o //
analyzed: @270b stan rnying pa de zhes bya ba ni stan gang yod pa de'o //
translated: “That old seat” means whatever seat he has.

original: spangs kyang rung ma spangs kyang rung zhes bya ba ni yod kyang rung med kyang rung ste'o //
analyzed: spangs kyang rung ma spangs kyang rung zhes bya ba ni yod kyang rung med kyang rung ste'o //
translated: “Whether it is abandoned or not abandoned” means “whether it exists or does not exist.”

original: stan sar pa gzhan byed na zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: stan sar pa gzhan byed na zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: “If he makes another new sitting mat” is the second.

original: dge 'dun gyis gnang ba ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyis gnang ba gzhag ste'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis gnang ba ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyis gnang ba gzhag ste'o //
translated: “Except if the Saṅgha gives permission” means “except if the Saṅgha has set aside the rule.”

original: spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni dngos po de spangs nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba bshags par bya ba ste /
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni dngos po de spangs nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba bshags par bya ba ste /
translated: “It is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession” means that after relinquishing that thing, he must acknowledge the offense entailing confession.

original: des na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore it is called “an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.”

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is an offense here?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang ; bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang ; bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, too, the offense should be understood through the characteristics of the basis, the preparation, the proximate preparation, the presentation of the offense, the absence of an offense, the training, and the amendment.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: Here, the presentation of the offense in the basis is as follows.

original: dge slong lo drug tshun chad du stan sar pa bya ba'i phyir dge 'dun las gnang ba ma thob pa stan snga ma gzhan yod pa'am rang dgar btang bas /
analyzed: dge slong lo drug tshun chad du stan sar pa bya ba'i phyir dge 'dun las gnang ba ma thob pa stan snga ma gzhan yod pa'am rang dgar btang bas /
translated: If a monk who has not received permission from the community to use a new mat for less than six years, either because he has another new mat or because he has given away his old one,

original: lo drug ma lon par stan blings pa phyi ma gzhan byed na zin pa'i mtha' lo drug tu bcang ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lo drug ma lon par stan blings pa phyi ma gzhan byed na zin pa'i mtha' lo drug tu bcang ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: makes a new mat before the six years have passed, he commits an actual downfall of the class of offenses to be relinquished through the application of antidotes, since he must keep the old mat for six years.

original: dge slong la lo drug tu bcang ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed byung na /
analyzed: dge slong la lo drug tu bcang ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed byung na /
translated: If a monk has committed an offense entailing forfeiture that must be kept for six years,

original: de ma spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
analyzed: de ma spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
translated: if he does not relinquish it, does not separate himself from it, and does not confess the downfall;

original: spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung bar ma bshags par ram /
analyzed: spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung bar ma bshags par ram /
translated: if he relinquishes it but does not separate himself from it and does not confess the downfall;

original: spangs shing bral bar byas la ltung ba ma bshags par lo drug tu bcang ba'i stan de lta bu gzhan zhig rnyed na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: spangs shing bral bar byas la ltung ba ma bshags par lo drug tu bcang ba'i stan de lta bu gzhan zhig rnyed na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
translated: or if he relinquishes it and separates himself from it but does not confess the downfall, and then obtains another mat to be kept for six years, the latter mat becomes subject to relinquishment by the force of the former.

original: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: However, he does not commit an actual downfall.

original: dge slong gis lo drug tu bcang ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed byung la ji srid du spang ba'i dngos po las ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags par lhung bzed dam chos gos sam dra ba'am /
analyzed: dge slong gis lo drug tu bcang ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed byung la ji srid du spang ba'i dngos po las ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags par lhung bzed dam chos gos sam dra ba'am /
translated: If a fully ordained monk who has committed a downfall that requires forfeiture keeps the article that should be forfeited for more than six years, then, as long as he has not confessed and been re-admitted to the order, he commits a downfall by keeping any of the following articles: a begging bowl, a religious robe, a needle case,

original: phor bu'am / ska rags sam /
analyzed: phor bu'am / ska rags sam /
translated: a water bottle, a belt,

original: dge sbyong gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad gang yang rung ba gzhan nye bar 'jog na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad gang yang rung ba gzhan nye bar 'jog na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
translated: or any other article necessary for a monk’s livelihood.

original: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: However, he does not commit a downfall by keeping the article that should be forfeited.

original: gnang ba ma thob pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: gnang ba ma thob pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk has not received permission to keep the article.

original: stan snga ma gzhan yod pa dang med pa la na smad pa med do //🔽lo drug tu ma lon pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: stan snga ma gzhan yod pa dang med pa la na smad pa med do // lo drug tu ma lon pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk has not received permission to keep the article, but there is another monk who has.🔽There is no offense if the monk has not kept the article for six years.

original: stan blings pa la na smad pa med do //🔽stan gsar @271a * //
analyzed: stan blings pa la na smad pa med do // stan gsar @271a * //
translated: There is no offense if the monk has not kept the article for six years, but he has dug a hole for it.

original: pas sar pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: pas sar pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk has not kept the article for six years, but he has dug a hole for it and has made a new article.

original: rang gis byas pa dang gzhan byed du bcug pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: rang gis byas pa dang gzhan byed du bcug pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk has not kept the article for six years, but he has dug a hole for it, made a new article, and has used it.🔽There is no offense if the monk has not kept the article for six years, but he has dug a hole for it, made a new article, used it, and then discarded it.

original: stan la ni bkram pa nyid byed pa mthar thug pa 'di'i dang po yin pas der dgos pa'i bal dag 'byed pa dang / 'jig pa dang rmel ba'i 'og rol du dang po bkram pa nyid la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: stan la ni bkram pa nyid byed pa mthar thug pa 'di'i dang po yin pas der dgos pa'i bal dag 'byed pa dang / 'jig pa dang rmel ba'i 'og rol du dang po bkram pa nyid la na smad pa med do //
translated: The final stage of spreading the mat is the first stage of this, so there is no fault in separating, destroying, or combing the wool for that purpose.

original: bal gyi rdzas bzang ngan dang mnyam ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: bal gyi rdzas bzang ngan dang mnyam ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in equalizing good and bad wool.

original: bal ma nyams pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: bal ma nyams pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in using undamaged wool.

original: bal dang srin bal la sogs pa dkon zhing rin che ba cha mnyam par bsres pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: bal dang srin bal la sogs pa dkon zhing rin che ba cha mnyam par bsres pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in mixing equal parts of rare and valuable wool, cotton, and so forth.

original: rgyu rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: rgyu rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in using suitable materials.

original: stan gyi tshad ni gsum ste /
analyzed: stan gyi tshad ni gsum ste /
translated: The size of the mat is threefold:

original: chen po dang 'bring dang chung du'o //
analyzed: chen po dang 'bring dang chung du'o //
translated: large, medium, and small.

original: chen po'i srid ni khru phyed dang lnga /
analyzed: chen po'i srid ni khru phyed dang lnga /
translated: The large one is five cubits long.

original: chung ngu'i srid ni khru phyed dang gsum /
analyzed: chung ngu'i srid ni khru phyed dang gsum /
translated: The small one is three and a half cubits long.

original: 'bring gi tshad ni de gnyis kyi bar te khru phyed dang bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'bring gi tshad ni de gnyis kyi bar te khru phyed dang bzhi'o //
translated: The medium size is between those two, four and a half cubits.

original: de dag gi zheng tshad ni gding ba'i zheng dang mnyam ste /
analyzed: de dag gi zheng tshad ni gding ba'i zheng dang mnyam ste /
translated: The width of those is the same as the width of the mat.

original: zheng du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho phyed dang do ste /
analyzed: zheng du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho phyed dang do ste /
translated: The width is half a fathom of the Sugata,

original: tha mal pa'i khru do dang sor drug go //
analyzed: tha mal pa'i khru do dang sor drug go //
translated: that is, two cubits and six finger-widths of an ordinary person.

original: bal gang yang rung ba las stan blings pa tshad de dag dang de dag pas lhag pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: bal gang yang rung ba las stan blings pa tshad de dag dang de dag pas lhag pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one makes a mat of any wool, and it is of that size or smaller.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni gnang ba ma thob pas lo drug tshun chad du stan blings pa tshad dang ldan pa dang / de bas lhag pa byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni gnang ba ma thob pas lo drug tshun chad du stan blings pa tshad dang ldan pa dang / de bas lhag pa byed pa nyid do //
translated: The agent of this is one who has not received permission, and who makes a mat of the proper size within six years, or one who makes it more than that.

original: 'di la yan lag drug gis dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag drug gis dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, there is a downfall of the basic lesson by six limbs:

original: gnang ba ma thob pa dang / lo drug ma lon pa dang / sar pa dang / stan dang / byas pa dang / byed pa thams cad mthar thug pa'i dang po bkram pa nyid do //
analyzed: gnang ba ma thob pa dang / lo drug ma lon pa dang / sar pa dang / stan dang / byas pa dang / byed pa thams cad mthar thug pa'i dang po bkram pa nyid do //
translated: not having received permission, not having completed six years, new, mat, made, and all making is completed by the first spreading.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If those limbs are incomplete, there is an offense as appropriate.

original: de la gnang ba ma thob pa zhes smos pa ni gnang ba thob pa la ltung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gnang ba ma thob pa zhes smos pa ni gnang ba thob pa la ltung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In that, the statement “not having received permission” is because there is no downfall for one who has received permission.

original: lo drug ma lon pa zhes smos pa ni lo drug lon pa la ltung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lo drug ma lon pa zhes smos pa ni lo drug lon pa la ltung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “not six years old” means that there is no offense if the child is six years old or older.

original: sar pa zhes smos pa ni rnying pa dang nyams pa dag la nyes byas su gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sar pa zhes smos pa ni rnying pa dang nyams pa dag la nyes byas su gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “new” means that there is an offense of wrong conduct for using an old or worn mat.

original: stan zhes smos pa ni stan las gzhan pa gding ba la sogs pa dag la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stan zhes smos pa ni stan las gzhan pa gding ba la sogs pa dag la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “mat” means that there is no offense for using a mat that is not a mat, such as a rug.

original: byas pa zhes smos pa ni ma byas pa dang byed du ma bcug pa la ltung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byas pa zhes smos pa ni ma byas pa dang byed du ma bcug pa la ltung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “made” means that there is no offense if the mat is not made or if one does not request that it be made.

original: byed pa mthar thug pa'i dang por bkram pa nyid ces smos pa ni /🔽stan byed pa la der gtogs pa'i byed pa mthar thug pa'i dang po ni bal bkram pa nyid yin te /🔽@271b de tsam byas na dngos gzhir 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: byed pa mthar thug pa'i dang por bkram pa nyid ces smos pa ni / stan byed pa la der gtogs pa'i byed pa mthar thug pa'i dang po ni bal bkram pa nyid yin te / @271b de tsam byas na dngos gzhir 'gyur zhing /
translated: The phrase “the first time that the mat is spread” means🔽that the first time that the mat is spread, it is the first time that the mat is used.🔽If one uses the mat at that time, one commits an offense entailing confession.

original: de phyin chad gang byed pa de ni de'i khongs su 'dus pa yin la /
analyzed: de phyin chad gang byed pa de ni de'i khongs su 'dus pa yin la /
translated: Any use of the mat after that is included in that offense.

original: bkram pa nyid kyi sngon rol du 'byed pa dang / 'jig pa dang / rmel ba dag ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bkram pa nyid kyi sngon rol du 'byed pa dang / 'jig pa dang / rmel ba dag ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the offense of preparation is a misdeed, the spreading, the separating, the tearing, and the weaving are the offense of preparation.

original: sbyor ba gcig gis lo drug tshun chad du stan gcig gam gnyis sam mang po zhig byed na yang ltung ba'i dngos gzhi gcig rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: sbyor ba gcig gis lo drug tshun chad du stan gcig gam gnyis sam mang po zhig byed na yang ltung ba'i dngos gzhi gcig rnam par gzhag go //
translated: If one does the weaving of one or two or many mats with one preparation, within six years, it is posited as one actual basis of a downfall.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The offense of preparation is a misdeed.

original: ji srid du lo drug tu bcang ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du lo drug tu bcang ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as one has begun the preparation for the downfalls of abandonment that are to be kept for six years, but has not reached the actual basis, it is a misdeed.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each actual basis that one has begun, there is one misdeed.

original: bal rnying pa dang nyams pa nyid la nyes byas so //
analyzed: bal rnying pa dang nyams pa nyid la nyes byas so //
translated: For old wool and damaged wool, it is a misdeed.

original: byed pa mthar thug pa'i dang po 'grems pa'i mdun rol du 'byed pa dang / 'jig pa dang / rmel ba dag la nyes byas so //
analyzed: byed pa mthar thug pa'i dang po 'grems pa'i mdun rol du 'byed pa dang / 'jig pa dang / rmel ba dag la nyes byas so //
translated: For the first of the final steps, the separating, the tearing, and the weaving before the spreading, it is a misdeed.

original: rgyu rung ba ma yin pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: rgyu rung ba ma yin pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If the seat is not suitable, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: tshad pas chung ba la nyes byas so /🔽stan snga ma ma zin pa'i 'og rol du phyi ma rtsom pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: tshad pas chung ba la nyes byas so / stan snga ma ma zin pa'i 'og rol du phyi ma rtsom pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If the seat is too small, there is an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If one begins a second seat under the first seat without having finished the first seat, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: stan snga ma brtsams pa nyid na de dang lhan cig tu'am phyis stan gnyis pa rtsom ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: stan snga ma brtsams pa nyid na de dang lhan cig tu'am phyis stan gnyis pa rtsom ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If one begins a second seat at the same time as or after the first seat has been begun, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: stan snga ma brtsams pa ma zin par de nyid dang lhan cig tu'am phyis stan gnyis pa la brtsams pa sngar zin par gyur na nyes byas so //
analyzed: stan snga ma brtsams pa ma zin par de nyid dang lhan cig tu'am phyis stan gnyis pa la brtsams pa sngar zin par gyur na nyes byas so //
translated: If one begins a second seat at the same time as or after the first seat has been begun, but before the first seat has been finished, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The offense of wrong conduct for preparation is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: As many preparations as there are, there are also that many preparations for preparation.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The preparation for the preparation of a minor offense is also a minor offense.

original: de yang dang po yid la sems pa ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: de yang dang po yid la sems pa ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: Moreover, the first mental intention is the minor offense of preparation for preparation.

original: de nas lus dang ngag gis sbyor ba ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas dngos so //
analyzed: de nas lus dang ngag gis sbyor ba ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas dngos so //
translated: Then, the application by body and speech is the actual fault of preparation.

original: de nas mthar thug pa ni spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhi'o zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mthar thug pa ni spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhi'o zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Then, the final step is the actual basis of the downfall of rejection.

original: ltung ba med pa ni byas zin pa rnyed pa dang / gzhan gyis byas pa la yongs su longs spyod pa dang / rnying pa'i byi dor mngon par 'du byed pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni byas zin pa rnyed pa dang / gzhan gyis byas pa la yongs su longs spyod pa dang / rnying pa'i byi dor mngon par 'du byed pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one has already made it, if one uses what was made by another, or if one makes a new one after repairing an old one.

original: sngar stan brtsams nas bar du khyim pa la sogs par babs te yang phyis rab tu byung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i tshe mthar thug par byed pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: sngar stan brtsams nas bar du khyim pa la sogs par babs te yang phyis rab tu byung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i tshe mthar thug par byed pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one begins to make a mat, but then descends to the level of a layperson and so forth, and later, when one has gone forth and been fully ordained again, one completes it.

original: gnang ba thob pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: gnang ba thob pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one has obtained permission.

original: lo drug lon pa la ltung ba med do //🔽ma byas pa dang / byed @272a * //
analyzed: lo drug lon pa la ltung ba med do // ma byas pa dang / byed @272a * //
translated: There is no offense if one has six years or more.🔽There is no offense if one has not made it,

original: du ma bcug pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: du ma bcug pa la ltung ba med do //

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen ba la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen ba la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense for beginners, for those who are insane, for those whose minds are disturbed, and for those whose senses are impaired.🔽The training rule is this: “A monk should train in not using any of the six types of dwellings that are prohibited for six years, in any situation, in any country.”🔽“In any situation” means in any situation.🔽“In any country” means in any country.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du lo drug tu bcad ba'i spang bar 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du lo drug tu bcad ba'i spang bar 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: “Six types of dwellings” means six types of dwellings.🔽“Prohibited” means prohibited by the Buddha.🔽“For six years” means for six years.

original: stan thams cad kyi thams cad du bug rdol dang sha zad pa dang / bcos dka' ba nyid ma yin pas gnang ba gsol bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: stan thams cad kyi thams cad du bug rdol dang sha zad pa dang / bcos dka' ba nyid ma yin pas gnang ba gsol bar mi bya'o //
translated: “Not using” means not using.🔽“Should train” means should practice.🔽“A monk” refers to a fully ordained monk.

original: dge slong rang dag rtog tu 'dong bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong rang dag rtog tu 'dong bar bya'o //
translated: “Should train” means should practice.🔽“In any situation” means in any situation.🔽“In any country” means in any country.🔽“Six types of dwellings” means six types of dwellings.🔽“Prohibited” means prohibited by the Buddha.🔽“For six years” means for six years.🔽“Not using” means not using.🔽“Should train” means should practice.

analyzed: yang na dge slong bskos pa dag rtog tu btang ngo //

analyzed: rtog pa'i dge slong dag gis kyang / chu dang zheng gnyi gar lhag pa nyid yin na gcad par bya'o //
translated: “A monk” refers to a fully ordained monk.🔽“Should train” means should practice.🔽“In any situation” means in any situation.🔽“In any country” means in any country.

analyzed: thung ba nyid dang dog pa nyid dag ni bskyed par bya'o //
translated: “Six types of dwellings” means six types of dwellings.🔽“Prohibited” means prohibited by the Buddha.🔽“For six years” means for six years.🔽“Not using” means not using.🔽“Should train” means should practice.🔽“A monk” refers to a fully ordained monk.

original: ral na btsem par bya'o //
analyzed: ral na btsem par bya'o //
translated: “Should train” means should practice.🔽“In any situation” means in any situation.🔽“In any country” means in any country.🔽“Six types of dwellings” means six types of dwellings.🔽“Prohibited” means prohibited by the Buddha.🔽“For six years” means for six years.🔽“Not using” means

original: bug rdol du gyur tam sha zad pa dag ni sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bug rdol du gyur tam sha zad pa dag ni sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: If there is a hole or if the flesh is exhausted, it should be applied.

original: bcos dka' ba nyid yin na dge 'dun gyis gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las kyis stan gyi gnang ba sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: bcos dka' ba nyid yin na dge 'dun gyis gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las kyis stan gyi gnang ba sbyin par bya'o //

analyzed: lag gi bla ni gleng gzhi'i dbang gis smos par zad kyi dge slong gzhan dag la yang cho ga 'dra bar shes par bya'o //
translated: The case of Upāli is mentioned by way of a nidāna. It should be understood that the procedure is the same for other monks.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is the same as before.🔽The fourteenth downfall is concluded.

original: lo drug tu bcang ba'i spang ba ste bcu bzhu pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: lo drug tu bcang ba'i spang ba ste bcu bzhu pa bshad zin to /
translated: The downfall of exceeding the size of a mat
