translated: The origin story of the downfall of exceeding the size of a mat took place in Śrāvastī, in the Jeta Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis bla na med pa'i mkhyen pa thugs su chud pa de'i tshe na thams cad du yul dbus su sangs rgyas 'jig rten du byung ngo zhes grag go zhes sgra grags so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis bla na med pa'i mkhyen pa thugs su chud pa de'i tshe na thams cad du yul dbus su sangs rgyas 'jig rten du byung ngo zhes grag go zhes sgra grags so //
translated: When the Blessed One attained unsurpassed knowledge, the sound spread everywhere, “In the middle country, a Buddha has appeared in the world!”

analyzed: byang phyogs na tshong pa dag gis yul dbus su sangs rgyas 'jig rten du byung ste /

original: thos nas kyang de dag 'di snyam du sems te /

original: der bdag cag gis khe spogs kyang bsgrub par bya /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'dug go mtha' gcig tu 'dug nas /

analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad do // rnam grangs du mar chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par bstan / yang dag par 'dzin du bcug / yang dag par gzengs bstod /

translated: if he relinquishes it but does not separate himself from it and does not confess the downfall,

original: spangs shing bral bar byas la ltung ba ma bshags par bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gis glan dgos pa'i gding ba de lta bu gzhan zhig rnyed na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: spangs shing bral bar byas la ltung ba ma bshags par bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gis glan dgos pa'i gding ba de lta bu gzhan zhig rnyed na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
translated: or if he relinquishes it and separates himself from it but does not confess the downfall, and then obtains another sitting mat that must be reinforced with a patch the size of a thumb joint of the Buddha, that new sitting mat will also be subject to relinquishment by the force of the previous downfall.

original: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: However, he does not commit a new downfall.

original: dge slong gis mtho gang gis spang ba'i ltung byed byung la /
analyzed: dge slong gis mtho gang gis spang ba'i ltung byed byung la /
translated: A monk who has committed a downfall that requires forfeiture by more than a hand’s breadth🔽and who keeps a begging bowl or a robe or a sitting mat or a water strainer or a belt or any other requisite of a renunciant

original: ji srid du spang ba'i dngos po las ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags par lhung bzed dam /🔽chos gos sam /
analyzed: ji srid du spang ba'i dngos po las ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags par lhung bzed dam / chos gos sam /
translated: without having confessed and been granted absolution for the downfall that requires forfeiture,

original: dra @275a * //🔽ba'am / phor bu'am /🔽ska rags sam /🔽dge sbyong gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad gang yang rung ba gzhan nye bar 'jog na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /🔽de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dra @275a * // ba'am / phor bu'am / ska rags sam / dge sbyong gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad gang yang rung ba gzhan nye bar 'jog na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te / de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: commits an offense equal to the original one.

original: gal te gding ba rnying pa ril gyis yod na des de ltar bya ste /
analyzed: gal te gding ba rnying pa ril gyis yod na des de ltar bya ste /
translated: If an old sitting mat is still usable, he should use it.

original: de'i na smad pa med do //
analyzed: de'i na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense in doing so.

original: gal te gding ba rnying pa bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang tsam zhig yod na yang des de ltar bya ste /
analyzed: gal te gding ba rnying pa bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang tsam zhig yod na yang des de ltar bya ste /
translated: If the old sitting mat is still usable, even if it is only the size of the Blessed One’s handspan, he should use it.

original: de la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: de la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense in doing so.

original: gal te gding ba rnying pa mi sra ba bcos par nus pa zhig yod na yang des de ltar bya ste /
analyzed: gal te gding ba rnying pa mi sra ba bcos par nus pa zhig yod na yang des de ltar bya ste /
translated: If the old sitting mat is still usable, even if it is only a piece of cloth, he should use it.

original: de la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: de la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense in doing so.

original: gal te gding ba rnying pa dam dum mthud cing sbyar du rung ba zhig yod na yang des de ltar bya ste /
analyzed: gal te gding ba rnying pa dam dum mthud cing sbyar du rung ba zhig yod na yang des de ltar bya ste /
translated: If there is an old blanket that is suitable to be sewn together and patched, then it should be done like that.

original: de la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: de la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in that.

original: gding ba sar pa shos gsar pas sar pa yin na des de ltar bya ste /
analyzed: gding ba sar pa shos gsar pas sar pa yin na des de ltar bya ste /
translated: If there is a new blanket that is newer than the new one, then it should be done like that.

original: de la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: de la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in that.

original: rang gis byas pa dang / gzhan byed du bcug pa lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: rang gis byas pa dang / gzhan byed du bcug pa lan smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in making it oneself or having someone else make it.

original: gding pa'i rdzas bzang ngan dang mnyam pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: gding pa'i rdzas bzang ngan dang mnyam pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in a blanket that is equal in quality.

original: rgyu rung ba la na smad pa med do //🔽gding ba'i tshad ni srid du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho'i mtho do /
analyzed: rgyu rung ba la na smad pa med do // gding ba'i tshad ni srid du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho'i mtho do /
translated: There is no fault in a suitable material.🔽The measure of the blanket is one cubit of the Sugata in length

original: zheng du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho'i mtho phyed dang do ste /
analyzed: zheng du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho'i mtho phyed dang do ste /
translated: and half a cubit of the Sugata in width.

original: gding ba gsar pas sar pa tshad de dag dang de dag pas lhag pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: gding ba gsar pas sar pa tshad de dag dang de dag pas lhag pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in a new blanket that is that size or larger.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni gding ba gsar pas sar pa byas pa dang / gding ba rnying pa yod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni gding ba gsar pas sar pa byas pa dang / gding ba rnying pa yod pa nyid yin no //
translated: The agent of this is making a new blanket and having an old blanket.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, there is a downfall through five limbs:

original: gding ba gsar pas sar pa dang / byas pa dang gding ba rnying pa yod pa dang / bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gis ma glan pa dang spyod pa nyid do //
analyzed: gding ba gsar pas sar pa dang / byas pa dang gding ba rnying pa yod pa dang / bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gis ma glan pa dang spyod pa nyid do //
translated: a new sitting mat, new, and made, and an old sitting mat is present, and it is not extended by the breadth of two outstretched arms of the Tathāgata.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these limbs is incomplete, there is a fault as appropriate.

original: de la gding ba gsar pas sar pa dang / byas pa zhes smos pa ni /
analyzed: de la gding ba gsar pas sar pa dang / byas pa zhes smos pa ni /
translated: Here, the statement “a new sitting mat, new, and made” is

original: gsar pas sar pa ma yin pa dang / ma byas pa la ltung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsar pas sar pa ma yin pa dang / ma byas pa la ltung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no offense if it is not new, or if it is not made.

original: gding ba rnying pa yod pa zhes smos pa ni gding ba rnying pa med pa la ltung bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gding ba rnying pa yod pa zhes smos pa ni gding ba rnying pa med pa la ltung bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement “an old sitting mat is present” is because there is no offense if an old sitting mat is not present.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gis ma glan pa zhes smos pa ni chad de tsam dang / de bas che bas glan pa la ni ltung ba med la /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gis ma glan pa zhes smos pa ni chad de tsam dang / de bas che bas glan pa la ni ltung ba med la /
translated: The statement “it is not extended by the breadth of two outstretched arms of the Tathāgata” is because there is no offense if it is extended by that amount or more.

original: de bas chung bas glan pa la ni smad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas chung bas glan pa la ni smad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But there is a fault if it is extended by less than that.

original: sbyor ba nyid ces smos pa ni rang gir mi sbyor bar ltung @275b ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyid ces smos pa ni rang gir mi sbyor bar ltung @275b ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “application” is mentioned because there is no offense if one does not apply oneself.

original: sbyor ba gcig gis gding ba gcig gam gnyis sam mang po zhig byed na yang ltung ba'i dngos gzhi gcig rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: sbyor ba gcig gis gding ba gcig gam gnyis sam mang po zhig byed na yang ltung ba'i dngos gzhi gcig rnam par gzhag go //
translated: If one application makes one, two, or many sitting mats, only one actual basis of offense is established.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The offense of application is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: ji srid du mtho gang gi spang ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi lam thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du mtho gang gi spang ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi lam thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as one has begun the application of a partial defeat of the sitting mat, but has not yet reached the actual basis, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each application that is begun in relation to the actual basis, there is one offense of wrong conduct.

original: rgyu rung ba ma yin pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: rgyu rung ba ma yin pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If the cause is not suitable, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: tshad pas tshung ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: tshad pas tshung ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If one is satisfied with the measure, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The offense of application of application is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: As many applications as there are, there are that many applications of application.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The preparation is a preparation that is a minor offense, and it is also a minor offense.

original: de yang dang po yid la sems pa ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: de yang dang po yid la sems pa ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: Moreover, the first mental intention is a minor offense that is a preparation for a preparation.

original: de nas lus dang ngag gis sbyor ba ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas dngos so //
analyzed: de nas lus dang ngag gis sbyor ba ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas dngos so //
translated: Then, the preparation by means of body and speech is the actual minor offense that is a preparation.

original: de nas mthar thug pa ni spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhi'o zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //🔽ltung ba med pa ni byas zin pa rnyed pa dang / gzhan gyis byas pa la yongs su longs spyod pa dang / rnying pa'i byi dor mngon par 'du byed pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: de nas mthar thug pa ni spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhi'o zhes bya bar shes par bya'o // ltung ba med pa ni byas zin pa rnyed pa dang / gzhan gyis byas pa la yongs su longs spyod pa dang / rnying pa'i byi dor mngon par 'du byed pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: Then, the final step is the actual offense of a partially defeating offense.🔽There is no offense if one uses what has already been made, if one uses what was made by another, or if one makes a new one to replace an old one.

original: gding ba gsar pa pha ma byas pa dang / rnying pa mi bdog pa dang / bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gis glan pa dang mi spyod pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: gding ba gsar pa pha ma byas pa dang / rnying pa mi bdog pa dang / bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gis glan pa dang mi spyod pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one uses a new mat that was not made by oneself or one’s parents, or if one uses a mat that is the size of the Sugata’s handspan.

original: gding ba rnying pa ril gyis mi bdog pa dang / bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang tsam yang mi bdog pa dang / mi sra bar bcos bar mi nus pa dang / dam dum mthud cing sbyar du mi rung ba la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: gding ba rnying pa ril gyis mi bdog pa dang / bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang tsam yang mi bdog pa dang / mi sra bar bcos bar mi nus pa dang / dam dum mthud cing sbyar du mi rung ba la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the old sitting mat is completely worn out, or if he does not have even a handspan square of the Tathāgata’s robe, or if he is unable to make a durable repair, or if he is unable to add patches and join them together.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if he is a beginning practitioner, or if he is insane, or if his mind is disturbed, or if he is the first offender.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du mtho gang gi spang bar 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du mtho gang gi spang bar 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training rule on sitting mats is finished.

original: gding ba rnying pa ril gyis bdog gam /
analyzed: gding ba rnying pa ril gyis bdog gam /
translated: If he has an old sitting mat that is completely worn out,

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gi tshad tsam zhig bdog gam /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gi tshad tsam zhig bdog gam /
translated: or if he has even a handspan square of the Tathāgata’s robe,

original: mi sra bar bcos par nus pa zhig bdog gam /
analyzed: mi sra bar bcos par nus pa zhig bdog gam /
translated: or if he is able to make a durable repair,

original: dam dum mthud cing sbyar du rung ba zhig bdog na yang de dag gis ci rigs par glan par bya'o //
analyzed: dam dum mthud cing sbyar du rung ba zhig bdog na yang de dag gis ci rigs par glan par bya'o //
translated: or if he is able to add patches and join them together, he should make one of those.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is the same as before.

original: mtho gang gi spang ba ste bco lnga pa bshad @276a * //🔽zin to / //
analyzed: mtho gang gi spang ba ste bco lnga pa bshad @276a * // zin to / //
translated: The prohibition against a handspan is the fifteenth.

original: / so sor thar pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel pa 'dul ba kun las btus pa /
analyzed: / so sor thar pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel pa 'dul ba kun las btus pa /
translated: This completes the fifteenth chapter, on the prohibition against a handspan, in this Ornament of Precious Liberation, a Wish-Fulfilling Gem of Sublime Dharma.

original: bam po bco lnga pa /
analyzed: bam po bco lnga pa /
translated: Chapter Sixteen: The Prohibition Against Wearing Wool

original: bal thogs pa'i spang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so//
analyzed: bal thogs pa'i spang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so//
translated: The frame story for the prohibition against wearing wool is this. The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
translated: The group of six said,

original: kye dga' bo nye dga' lhung bzed nag po can 'di dag ni rkang pa spre'u zhag gis bskus te 'gro na yang 'gro bar chas pa'i rnyed pa sgrub par byed /
analyzed: kye dga' bo nye dga' lhung bzed nag po can 'di dag ni rkang pa spre'u zhag gis bskus te 'gro na yang 'gro bar chas pa'i rnyed pa sgrub par byed /
translated: “Oh Nanda, these monks with black bowls smear their feet with monkey fat and then set out. They obtain the alms of those who are ready to leave.

original: 'ong na yang glo bur du 'ongs pa'i rnyed pa sgrub par byed cing /
analyzed: 'ong na yang glo bur du 'ongs pa'i rnyed pa sgrub par byed cing /
translated: When they return, they obtain the alms of those who have just arrived.

original: skye bo mang po dga' ba dang yid du 'ong bar yang 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: skye bo mang po dga' ba dang yid du 'ong bar yang 'gyur ro ;
translated: They become dear to and beloved by many people.

original: / yu bu cag ni khron ba'i rus sbal dang 'dra bar gar yang mi 'dong gang nas kyang mi 'ong bas rnyed pa 'thob pa dang / skye bo mang po dga' ba dang yid du 'ong ba ga la 'gyur gyi yu bu cag kyang 'dod ngo //
analyzed: / yu bu cag ni khron ba'i rus sbal dang 'dra bar gar yang mi 'dong gang nas kyang mi 'ong bas rnyed pa 'thob pa dang / skye bo mang po dga' ba dang yid du 'ong ba ga la 'gyur gyi yu bu cag kyang 'dod ngo //
translated: “We are like turtles in a well. We don’t go anywhere and nothing comes to us. How could we get any gain or be loved by many people?”

original: gang du 'dong /
analyzed: gang du 'dong /
translated: “Where will you go?”

original: gang du 'dron pa don mthun 'grub par ro //
analyzed: gang du 'dron pa don mthun 'grub par ro //
translated: “Where the caravan of merchants is going.”

original: de dag gis bsams pa /
analyzed: de dag gis bsams pa /
translated: They thought,

original: gal te thams cad 'dong bar gyur na bdag cag gi slong mo ster ba'i khyim gang dag yin pa de dag kyang lhung bzed nag po can dag gis kha phyin par 'gyur gyis bdag cag gis gcig gzhag ste 'dong bar bya na su gzhag par bya /
analyzed: gal te thams cad 'dong bar gyur na bdag cag gi slong mo ster ba'i khyim gang dag yin pa de dag kyang lhung bzed nag po can dag gis kha phyin par 'gyur gyis bdag cag gis gcig gzhag ste 'dong bar bya na su gzhag par bya /
translated: “If we all go, the families who give us alms will be taken over by those with black bowls. We should leave one of us here. Who should we leave here?”

original: btsun pa 'char ka'o //🔽btsun pa 'char ka khyod ni 'di nyid du 'dug shig dang / kho bo cag 'dong bar bya'o //
analyzed: btsun pa 'char ka'o // btsun pa 'char ka khyod ni 'di nyid du 'dug shig dang / kho bo cag 'dong bar bya'o //
translated: “Noble Ārṣaka.”🔽“Noble Ārṣaka, you stay right here, and we will go.”

original: de bzhin gyis shig ces 'char ka de nyid du 'dug go //
analyzed: de bzhin gyis shig ces 'char ka de nyid du 'dug go //
translated: “Do it that way,” and Ārṣaka stayed there.

original: lnga po dag gis 'dron pa don mthun btsal bar brtsams pa dang / de dag gis bal yul du 'gro ba'i 'dron pa don mthun mthong nas de'i drung du song ste smras pa /
analyzed: lnga po dag gis 'dron pa don mthun btsal bar brtsams pa dang / de dag gis bal yul du 'gro ba'i 'dron pa don mthun mthong nas de'i drung du song ste smras pa /
translated: The five set out to find a caravan. They saw a caravan going to Nepal and approached it.

original: bzhin bzangs dag khyed gang du 'dong /
analyzed: bzhin bzangs dag khyed gang du 'dong /
translated: “Sirs, where are you going?”

original: 'phags pa dag bal yul du'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa dag bal yul du'o //
translated: “Noble ones, to Nepal.”

original: bzhin bzangs dag kho bo cag kyang khyed dang lhan cig 'dong ngo //
analyzed: bzhin bzangs dag kho bo cag kyang khyed dang lhan cig 'dong ngo //
translated: “Sirs, we will go with you.”

original: 'phags pa dag bal yul ni rnga mo'i rgyab 'dra ba lags pas khyed cag der dgyes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa dag bal yul ni rnga mo'i rgyab 'dra ba lags pas khyed cag der dgyes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: “Noble ones, Nepal is like the back of a camel. You will not enjoy it there.”

original: bzhin bzangs dag gal te de lta bu yin du zin kyang yul mthong par 'gyur gyi 'dong bar bya'o //
analyzed: bzhin bzangs dag gal te de lta bu yin du zin kyang yul mthong par 'gyur gyi 'dong bar bya'o //
translated: “Sirs, even if that is so, we will see the country. Let us go.”

original: 'phags pa dag gal te de lta na tshur spyon bzhud do //
analyzed: 'phags pa dag gal te de lta na tshur spyon bzhud do //
translated: “Noble ones, if that is so, then come. Let us go.”

original: drug sde dag 'dron pa don mthun de dang lhan cig bal yul du 'phags nas mthar gyis bal yul du phyin pa dang / nyi ma gang kho na la bal yul du phyin pa'i nyi ma de la mngon par mi dga' @276b bar gyur nas /🔽de dag nang par sngar langs te lam srang du dong ba dang / tshong pa dag gis drug sde dag mthong nas de dag gi rkang pa la phyag 'tshal te smras pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag 'dron pa don mthun de dang lhan cig bal yul du 'phags nas mthar gyis bal yul du phyin pa dang / nyi ma gang kho na la bal yul du phyin pa'i nyi ma de la mngon par mi dga' @276b bar gyur nas / de dag nang par sngar langs te lam srang du dong ba dang / tshong pa dag gis drug sde dag mthong nas de dag gi rkang pa la phyag 'tshal te smras pa /
translated: On the very day they arrived in Nepal, they became unhappy.

original: 'phags pa dag bal yul ji 'dra /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag bal yul ji 'dra /
translated: In the morning they got up and went to the streets, where merchants saw them and bowed down at their feet, saying, “Noble ones, what is Nepal like?

original: khyed cag mngon par mi dgyes par ma gyur tam /
analyzed: khyed cag mngon par mi dgyes par ma gyur tam /
translated: Have you not been happy there?”

original: bzhin bzangs dag nyi ma gang kho na la bal yul du phyin pa'i nyi ma de nyid la mngon par mi dga' bar gyur to //
analyzed: bzhin bzangs dag nyi ma gang kho na la bal yul du phyin pa'i nyi ma de nyid la mngon par mi dga' bar gyur to //
translated: “Good sirs, on the very day we arrived in Nepal, we became unhappy.”

original: 'phags pa dag bdag cag gis khyed la dang po kho na nas bal yul na ni rnga mo'i rgyab 'dra ba lags pas khyed cag der dgyes par mi 'gyur ro zhes ma bgyis sam /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag bdag cag gis khyed la dang po kho na nas bal yul na ni rnga mo'i rgyab 'dra ba lags pas khyed cag der dgyes par mi 'gyur ro zhes ma bgyis sam /
translated: “Noble ones, didn’t we tell you from the very beginning, ‘Nepal is like the back of a camel. You will not be happy there’?”

original: bzhin bzangs dag ji de lta na 'gro'am /
analyzed: bzhin bzangs dag ji de lta na 'gro'am /
